  • Manage and design the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
  • Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
  • Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
  • Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
  • Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
  • Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.


Benefits


Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.

Title: Senior Analyst, Investment Data Solutions - 1832 Asset Management
Description:
Requisition ID: 173768




Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.




High quality data is critical to the success of Scotia Global Asset Management (SGAM). Investment Data Solutions (IDS) is responsible for the implementation and on-going support of our Investment Data Hub (IDH) which is a strategic priority for the firm and built on the Enterprise Data Management (EDM) solution from S&P Global Market Intelligence. IDS will increase overall data quality across the firm and centralize the management of core investment data domains such a security reference, pricing, ratings, counterparties and benchmarks.




As Senior Analyst, Investment Data Solutions, you will be part of building and establishing a business-focused investment data management practice within SGAM and will participate in the design and implementation of key data quality controls within the IDH platform. You will also be working with business and technology partners across SGAM on new data and reporting initiatives and delivery of data quality enhancements.




Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:




Deliver and maintain accurate, complete, and timely investment data sets in the IDH by proactively identifying and correcting data quality issues and responding to data or reporting enquiries
Provide first-line support for relevant data enquires and ensure support requests are handled promptly and accurately
Work with technical support teams from Scotia Global Wealth Engingeering (GWE) and vendor to resolve production and data issues
Work with the IDS team to define and draft business rules and data quality controls and ensure that data quality controls are in line with best practice standards
Participate in engagement with key partners and stakeholders to understand investment data and reporting requirements and participate in design, planning, testing, and solutions delivery
Participate in Investment Data Solutions projects and other cross functional projects as assigned
Contribute to defining governance strategies and the creation of related standards, policies and procedures for Investment Data Solutions to support enterprise data frameworks and best practices
Participate in the implementation and testing of scheduled system releases




– We’d Love To Work With You If You Have




Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role.

Bachelor Degree, with a technology or business focus, or equivalent education and experience
High level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel and SQL queries
Previous experience with core investment data domains (eg positions, security reference, pricing and benchmarks)
Ability to develop positive and collaborative relationships with business partners and effectively communicate with both business and technology data stakeholders
Excellent organizational skills and a keen attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of Markit EDM, and/or Bloomberg is an asset

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: P2 - Data Modeller - 148719-1
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst looking for a new opportunity?

Are you looking for a new contract opportunity?

We are pleased to offer you four new contract opportunity for you to consider: Data Analyst

Start: ASAP

Estimated length: 3 months

Location: Toronto

Hybrid remote work

Actively seeking for candidates with below requirements

Advantages

You will have an opportunity to work with a leading employer in the local market.

Responsibilities

Work alongside a product owner(s), and be responsible for analyzing the digital behavior of clients and providing modeling and execution support to assist in personalizing experiences

Participate on a team where data, measurement, and analysis is integral to smart decision making and building awesome products and features

Provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to help drive optimization across products KPIs (i.e increased usage and sales recommendations)

Build critical understanding of customers and how they use products and be a strong internal voice for the power of analytics as a driver of business value

The delivery of business value in this role comes from a combination of knowledge transfer to key stakeholders and the provisioning of data services and tests to client facing applications (Public websites, Online Banking, Mobile apps)

Analyze large data sets and representing the behavior of digital product users to provide insights about user actions that help owners optimize on KPIs (i.e. conversions, attribution models, path analysis, cohort analysis, conversion analytics, etc.)

Consult with digital team leaders to understand goals and identify potential analytics projects or solutions to further the objectives of the Digital Product teams

Support Multivariate and A/B testing by exposing core insights from the data to suggest, create and execute multivariate or a/b/c tests that drive fundamental improvements to the site experience

Responsible for managing and developing business relationships with Digital product owners and key partners, including conducting regular monthly business review

Deliver clear, concise and timely analysis with team members and stakeholders identifying trends, issues and opportunities, performance analysis, dashboards, benchmarking, sales reports, customer profile/segmentation, etc.

Work closely with developers to modify digital content based on business rules and models

Qualifications

2-4 years experience in related digital product development or data mining role

BA/BSc or above in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field

Advanced knowledge of R, Python, SQL or SAS

Understanding of marketing analytics, data mining, experimentation and measurement

Knowledge of web and mobile development processes

Nice to Have:

Familiar with online tools such as Google Analytics Premium and Tableau

Knowledge of graph analytics (Neo4j, DataStax, Neptune)

Experience with the deployment of APIs and services for front-end personalization

Knowledge of graph analytics (Neo4j, DataStax, Neptune)

Ability to code in Scala

Knowledge of statistical modeling and forecasting

Summary

Do you have this experience? If you answer YES, then please apply IMMEDIATELY to so we can then discuss your experience and interest in this opportunity!

Title: Bus. Intelligence Specialist (PowerBI Dev.)
Description:
Description




As part of the modernization of Social Assistance (SA) reporting platform (Legacy Cognos system), conduct a review of existing data model(s), report model(s) and redesign reporting products to be scalable and flexible to meet current program and Ministry needs for analytical and operational reporting.




The SA program area has identified several data and reporting products to support their efforts to modernize service delivery and streamline partnerships with municipalities. As the SA program area continues to develop the operational model implementation and evaluation plans, BIPD needs to establish a modernized, flexible reporting model to support reporting products and requirements. This will result in development of net new data and reporting products, including products to support Service Planning, continuous monitoring of operational indicators and outcome data through the contract cycle. At the same time BIPD needs to address the development of products in the SA reporting backlog, and the rationalization of the current 160+ operational and analytical products in the reporting catalogue.




Purpose




To integrate, translate and oversee design of business-driven issues and priorities into enterprise-level business intelligence and data analytics solutions, using leading-edge data development approaches, with expertise/knowledge in data modelling, data architecture and infrastructure, data development (including dimensional modelling) as well as reporting (e.g. dashboard) development.




To project-manage (e.g. design, deliver and implement) complex I&IT projects and various agile, business solutions required to meet cross-ministry business intelligence and data analytics activities and priority projects, including leading and supporting enterprise-wide projects that may involve work with other ministries, jurisdictions and the broader public sector.




To work within the ministry's business analytics data warehouse environment, and support efforts to enhance and maintain infrastructure and applications, and providing technical expertise to the development and implementation of various I&IT solutions, while working with CYSSC, ITS and enterprise partners.




To lead data development and maintenance activities that support strategic initiatives and priority projects across the ministry, including the preparation of ad-hoc statistical information and developing research/analytical data for reporting and analytics, while ensuring appropriate data quality, integrity, privacy and security.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Remote – East Coast Canada




Why Confluence?




Over the past several years we have undergone a great deal of positive change and growth to become the company we are today. Our global footprint now spans multiple countries, giving our employees the opportunity to get exposure to other countries and cultures. And it stands to reason that none of this would have been possible without the hundreds of hard-working employees who work at Confluence.




What do we do?




As a leading global technology solutions provider to the investment management industry, Confluence helps clients solve complex investment data challenges across the front, middle and back office. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, Confluence services over 1000 clients in 40 countries, with locations across Europe, North America, South Africa, Australia and Asia.




More About The Role & Team




Due to several significant acquisitions since 2019, we are in the process of streamlining all processes and systems.




Working within our growing Transformation Technology Team this role will develop, maintain, support and integrated our internal data systems. The right candidate will develop and maintain data pipelines and models including ETL connections and in-warehouse translation tools for Business Analytics and Analysis.




This role is integral to the business, as it allows us to analyse and interpret key financial data as we grow and change.




You will be part of a small but impactful team in a growing and dynamic financial data company.




What skills and experience do I need to succeed?




You will have experience developing and maintaining Data Pipelines, including ETL connections and in-warehouse translation tools.




Cloud database/architecture experience is essential. Knime experience is highly desirable, but not essential.




You will have worked in a technical environment previously, with a leaning towards engineering business process. You will also ideally have an interest in, or aptitude for, Finance/Maths due to the type of data you will be engineering.




What do we offer?




Confluence offers generous benefit packages for team members. As a growing, global organization, we are always looking for ways to ensure that our employees can access benefits that matter to them and their families. This includes:




Generous time off packages
Global Career Development opportunities
Social Events
Referral Bonus scheme- $3,000 per successful referral
Plus many more!




More about the Location




We are looking to hire in the UK, Ireland, or east coast of Canada, where we have an employee base.




This is a remote position, however hybrid working will be available if you are based near one of our offices.




Values




We look for people who align with our 4 values.




Integrity




Face reality with honesty, courage and accountability




Imagination




Deal creatively with challenges and envision what the world could be




Discipline




Build good habits into reflexes which become a part of our life




Service




Committed to the success of others




If you would like to find out more about a Career at Confluence, please apply today.




We are committed to providing equal opportunities regardless of age, gender, religion or ethnic origin and we give full and fair consideration to the employment and career development of disabled persons, commensurate with their aptitudes and abilities.




To understand how and why we hold your data please view the relevant Privacy Statement:




Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Associate Director, Data Analytics and Insights , the Data Analyst is responsible for enforcing and upholding the importance of data policies and strategies to create suite of analytics solution to achieve organization’s strategic goals and objectives. The Data Analyst works with various stakeholders to identify analytical needs, and translate the requirements; develop, compile and present the analysis supported by data. In addition, other responsibilities will include process improvement initiatives, as well as, working with data stewards to ensure data quality, create and document data models, and collaborate with database developers to improve systems and database designs.

From coordinating with the data architecture team to transforming business problems to suitable cloud-based solutions, the Data Analyst will play a key role in all stages of the data management process, with focuses on development, implementation and maintenance. In order to succeed, the analyst must demonstrate both sound technical knowledge and outstanding soft skills.

Responsibilities

Assist Associate Director , Data Analytics and Insights in management and development of various analytics projects across multiple business functions and teams
Act as a primary source of expertise in the data structure and workflow of various supporting systems
Work directly with business users with variety of level of expertise and requirements to identify and translate the business case into technical requirements for development of full analytics solutions
Research and review large sets of data, using peer analysis with benchmarking and competitor analysis
Evaluate query designs, data structure, and data quality to provide recommendation for improvement as needed
Analyze problems and errors produced by business applications.
Develop targeted metrics and KPI’s for descriptive, and prescriptive analytics
Work with teams to provide input into test strategy, test scenarios, test data requirements and support user validation
Conduct insightful ad-hoc analysis to investigate ongoing, or one-time issues
Develop documentation of key processes, issues, and assist in creating data dictionary
Conduct analysis to validate system issues and work with IT to resolve those issues
Provide training and support cross functional teams
Complete all other duties as assigned

Qualifications

A bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field
4-6 years experience in a similar role preferred.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (Functions, formulas, charts, tables, and power query)
Demonstrated experience in Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate and creating suite of analytics dashboards
Experience in data modelling, and financial modelling preferred
Actively demonstrates confidentiality, tact and discretion in preparing, disclosing and handling information of a confidential and/or sensitive nature
Ability to work effectively both independently and as a member of a team
Experience with cloud technologies would be an asset. Specifically – Hana, SQL Server, Azure Data Factory, Stream Analytics
Experience with SAP ECC, BW and BODS suite of tools
Knowledge of big data infrastructures such as Hadoop or Snowflake will be an asset
Strong problem-solving skills, mathematical and data literacy
Strong organizational and project management skills with the ability to work independently and in a team environment, and mentor and train other members of the team
Creative, innovative, and critical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills
Show more Show less

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At TrackDDB, data is the driving force behind our creative solutions. Our team of talented professionals – from analysts and technologists to strategists and creatives – works together to exceed our clients’ business objectives through the perfect mix of data, strategy and creativity.




We are searching for a dedicated, team-oriented Data Marketing Analyst who is a strong, confident communicator and is adaptable to different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets. In this role, they will pair their digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. They will find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. They must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy.




What We Can Offer You




A friendly culture deeply rooted in mutual respect for everyone’s time and individual goals
Opportunity for professional growth, training and industry leadership in our category
DDB perks, including competitive benefits, referral bonuses and our unique FUEL program to help fund inspiration outside of working hours




We are currently working in a hybrid work arrangement.




Responsibilities




Work directly with clients, team members and senior leadership to develop analytics strategy
Improve profitability and drive revenue through creating effective KPIs and optimization of metrics that affect them
Guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of development
Lead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data mining
Ensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and training
Drive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark data
Interpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needs
Use advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environment
Facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offers
Creation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualization




Qualifications
Curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environment
Undergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline
1-3+ years analytical experience: strong presentation skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation
Deep knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communications
Experience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformation
Keen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadership
A strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-oriented
Experience with marketing attribution modeling
Demonstrated experience in requirements gathering and documentation for web analytics implementation including KPI development, tagging and report automation.
Intermediate level capabilities with SQL
Intermediate level capabilities with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics
Familiarity with R and/or Python
Demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projects
Bonus Points for:
Experience with Tableau
Proficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)

At TrackDDB, data is the driving force behind our creative solutions. Our team of talented professionals – from analysts and technologists to strategists and creatives – works together to exceed our clients’ business objectives through the perfect mix of data, strategy and creativity.


We are searching for a dedicated, team-oriented Data Marketing Analyst who is a strong, confident communicator and is adaptable to different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets. In this role, they will pair their digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. They will find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. They must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy.


What We Can Offer You


  • A friendly culture deeply rooted in mutual respect for everyone’s time and individual goals
  • Opportunity for professional growth, training and industry leadership in our category
  • DDB perks, including competitive benefits, referral bonuses and our unique FUEL program to help fund inspiration outside of working hours


We are currently working in a hybrid work arrangement.


Responsibilities


  • Work directly with clients, team members and senior leadership to develop analytics strategy
  • Improve profitability and drive revenue through creating effective KPIs and optimization of metrics that affect them
  • Guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of development
  • Lead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data mining
  • Ensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and training
  • Drive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark data
  • Interpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needs
  • Use advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environment
  • Facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offers
  • Creation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualization


Qualifications
  • Curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environment
  • Undergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline
  • 1-3+ years analytical experience: strong presentation skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation
  • Deep knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communications
  • Experience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformation
  • Keen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadership
  • A strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-oriented
  • Experience with marketing attribution modeling
  • Demonstrated experience in requirements gathering and documentation for web analytics implementation including KPI development, tagging and report automation.
  • Intermediate level capabilities with SQL
  • Intermediate level capabilities with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics
  • Familiarity with R and/or Python
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projects

    • Experience with Tableau
    • Proficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)

Title: Analyst, Aircraft Economics, Maintenance Data & Sales Support
Company: De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Limited
Description:
The Organization




De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.




Position Summary




We have an opening in our Customer Services Department for an Analyst, Aircraft Economics, Maintenance Data & Sales Support. The analyst will review and analyze technical queries related to all aspects of aircraft reliability and aircraft economics as well as compile detailed reports and presentations. The analyst will close such queries timely and with highest quality. The analyst will also aggressively support aircraft sales campaigns. The selected candidate will be reporting to the Chief, Maintenance Data Analysis, and Aircraft Economics.




Duties & Responsibilities




Review, prioritize, analyze, and respond to all assigned queries related to reliability, maintenance costs, aircraft economics and other analyses of various maintenance & operational data
Utilize/validate/enhance existing engineering analyses or conduct new analyses to develop a solution to the operator’s queries
Work closely with originators of queries (De Havilland – internal and external customers) to ensure all necessary data are obtained in order to meet customer’s expectations with regards to timeline and quality
Work independently and with Maintenance Programs and Planning Specialists to support them and align in all Maintenance Engineering queries, reports, projects, and assignments
Identify potential data validity/integrity issues and address data quality issues to improve technical reporting
Provide qualitative and timely reliability and cost data and analyses to key supporting functions in Customer Services and Support, Sales & Marketing, Procurement, Engineering and other De Havilland teams
Aggressively and timely support De Havilland’s Sales and Marketing teams in their campaigns
Work very closely with In-Service Engineering, Customer Support Account Managers, Field Service Representatives, In-Service Supplier Management, Marketing/Sales Service and Support, Engineering, Procurement, and other De Havilland teams
Participate in customer technical evaluations, customer meetings, conferences and working groups




Education And Professional Qualifications




University Degree in Engineering with at least 3 years’ experience in Industrial or Aerospace or College Diploma in Aviation Technology with at least 5 years’ experience in the Aerospace Industry




Experience:




Three to five years in Aerospace
Strong analytical abilities and experience using statistics to resolve engineering problems
Robust understanding of reliability and aircraft direct maintenance costs
Aircraft maintenance programs and planning concepts, methods and management are a definite asset
Good knowledge of aircraft systems
Familiarity with De Havilland aircraft Dash 8 Series 100, 200, 300 and 400 is a definite asset
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools and Oracle database is a valuable asset.
Thorough understanding of airline operations and independent maintenance organizations, intimate knowledge of their maintenance & engineering structure and functions is a valuable asset.




Skills




Advanced user knowledge of MS Office Suite (Excel, Access, MS Word, and PowerPoint)
Basic SQL Skills
Robust ability to manage tight deadlines and prioritize workload accordingly
Able to work independently or as part of a team
Able to conduct multidimensional queries of databases containing historical queries and solutions; able to validate/enhance/improve such solutions
Strong customer service skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills




At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation, and disability, are encouraged to apply.

Title: Data Analyst/ Senior Data Analyst (Statistics/Python/BI) (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Overview:




The Agoda Content department is currently looking for a curious and questioning self-starter and proactive analyst, who will help drive decision making with insights from content, marketing and partner performance data.




You will get the opportunity to own analytical projects to direct our department’s focus, and prioritize our actions. By joining Agoda, you will become part of a truly international team, with leading experts of different backgrounds coming from 50+ countries around the world. This is a genuine opportunity to gain valuable experience in a challenging and cutting-edge tech environment. The ideal candidate would have a passion for high-converting content, great user-experience, data and analysis tools and methods. This position reports to the Associate Director of Content Operations, in Bangkok, Thailand.




Main responsibilities:




Understand Content goals and KPIs and be able to align reports and insights based on them. Identify and investigate trends, anomalies and opportunities to improve Agoda’s Content strategy
Identify content opportunities that drive customer value, bookings and conversion
Help build business cases around the opportunity and get buy-in from stakeholders
Ensure appropriate data/tools/dashboards to measure execution and enable deeper analysis
Track execution and report up in regular updates
Work with product, data/BI team and IT to create data resources and build appropriate reporting
Work with Content team leads to understand their business needs and identify opportunities in terms of team actions prioritization and focus
Use multiple data sources to report Content projects insights and impact; support Content tests and experiments
Encourage and train the Content team in best practice use of Agoda data, analysis techniques and interpretation
Coordinate with other Cross Functional departments like Analytics, Partner Services, and Product Owners
Use Web-Analytics for Research and Analysis




Requirements:




Bachelor degree or higher
2+ years of relevant experience
Experience / knowledge in statistics, SQL, Python/R, Tableau and advanced Excel – required
Ability to demonstrate data manipulation using data warehouse and create meaningful insight and visualization
Experience / knowledge in Vertica and / or Impala – advantage
Experience in generating data and / or preparing experiments for product development – advantage




Professional characteristics:




Attentive to detail and committed to data integrity
Keen and curious nature; able and willing to share your opinion
Organized; able to manage multiple, competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines
Able to communicate effectively; fluent in English – both spoken and written

Title: Data Visualization Lead
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!




We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.




Data Visualization Lead




Remote




Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.




Please visit Fractal | Intelligence for Imagination for more information about Fractal




Position Overview




This role would be focused on our business intelligence and data engineering development, and would be responsible for defining and leading thought-leadership on client engagement, defining visualizations for data & crafting engineering requirements.




Who We Are Looking For




We are looking for a Lead Data Visualization expert to lead requirements refinement and engagement of one of our business intelligence development teams.
You will be an effective technologist, passionate about Power BI, and approaches all new development empathetic to the user experience. You will implement and support the ongoing effort to use visualization standards, tool assessment methodologies, and training approach across squads.
You are a mature consultant, able to understand diverse requirements and engage directly with clients, providing a senior touch in order guide them to the correct data visualizations and expressions of requirements for optimally solving their problems. You are able to guide a conversation seamlessly, and you always show up prepared to meetings with an agenda, guidance, and are a proactive communicator.




What You Will Work On




Development of sophisticated data visualizations that lead to improved client performance and accomplishment of strategic and/or operational goals.
Helping customer team express their OKRs and results in an effective way.
Own relationships with diverse business partners to understand current and future customer and business needs, elicit platform requirements, and define relevant strategic questions
Support and evolve standards for all cycles of visualization development including requirements gathering, iterative prototyping, development, code/asset management and versioning, documentation, and maintenance.
Actively evaluate and continuously improve the approach, toolset, and implementation of visual analytics and reporting
Partner across data engineering, data science, client teams (to understand subject matter of their business) and other functional teams to accelerate and use visualization strategies, data capabilities, and insights as part of the company’s integrated data offense
Evolve analytics capabilities and champion visualization and dashboarding standard methodologies for UI/UX development, data quality, deployment, and sustainable maintenance, including fast, iterative experimentation and measurement




What You Will Bring




Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Technology, Computer Science or other related fields or combination of relevant education, experience and training
10+ years of relevant experience developing dashboards, data visualizations, analytical reports, and self-service tools preferred
5+ years leading or mentoring teams developing analytic tools, visual analytics, sophisticated analytics, or related practices Expert level proficiency in SQL preferred
Experienced business understanding, with a passion for business reporting, analysis, and working with business intelligence tools and large amounts of data
In-depth experience in solving sophisticated problems through data and analytics, including providing insights that are logical, data driven, simple to understand and aligned to business goals
Experience working together with key stakeholders (product & portfolio managers, product or merchandising managers, executives, etc.) to design and build data visualizations to support business performance and goals
Ability to develop strong partnerships across a multi-layered, fast moving, results-driven organization
Relevant experience in user-centered design and capturing and communicating user needs and coaching developers to promote these methods
Experience in navigating sophisticated business relationships while ensuring products are designed for optimal user experience and have measurable criteria for success
Expertise with visual analysis technologies such as Power BI, Tableau, Domo, SAS, QlikView, JavaScript, or similar tools
Knowledge developing in cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure, Power BI, Tableau, Google Cloud, and AWS; MPP, Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Impala, Hive, MongoDB, HBase, or Cassandra are a plus.
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills – a visual and verbal storyteller who can guide and develop these skills across the team with a solid basis in business intelligence.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights effectively.
Proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and data analysis.
Expertise in creating and designing interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations.




Preferred Skills




Certification in Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization tool, with an emphasis
3+ years in the Retail / CPG industry
Expertise in data warehousing, dimensional modeling, and the ability to drive standard methodologies in data management and governance
Solid understanding of various database management systems like as well as proficiency in working with large data sets.




Pay




The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $96,000 - $149,000. In addition, for the current performance period, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus.




Benefits




As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a “free time” PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take time needed for either sick time or vacation.




Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.




If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!




Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

HTML:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!


We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.


Data Visualization Lead


Remote


Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.


Please visit Fractal | Intelligence for Imagination for more information about Fractal


Position Overview


This role would be focused on our business intelligence and data engineering development, and would be responsible for defining and leading thought-leadership on client engagement, defining visualizations for data & crafting engineering requirements.


Who We Are Looking For


  • We are looking for a Lead Data Visualization expert to lead requirements refinement and engagement of one of our business intelligence development teams.
  • You will be an effective technologist, passionate about Power BI, and approaches all new development empathetic to the user experience. You will implement and support the ongoing effort to use visualization standards, tool assessment methodologies, and training approach across squads.
  • You are a mature consultant, able to understand diverse requirements and engage directly with clients, providing a senior touch in order guide them to the correct data visualizations and expressions of requirements for optimally solving their problems. You are able to guide a conversation seamlessly, and you always show up prepared to meetings with an agenda, guidance, and are a proactive communicator.


What You Will Work On


  • Development of sophisticated data visualizations that lead to improved client performance and accomplishment of strategic and/or operational goals.
  • Helping customer team express their OKRs and results in an effective way.
  • Own relationships with diverse business partners to understand current and future customer and business needs, elicit platform requirements, and define relevant strategic questions
  • Support and evolve standards for all cycles of visualization development including requirements gathering, iterative prototyping, development, code/asset management and versioning, documentation, and maintenance.
  • Actively evaluate and continuously improve the approach, toolset, and implementation of visual analytics and reporting
  • Partner across data engineering, data science, client teams (to understand subject matter of their business) and other functional teams to accelerate and use visualization strategies, data capabilities, and insights as part of the company’s integrated data offense
  • Evolve analytics capabilities and champion visualization and dashboarding standard methodologies for UI/UX development, data quality, deployment, and sustainable maintenance, including fast, iterative experimentation and measurement


What You Will Bring


  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Technology, Computer Science or other related fields or combination of relevant education, experience and training
  • 10+ years of relevant experience developing dashboards, data visualizations, analytical reports, and self-service tools preferred
  • 5+ years leading or mentoring teams developing analytic tools, visual analytics, sophisticated analytics, or related practices Expert level proficiency in SQL preferred
  • Experienced business understanding, with a passion for business reporting, analysis, and working with business intelligence tools and large amounts of data
  • In-depth experience in solving sophisticated problems through data and analytics, including providing insights that are logical, data driven, simple to understand and aligned to business goals
  • Experience working together with key stakeholders (product & portfolio managers, product or merchandising managers, executives, etc.) to design and build data visualizations to support business performance and goals
  • Ability to develop strong partnerships across a multi-layered, fast moving, results-driven organization
  • Relevant experience in user-centered design and capturing and communicating user needs and coaching developers to promote these methods
  • Experience in navigating sophisticated business relationships while ensuring products are designed for optimal user experience and have measurable criteria for success
  • Expertise with visual analysis technologies such as Power BI, Tableau, Domo, SAS, QlikView, JavaScript, or similar tools
  • Knowledge developing in cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure, Power BI, Tableau, Google Cloud, and AWS; MPP, Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Impala, Hive, MongoDB, HBase, or Cassandra are a plus.
  • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills – a visual and verbal storyteller who can guide and develop these skills across the team with a solid basis in business intelligence.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights effectively.
  • Proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and data analysis.
  • Expertise in creating and designing interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations.


Preferred Skills


  • Certification in Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization tool, with an emphasis
  • 3+ years in the Retail / CPG industry
  • Expertise in data warehousing, dimensional modeling, and the ability to drive standard methodologies in data management and governance
  • Solid understanding of various database management systems like as well as proficiency in working with large data sets.


Pay


The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $96,000 - $149,000. In addition, for the current performance period, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus.


Benefits


As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a “free time” PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take time needed for either sick time or vacation.


Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!


Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

Title: Senior Analyst, Data and Technology / Analyste principal ou analyste principale, Données et technologie
Company: Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada
Description:
Senior Analyst, Data and Technology RE-05

Federal Organization: Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions

Official Language Proficiency: English Essential

Salary $92,600 to $119,300

Location: OSFI believes in offering employees flexibility and in creating a workplace that is productive, engaging, collaborative, and inclusive, all the while being supportive of employees’ wellbeing. As such, OSFI is experimenting with a hybrid work model (a combination of telework and onsite work) that will shape how we use our physical workplace to establish new norms, ways of collaborating, and working together and will adjust its model based on lessons learned.

 

This position is located in Toronto. However, the successful candidate may report to the Toronto or Ottawa office for in-office work.

 

Due to the nature of the work and operational requirements, this position requires physical presence (in-office work) from one of the following OSFI offices across Canada: Toronto or Ottawa. The option of teleworking is available on a part-time basis in accordance with OSFI’s Guidelines on Telework. Teleworking arrangements are determined on a case-by-case basis depending on the nature of the work required by the position, the operational and business needs, as well as the candidate’s work preferences.




The Senior Analyst (Data & Technology, Data Collection Modernization) will play an important role within the transformational Data Collection Modernization Team in the Risk & Data Analytics Division (RDA) at OSFI. This position will support the Manager in the effective and timely delivery of OSFI’s data collection transformation objectives to meet its (and Government of Canada peer agencies) information needs, with particular emphasis on the conceptualization, design and execution of data initiatives, process re-engineering, and technology implementation.




This role will require coordination and engagement with key stakeholders, including OSFI’s RDA (e.g., Data Governance, Data Management and Data Engineering Teams) and IM/IT Divisions (e.g. Enterprise Architects, Infrastructure & Technology Solutions, Application Services, etc.), other Government of Canada entities (i.e. Bank of Canada and CDIC) and the vendor stakeholders. This role will support overall project management, technical assessments/requirements, stakeholder engagement and assisting with the development of various supporting strategies, as appropriate (e.g., procurement, communication, and organizational change management).




***********************************************************************************************************************************

Analyste principal ou analyste principale, Données et technologie RE-05

Organisme fédéral Bureau du surintendant des institutions financières

Connaissance des langues officielles anglais essentiel

Un salaire 92 600 $ à 119 300 $

Lieu Le BSIF souhaite offrir de la flexibilité à son personnel et créer un milieu de travail productif, stimulant, collaboratif et inclusif, tout en favorisant le bien-être des employés. À ce titre, le BSIF expérimente un modèle de travail hybride (combinaison de télétravail et de travail au bureau) qui permettra de définir ses nouvelles normes sur l’utilisation des espaces de travail communs et d’établir de nouveaux modes de collaboration. Ce modèle sera ajusté à la lumière des leçons tirées.

 

Le bureau d’attache de la personne retenue est situé à Toronto, mais elle pourrait être autorisée à travailler du bureau de Toronto ou d’Ottawa.

 

En raison de la nature du travail et des exigences opérationnelles, ce poste exige une présence physique (travail au bureau) à partir de l’un des bureaux du BSIF suivants au Canada: Toronto ou Ottawa. L’option du télétravail à temps partiel est offerte conformément à la Ligne directrice sur le télétravail du BSIF. Les ententes de télétravail sont conclues au cas par cas en fonction de la nature du travail qu’exige le poste, des besoins opérationnels et organisationnels ainsi que des préférences de travail du candidat.




L’analyste principal(e) (Données et technologie, Modernisation de la collecte des données) jouera un rôle important au sein de l’équipe de transformation et de modernisation de la collecte des données créée au sein de la Division de l’analyse du risque et des données (DARD) du BSIF. Le titulaire de ce poste aidera le gestionnaire à réaliser efficacement et en temps voulu les objectifs de transformation de la collecte de données du BSIF afin de répondre à ses besoins d’information (et à ceux des organismes pairs du gouvernement du Canada), en mettant particulièrement l’accent sur la conceptualisation, la conception et l’exécution d’initiatives en matière de données, la réorganisation des processus et la mise en œuvre de la technologie.




Ce rôle nécessitera une coordination et des interactions avec les principales parties prenantes, y compris la DARD du BSIF (p. ex. ses équipes de gouvernance de données, de gestion des données et d’ingénierie des données), les équipes faisant partie de la Division de la gestion de l’information-technologie de l’information (p. ex. Architecture d’entreprise, Services d’infrastructure et de technologie, Services des applications), d’autres entités du gouvernement du Canada (p. ex. la Banque du Canada et la Société d’assurance-dépôts du Canada) et les représentants de fournisseurs. Le titulaire doit aussi contribuer aux activités générales de gestion de projets, d’analyse et d’établissement des exigences techniques et de mobilisation des parties prenantes, et participer à l’élaboration de diverses stratégies de soutien, s’il y a lieu (p. ex., approvisionnement, communications et gestion du changement organisationnel).

Si vous êtes intéressé à poser votre candidature pour ce poste, veuillez cliquer sur le lien pour prendre connaissance des qualités énumérées dans l’offre d’emploi et des renseignements supplémentaires.

Title: Technical Analyst
Description:
Our Banking client in Toronto, , Ontario is looking to hire a Technical Analyst for a 12-months contract role.




What You Will Do…




Analyze highly complex business requirements; generate technical specifications to design or redesign the application.
Act as an expert technical resource for modeling, simulation, and data analysis efforts
Leverage industry best practices to design, test, implement and support a solution.
Must be able to perform data analysis, data comparison, and data cleansing using tools.
Performing system analyses on software programs, applications, and services.
Determining system efficiency and functionality by liaising with internal business partners.
Be flexible and thrive in an evolving environment.
Adapt to change quickly and adjust work accordingly in a positive manner.




Must Have Skills




What you will need to succeed…




1+ years’ experience as a Data/Systems Analyst
1+ years expert experience with MS Excel – has to know macros.
1+ years’ demonstrated experience building large reports.
1+ years hands-on experience in SDLC/ Agile environment.




Nice-To-Have Skills




Analyst background from FI/banking an asset.




Applying with Raise




Raise is an established IT and engineering hiring firm with over 60 years’ experience connecting talented candidates with meaningful work. When you apply, you’ll get more than just a chance at a great job—you’ll become part of a vast network of employers that are always changing.




We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at +1 800-567-9675 or hello@raiserecruiting.com

Title: Bioinformatics Scientist: Methylation Data Analysis
Description:
We are focused on developing a disruptive Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) platform along with a portfolio of reagents, assays and informatics solutions for multiple disease areas. We are looking for a Bioinformatics Scientist to support assay development efforts.




In this role, you will collaborate closely with molecular biologists and bioinformatics scientists and apply your strong knowledge in processing and analyzing next generation sequencing technologies. You will maintain, improve and develop internal algorithms, tools and pipelines for oncology applications (such as variant calling) as well as analyzing biological data for assay development




Responsibilities

• Provide hands-on bioinformatics data analyses and troubleshooting of bioinformatics pipelines

• Implement innovative algorithms for minimal residual disease and cancer early detection

• Collaborate with wet-lab scientists and bioinformaticians to develop new assay methodologies

• Work with external collaborators and provide bioinformatics support for them

• Present and communicate team activities/project results across multiple functions in the organization







Required Skills:

● Documented experience with sequencing/genomic data analysis (NGS), especially in the area of high-throughput sequence analysis

● Proficient in general bioinformatics tools including tools for sequence alignment, variant analysis, and database queries

● Proficient in Python and R

● Proficient working in a Linux HPC environment

● Hands-on experience in workflow management system (e.g. Nextflow, Snakemake)

● Working understanding of biological concepts and experimental methods commonly used in molecular biology and interest to learn more

● Excellent communication, advanced English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills; Responsible and reliable, goal and task oriented.




Preferred Skills:

● Strong statistical background

● Experience with version control and familiarity with issue tracking systems (i.e .JIRA).

● Familiarity with database languages such as SQL

● Experience with container-based virtualization (i.e. Docker)

● Familiarity with R Shiny App development

● Experience with immune repertoires data analysis




Note from HM: HM wants candidate to have PhD, experience with NGS. Understanding of methylation data

Title: P1- Data Analyst- WECJP00025630
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst looking for a new opportunity?

Are you looking for a new contract opportunity?

We are pleased to offer you a new contract opportunity for you to consider:

Data Analyst

Start: ASAP
Estimated length: 10 Months
Location: Mississauga
Hybrid role - 2-3 days onsite


Actively seeking for candidates with below requirements.

Advantages

You will have an opportunity to work with a leading employer in the local market.

Responsibilities

Lead data analytics process with the product team to gather insights and identify


solutions

Collect, organize, analyze, and present insights through visualization reports.
Enable data-driven insights to be translated into decisions and actions by telling a


convincing story.

Establish practices around data objects, data quality rules for better collection,


documentation, and storage of data.

Participate in defining new features based on data insights across project initiatives.
Develop a data dictionary, simple queries and maintain them; produce various reports


using appropriate tools.

Prepare visual presentations to effectively engage all necessary stakeholders to support


success and obtain results.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field. MS/PhD would be a


strong asset.

4-6 years of experience as a data analyst
Experience with Data Design, Dimensional Modelling, Teradata, MS SQL, HiveQL,


Hadoop HDFS, Confluence, Jira.

Strong understanding of data design techniques and principles
Strong leadership and communication skills
Must be able to work effectively both on teams as well as be self-motivated, task


oriented and organized.

Strong customer focus and obsession with quality
Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment
Ability to gather & document details / requirements /user stories from stakeholders for a


data request

Coordinate data conversations with stakeholders, data sources
Able to identify source systems and data steward
Process a security review in order to gain access, pull, and transmit data
Able to write and run SQL queries from Data Lake, Big Query, and Vendor Master as


Required

Validate query results to ensure it meets criteria/requirements
Stakeholder management
Experienced in JIRA , scrum ceremonies, and Agile Methodology
Retail/ Store Operations experience is a MUST HAVE
Creating dashboards in XLSX, Tableau or Power BI, SQL
Strong communication and story telling of data


Summary

Do you have this experience? If you answer YES, then please apply IMMEDIATELY to so we can then

discuss your experience and interest in this opportunity!

Randstad Technologies Group

Canada's largest provider of IT Staffing Solutions, offering hundreds of permanent and contract

opportunities across all roles, levels and platforms. Our Web-based tools help you see and apply for jobs

matched automatically to your skills and preferences. When you're ready to interview we meet with you in

person to help you build the technology career path you've always wanted. Visit www.randstad.ca to get

started!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

  • Must be able to work effectively both on teams as well as be self-motivated, task

oriented and organized.
  • Strong customer focus and obsession with quality
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment
  • Ability to gather & document details / requirements /user stories from stakeholders for a

data request
  • Coordinate data conversations with stakeholders, data sources
  • Able to identify source systems and data steward
  • Process a security review in order to gain access, pull, and transmit data
  • Able to write and run SQL queries from Data Lake, Big Query, and Vendor Master as

Required
  • Validate query results to ensure it meets criteria/requirements
  • Stakeholder management
  • Experienced in JIRA , scrum ceremonies, and Agile Methodology
  • Retail/ Store Operations experience is a MUST HAVE
  • Creating dashboards in XLSX, Tableau or Power BI, SQL
  • Strong communication and story telling of data

Summary

Do you have this experience? If you answer YES, then please apply IMMEDIATELY to so we can then

discuss your experience and interest in this opportunity!

Randstad Technologies Group

Canada's largest provider of IT Staffing Solutions, offering hundreds of permanent and contract

opportunities across all roles, levels and platforms. Our Web-based tools help you see and apply for jobs

matched automatically to your skills and preferences. When you're ready to interview we meet with you in

person to help you build the technology career path you've always wanted. Visit www.randstad.ca to get

started!

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Dimensional Strategies Inc. (DSI)




Founded in 1998, Dimensional Strategies Inc. (DSI) is a Mississauga based consulting firm. Many years ago, DSI decided to specialize in Microsoft based tools and as a result have grown from a small 8-person shop to become a leader in Microsoft consulting services.




Gold Data Analytics
Gold Cloud Platform
Gold Data Platform
Gold Application Development




Being a Microsoft Partner means we design, deploy, deliver and support custom quality solutions using Microsoft technologies. We are a leader in Data Analytics, supported by initiatives like Dashboard in a Day (PowerBI), a joint offering between DSI and Microsoft Canada, as well as some of the earliest engagements in cloud based azure projects with some of Canada’s leading organizations. We love what we do and are fortunate enough to help our clients make better, more timely decisions by improving their information access capabilities and enabling key processes.




Dimensional Strategies Inc. (DSI) is currently looking to expand its rapidly growing Data Analytics visualization and reporting team. We Specialize in the development of solutions based on the Microsoft Data Platform. DSI is looking to add a number of select senior resources to the team.




At DSI we value aptitude, work ethic, and a desire to learn amongst a team that believes collaboration is key. If this sounds like a place you might like to work and you feel that your experience matches the requirements below, we encourage you to contact us.




Responsibilities:




There is a heavy client facing aspect to this role. As a Power BI consultant for DSI you will have the opportunity to deliver our Dashboard in a Day (DIAD) events for DSI and Microsoft customers, clients, and / or employees. You will also be a part of project based consulting engagements with leading organizations across North America.
You have experience leading training events in the past, or mentored team members on Power BI
You are a Power BI evangelist, with a passion for demonstrating the effectiveness of the Power BI tool
Ability to translate business requirements into technical requirements and architect a business-centric technical architecture
Reviews and reports on project metrics to benchmark effectiveness
Works closely with database administrators and developers to ensure that business models are accurately implemented in application systems
Provides education on the naming and modeling standards; assists with modeling specific constructs
Reviews project models to ensure adherence to standards
Ensures data quality alignment




The following knowledge or skills are considered as necessary for this role:




Bachelors in Computer Science with 6+ years of related experience
5+ years of Data Management Experience
Understands database architectures, and data warehousing concepts
Experience with instructor led training, web based training sessions, and consulting, and reporting templates.
Ability to analyze data, and familiarity with data modeling, analysis and visualization tools
2 - 3 years of DAX expressions experience
Data modeling experience a must. If you can't create your own data models you are not a fit
Tabular model experience
star and snowflake schema design experience
Technical accomplishments in SQL, ETL, and data blending tools
Problem Solving Skills
Excellent communication and comprehension skills
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure Data Platform (SQL DB, Blob, Data Factory, Automation, etc.) an asset.
Understand the benefits of data warehousing, data architecture, data quality processes, data warehousing design and implementation, table structure, fact and dimension tables, logical and physical database design, data modeling, reporting process metadata, and ETL processes
Utilize strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to share application expertise, communicate complex business problems, and facilitate discussion with stakeholders.







Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: BI Analyst - Hybrid
Description:
The Analyst, BI will be a valuable member in contributing to our client's future. Supporting the BI Lead, this individual will be responsible for implementation of new

customer projects, change requests and managing day to day support of the business inquiries and BI environment. They will participate as part of a team in

design and implementation of standardized reporting & analytics processes to support current and future reporting needs of business. Lastly, as a member of our

core team, the right person for the role will be a leading example of our culture.

Advantages

Who you are:

 You have the courage to think differently about how things get done to continuously improve and deliver even better results every day.

 The safety, health, and well-being of yourself and your team, is your first priority.

 Providing exceptional service is your passion.

 You uphold your commitments and make decisions with everyone in mind.

 You are energized by collaborating in a team environment, and enjoy supporting others to find success.

 You embrace new things, are open to different perspectives, and adapt quickly to an evolving environment.

 Strives to go above and beyond the call of duty.

Responsibilities

What success looks like:

 Your business partners are excited to collaborate with you! You support one another as a team and work together, leveraging everyone’s strengths.

 You are depended on to see your commitments through and with good intentions.

 The duties and tasks supported by your role continuously improve with increased quality and fast speed to market.

 You work with various stakeholders to proactively elicit and analyze business requirements for Business Intelligence (BI) solutions and user/operational reports

 You actively seek out opportunities to add business value through reporting and analytics

 You participate in the conceptual design of BI report development/dashboard & visualization solutions that meet business objectives in compliance with best

practices

 You respond to analytical requests with solution design from the bottom up, addressing: data modeling, analytical structure, security and BI visualization

 You design, development & support of reporting solutions using the SAP BW, SAP BusinessObjects (Crystal, Webi) & Qlik Sense

 You design BI/BW data models, data store objects, and information stores to sustain current and future needs

 You design/develop custom data sources based on business requirements in SAP or non-SAP systems or enhance standard SAP data sources

 You prepare project/initiative related documentation (solution designs, business rules, technical information, test plans/scripts & etc.)

 You provide support and maintenance of the existing BW, BusinessObjects & Qlik Sense environments including data loads, security and etc.

 You provide customer support, training, investigation & troubleshooting of inquiries/tickets

 You assist in setting up Enterprise standards and best practices

 You Ensue optimal system performance & data integrity

Qualifications

What you bring to the role:

 A Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or related field

 8 + years of experience modeling/implementation of SAP BW data warehousing solutions and reporting with SAP BEx, SAP Business Objects and their best

practices

 Experience in configuration & enhancement of standard SAP ECC data sources.

 Knowledge in SAP functional areas such as SD, MM, WM, FI, HR

 Proven experience in development/configuration of custom ETL processes using SAP BW for SAP and non-SAP data sources

 Experience in ABAP programing in relation to SAP BW

 Experience with the core components of the Business Objects reporting tool suite, 4.x or higher ( Web Intelligence, Crystal Reports, Dashboards and building

Universes)

 Experience in performance tuning of SAP BW objects & Processes

 Experience in information broadcasting, dynamic recipients and etc.

 Working knowledge of SAP Portal and BI launch pad configuration & administration

 Working experience in BW authorization and authorization concepts in BusinessObjects Enterprise

 Experience with data visualization tools including Qlik view/Qlik Sense and Visualization methodologies & best practices

 Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills

 Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced team environment

 When making decisions, you consider everyone and engage those who can add value to the process.

 Manage time and priorities effectively in a fast-paced, flexible environment to deliver incremental value every day.

 You are adaptable in your approach and prioritize with focus on what adds value to the client.

Summary

If you feel you are the right fit for this role please email me your word resume to aaron.lail@randstad.ca
