Title: Data Analyst - 100% Remote
Description:
About You




To be successful in this role you are an awesome Data Analyst you have a sharp eye for detail, a knack for numbers, and a passion for finding patterns in complex data sets




But that's not all. You are also a data wizard who is forever learning & you stay on top of the latest trends in data analysis and visualisation. Your expertise allows you to present complex data in a way that's both informative and engaging to your stakeholders




Whether you are crunching numbers, building models, or create data visualisations that pop you do it with finesse and simplicity. This opportunity offers excellent career progression within the business as you are a key contributor to the Data team which cross functionally supports all other departments in the business.




About The Role




We are currently seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Data Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for analysing a wide range of data for Europe’s largest online marketplace for classic cars, identifying trends, providing insights, and optimising our processes for auctions and classified listings.




You will work closely with our team making data driven recommendations for improvements to our platform to senior stakeholders based on your findings. The successful candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, experience with SQL and visualisation tools, and excellent problem-solving skills.




If you are passionate about data and looking for an exciting opportunity to apply your skills in a dynamic and fast-paced scale-up, we encourage you to apply for this position.




About Us Www.carandclassic.com




Car & Classic is one of the largest automotive marketplaces in the world. We’re lucky to have thousands of user-generated listings submitted monthly with content gems from James Bond’s Aston DB5 to Elvis Presley’s Cadillac. The site is old, launched in 2005 but under new, VC-backed ownership since 2018 and on an exciting triple-digit growth journey to bring classic vehicle transactions online.




Our culture is incredibly important to us. We’re lucky enough to have built the team from scratch with a focus on enjoying the day-to-day, diversity, inclusion and high performance. Despite being an entirely distributed business, we build strong connections as colleagues and have created a fun and high-performing culture




We’re looking for a Data Analyst that has good, relevant experience and wants to make their mark in a rapid growth business where they can make a real difference, whilst enjoying the environment and culture




Finally, you don’t have to love cars to work here (and lots of our team don’t) but for those who do this is an incredible opportunity to combine your passion and professional lives – we look forward to hearing from you.




Role And Responsibilities




Conducting deep dive analysis into listing performance (both auctions and our non-auction products).
Investigating conversion rates through our platform using event-level data from GA4.
Creating new data products and dashboards in a variety of tools (Metabase, Streamlit, Count).
Making recommendations for improvements to senior stakeholders based on your findings.
Working with the rest of the data team to make improvements to our data collection and modelling processes.
Identifying, communicating and improving weaknesses in our current reporting infrastructure.
Thoroughly documenting your work and contributing to the data team’s suite of documentation.




The skills, attributes and experience you must have:




SQL - have a high level of proficiency in SQL, including the use of window functions, CTEs, and the ability to work with semi-structured data.
dbt - have a working knowledge of core dbt concepts.
Python|R - A good understanding of core concepts and the ability to write scripts to perform analytical tasks using standard Python|R libraries such as pandas, numpy,sklearn OR Rshiny, dplyr, ggplot2, is required. Familiarity with
BI / Visualisation tools - strong experience in using one, or more, BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Comfortable working with relatively large datasets.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to turn a business problem into structured data analysis.
Ability to create informative data visualisations and a good understanding of the fundamentals of data visualisation design.
Demonstrates creativity in identifying and solving problems, and in presenting data and insights in a compelling and innovative way.
Ability to prioritise working on multiple projects at any one time.
This role requires the ability to act as a trusted advisor to a range of stakeholders, up to board level.




Skills, attributes and experience it would be nice for you to have:




Version Control: Experience Using Git as Part of an Analytics Workflow
A background in statistics or a numerate discipline at an academic level is preferred.
Experience creating data applications using Streamlit|Rshiny|Dash would be a plus.
Interest and enthusiasm for classic vehicles.




What do you get (remuneration & benefits)?




Base salary between £30,000 - £35,000 GBP💰
Stock options 📈
All the equipment you need to get the job done 💻
Flexible working - work where and when you want in order to get the job done 🌍
Access to free counselling, therapy and mental health support via Spill 🤗
Professional development allowance 🚄
Income Protection 🛡
Life Cover 👩‍👧‍👦
Smart Health 🩺
Generous parental leave 👶
33 days holiday (including bank holidays) 🏝
Ability to make your mark on a fast-growing start-up 🚀




Our application process




We want to make sure we hire the best available talent! We had a fantastic 2022 with all our hires hitting the ground running. We are excited to do the same in 2023.




Every role is crucial to us at this stage of our growth. We are continuously improving and evolving our recruitment and application process. Once you decide to apply you’ll be presented with a series of questions. The answers to the questions are the difference between your application being progressed or not. Please do give them your time and effort when answering.




Good luck with your application and thank you in advance for your interest in joining us at Car & Classic.




Car & Classic Limited is an equal opportunity employer




Equality, diversity and inclusion are integral parts of our culture. We recognise and celebrate the value and impact diversity brings to our company and are committed to ensuring this is a consistent focus, for which we hold ourselves responsible.




We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and equally and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role.
Show more Show less
HTML:
About You


To be successful in this role you are an awesome Data Analyst you have a sharp eye for detail, a knack for numbers, and a passion for finding patterns in complex data sets


But that's not all. You are also a data wizard who is forever learning & you stay on top of the latest trends in data analysis and visualisation. Your expertise allows you to present complex data in a way that's both informative and engaging to your stakeholders


Whether you are crunching numbers, building models, or create data visualisations that pop you do it with finesse and simplicity. This opportunity offers excellent career progression within the business as you are a key contributor to the Data team which cross functionally supports all other departments in the business.


About The Role


We are currently seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Data Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for analysing a wide range of data for Europe’s largest online marketplace for classic cars, identifying trends, providing insights, and optimising our processes for auctions and classified listings.


You will work closely with our team making data driven recommendations for improvements to our platform to senior stakeholders based on your findings. The successful candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, experience with SQL and visualisation tools, and excellent problem-solving skills.


If you are passionate about data and looking for an exciting opportunity to apply your skills in a dynamic and fast-paced scale-up, we encourage you to apply for this position.


About Us Www.carandclassic.com


Car & Classic is one of the largest automotive marketplaces in the world. We’re lucky to have thousands of user-generated listings submitted monthly with content gems from James Bond’s Aston DB5 to Elvis Presley’s Cadillac. The site is old, launched in 2005 but under new, VC-backed ownership since 2018 and on an exciting triple-digit growth journey to bring classic vehicle transactions online.


Our culture is incredibly important to us. We’re lucky enough to have built the team from scratch with a focus on enjoying the day-to-day, diversity, inclusion and high performance. Despite being an entirely distributed business, we build strong connections as colleagues and have created a fun and high-performing culture


We’re looking for a Data Analyst that has good, relevant experience and wants to make their mark in a rapid growth business where they can make a real difference, whilst enjoying the environment and culture


Finally, you don’t have to love cars to work here (and lots of our team don’t) but for those who do this is an incredible opportunity to combine your passion and professional lives – we look forward to hearing from you.


Role And Responsibilities


  • Conducting deep dive analysis into listing performance (both auctions and our non-auction products).
  • Investigating conversion rates through our platform using event-level data from GA4.
  • Creating new data products and dashboards in a variety of tools (Metabase, Streamlit, Count).
  • Making recommendations for improvements to senior stakeholders based on your findings.
  • Working with the rest of the data team to make improvements to our data collection and modelling processes.
  • Identifying, communicating and improving weaknesses in our current reporting infrastructure.
  • Thoroughly documenting your work and contributing to the data team’s suite of documentation.


The skills, attributes and experience you must have:


  • SQL - have a high level of proficiency in SQL, including the use of window functions, CTEs, and the ability to work with semi-structured data.
  • dbt - have a working knowledge of core dbt concepts.
  • Python|R - A good understanding of core concepts and the ability to write scripts to perform analytical tasks using standard Python|R libraries such as pandas, numpy,sklearn OR Rshiny, dplyr, ggplot2, is required. Familiarity with
  • BI / Visualisation tools - strong experience in using one, or more, BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
  • Comfortable working with relatively large datasets.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to turn a business problem into structured data analysis.
  • Ability to create informative data visualisations and a good understanding of the fundamentals of data visualisation design.
  • Demonstrates creativity in identifying and solving problems, and in presenting data and insights in a compelling and innovative way.
  • Ability to prioritise working on multiple projects at any one time.
  • This role requires the ability to act as a trusted advisor to a range of stakeholders, up to board level.


Skills, attributes and experience it would be nice for you to have:


  • Version Control: Experience Using Git as Part of an Analytics Workflow
  • A background in statistics or a numerate discipline at an academic level is preferred.
  • Experience creating data applications using Streamlit|Rshiny|Dash would be a plus.
  • Interest and enthusiasm for classic vehicles.


What do you get (remuneration & benefits)?


  • Base salary between £30,000 - £35,000 GBP💰
  • Stock options 📈
  • All the equipment you need to get the job done 💻
  • Flexible working - work where and when you want in order to get the job done 🌍
  • Access to free counselling, therapy and mental health support via Spill 🤗
  • Professional development allowance 🚄
  • Income Protection 🛡
  • Life Cover 👩‍👧‍👦
  • Smart Health 🩺
  • Generous parental leave 👶
  • 33 days holiday (including bank holidays) 🏝
  • Ability to make your mark on a fast-growing start-up 🚀


Our application process


We want to make sure we hire the best available talent! We had a fantastic 2022 with all our hires hitting the ground running. We are excited to do the same in 2023.


Every role is crucial to us at this stage of our growth. We are continuously improving and evolving our recruitment and application process. Once you decide to apply you’ll be presented with a series of questions. The answers to the questions are the difference between your application being progressed or not. Please do give them your time and effort when answering.


Good luck with your application and thank you in advance for your interest in joining us at Car & Classic.


Car & Classic Limited is an equal opportunity employer


Equality, diversity and inclusion are integral parts of our culture. We recognise and celebrate the value and impact diversity brings to our company and are committed to ensuring this is a consistent focus, for which we hold ourselves responsible.


We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and equally and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wilkinson Partners are very pleased to have partnered with a leading specialist Investment and Lending business who specialise in both commercial and residential property. The firm are actively looking to make a strategic hire for a Data Analyst to join their platform and report directly into the firm's CFO and Technology Director.




This hire forms part of their impressive growth plans as they look to build on their current success and continue building out their data capabilities. A compelling opportunity for a Data professional who is looking to join an entrepreneurial business and add real value in their next role.




Key experience required:




2-3 years experience as a Data professional
Proficient in SQL and PowerBI - other technologies are advantageous and will be considered
Excellent data visualisation skills, be able to tell a story with the data insights
Strong understanding of Finance, being numerically minded with an investigative mindset
Executive presence - confidence in working with senior stakeholders across each aspect of the business




For an informal chat to discuss how this role could be the next step for your career, please either apply or reach out directly to Tom Jackson on the details below:




tomjackson@wilkinsonpartners.com

020 3687 0432

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Centrepoint, the UK’s leading youth homelessness charity, is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data, Insight and Performance team in London which supports the organisation by analysing data, creating dashboards, managing KPIs and responding to data requests.




This is a permanent, full-time (37.5 hours per week) contract opportunity with a closing date of Monday 27th March.




We help vulnerable young people by giving them the practical and emotional support they need to find a job and live independently. Centrepoint provides homeless young people with accommodation, health support and life skills in order to get them back into education, training and employment. We want to end youth homelessness by 2037.




Together with our partners, we support over 14,000 young people each year.




About You




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Degree level qualification or equivalent experience.
Proficiency in data analysis and business intelligence tools such as Power BI.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Committed to self-development by engaging with training and continuous learning.
Proactive, always looking for opportunities to generate insight for the organisation




What You’ll Be Doing




Developing Power BI dashboards, to communicate meaningful insights, with impactful visualisation.
Analysing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can help inform business decisions.
Responding promptly to data request from support our services, business development, fundraising, policy and communications teams to evidence Centrepoint’s value and support new bids and campaigns.
Conveying technical information in a way that is accessible to a wider audience.
Collaborating with stakeholders to identify business problems and develop solutions.
Providing recommendations to management based on data analysis and interpretation.
Monitoring data quality and ensuring data integrity across multiple systems and sources.
Staying up-to-date with emerging trends in data analysis, statistics, and technology.
Automating manual tasks to improve efficiency.




Why join Centrepoint?




In return for your efforts you’ll receive a competitive salary, excellent training and development, and a host of staff benefits including:




25 days of annual leave per year, rising by one day per year to a maximum of 27 days
Healthcare cash plan
Private Medical insurance
Income protection
Employer pension contributions of 5%
Clear career progressions, linked to portfolio work, that enables movement up the pay scale
Access to Cycle 2 Work loan scheme
An interest-free travel loan




At Centrepoint we challenge the discrimination within society that contributes to youth homelessness, and we are just as committed to fairness and equality within Centrepoint itself. We are passionate about ensuring all of our colleagues are made to feel included in the work we do and that we value the rich diversity within the organization.




We are an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications regardless of sex, gender, race, age, belief in any religion and none, gender identity, ethnic origin, class, sexuality, nationality, appearance, unrelated criminal activities, disability, responsibility for dependents, part time or shift workers, being HIV positive or living with AIDS, lived experience of homelessness or using young people’s services and any other matter which causes a person to be treated with injustice.




Centrepoint’s policy is to recruit, employ and promote people on the basis of their suitability for the work to be performed, and to this end, our aim is to ensure that all applicants, employees and volunteers receive equal treatment.




Don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity to join our team as a Data Analyst click ‘Apply’ now!
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hi, we’re token.com. Our goal is to create a world where money can flow effortlessly into the things people truly care about. token.com is the fun, simple and social platform to discover and invest in the game-changing ventures of tomorrow. At token.com we recognise the positive value of diversity, we promote equality and challenge discrimination. We actively encourage job applications from people of all backgrounds.

We’re a high-performance team of around 50 people. We have freedom and responsibility, a culture that encourages innovation, offers ownership and embraces knowledge sharing. We are now working as a team first, remote friendly company, arranging monthly get-togethers and regular team retreats. We also have a co-working space in London for collaboration and socialising.

This is a data driven role, the expectation is to perform analysis, produce dashboards, present findings, model data and fundamentally keep learning and iterate on the learnings gained and help the product evolve based on this learning.

Reporting to a Product Manager, this role will be fundamental to the Build-Measure-Learn paradigm we are employing here at token.com as part of our product development strategy. We cannot learn something without measurement, we cannot measure something without building, fundamentally we must learn and iterate based on learnings.

Requirements

A few of the responsibilities for this position include:

Partner with stakeholders (e.g., Product, Growth, Engineering, Finance) to build and help improve acquisition, engagement, and retention
Conduct rigorous exploratory data analysis, create executive-facing automated dashboards and collaborate on building business cases that drive decision-making and product roadmap prioritisation
Synthesise large volumes of data with attention to granular details and present insights and recommendations to stakeholders
Own product metrics (build, evaluate and maintain product dashboards)
Data driven development: analyse metrics, identify pain points in the customer journey, propose new solutions (supported with relevant data discoveries)
Data mapping between systems
Document the current process
Product thinking, always thinking about the customer and how we can use data to learn more about the customer


Requirements

Previous experience working with datasets (SQL, BigQuery)
Previous experience working with mobile app analytics
Experience producing dashboards and presenting to teams across the company
Experience analysing large, multi-dimensional data sets and synthesising insights into actionable solutions
Previous experience performing ad hoc analysis on product/business problems and presenting the findings


Attributes

We’re looking for candidates who are:

Always asking why, wanting to understand why customers are doing something or not doing something and never shy to go into the data and try and discover the answer to the why
Allowing the data to speak for itself, bring the data and present it in such a manner that people understand what is needed
Want to create a data-driven culture and support teams with implementing a data strategy.


Benefits

What we offer you!

Our team members are rewarded well! UK employees are offered the below, and we will aim for similar elsewhere:

Private health insurance with all the fun extras (with options for your family to!)
A training & development budget that helps you to grow with token.com
25 days holiday plus local public holidays
Flexible working hours (we care about your output, not when you rock up or clock out)
Excellent paid maternity and paternity leave
Working from home budget
Top of the range hardware
Cycle Scheme
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent Job Alert:

Title: Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Salary: £50,000 + Benefits

Industry: Retail/eCommerce

Contact: james.gershfield@forsythbarnes.com




Brief Overview:




A fantastic opportunity has been made available for a Data Analyst to join a leading retail/eCommerce business in London. It is the perfect time to join the business during a period of growth, and take ownership of the data function in a strategic position.




Reporting into the Head of Data, this role will support the wide eCommerce team to deliver accurate reporting and actionable insights across numerous areas within the business. This will include eCommerce sales, retail sales as well as customer behavioral data and performance marketing.




JOB Requirements:







Experience with data visualisation tools - Power BI & Mode
Experience with ETL in an eCommerce environment
Good knowledge of Shopify, Google Analytics, Meta, ERP etc...
Solid history of working in a data analyst role previously for a minimum of 2 years.




If you're interested, please apply by emailing a copy of your most up to date CV and your current availability.




Please feel free to pass this on to anyone you think it may suit/ anyone you know may be interested.




Apologies if this is not wholly relevant, or at the desired level. Please feel free to view all of our jobs at www.forsythbarnes.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
How does working for an established energy services provider for over 40 years sound? Due to continued growth, it is the perfect time for a Junior Data Analyst to be joining and beginning or taking further steps in your career development with them. They offer a fantastic working environment as well as an incredibly exciting and diverse range of projects to work on.

My client helps organisations manage their energy better and are well-respected within their division.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for maintaining and maximising operational efficiency of data collection services and to ensure all team key performance targets are met.

Interested? Lets find out more

Junior Data Analyst Responsibilities

Junior Data Analyst to actively support the collection of accurate data within critical timelines
Participate in data collection & associated activities, with the enthusiasm and drive necessary to ensure data is delivered in accordance with the teams published service levels
Proactively liaise with internal and external parties
Apply an investigative and enquiring approach
Input data from contracts into the internal CRM system
Identify ways of optimising processes within CRM to make them more efficient

Junior Data Analyst Skills

Consistently professional, confident and calm even in challenging situations
Be a supportive and helpful team player with a flexible and positive attitude
Strive to meet objectives and improve performance
Articulate, professional and clear verbal communication skills
Good listener; can understand the needs of customers and colleagues
Junior Data Analyst with strong problem-solving and analytical abilities
Intermediate knowledge of Excel, Word and Outlook
Confident and accurate use of departmental computer systems/databases
Keep up to date with advances in technology, new methods and ways of working.

Company Benefits

Pension scheme after 3 months - matching up to 8% of employee contribution
Simplyhealth Cash Plan after probationary period
Professional qualifications sponsorship
Career development opportunities in a growing Group of companies
Increasing holiday with length of service (20 - 25 days pa plus bank holidays)
Holiday EXTRA - purchase up to 5 days extra holiday per year
Employee Assistance programmes - health, legal, counselling (through Simply Health).

Interested?

Apply now and we can discuss this in more detail and provide you with a more detailed job description.

Due to the large numbers of responses we receive, despite our best efforts it is not possible to respond to every application. Therefore, only short-listed candidates will be contacted for this particular role and if you havent heard from us within 7 days please assume you have been unsuccessful on this occasion. Please feel free however to apply for further roles and we will certainly keep your details on file and contact you with suitable vacancies. YourRecruit (IT) Ltd does not discriminate on the grounds of age, race, gender or disability and complies with all relevant UK legislation.

To stay safe in your job search we recommend that you visit SAFERjobs, a non-profit, joint industry and law enforcement organisation working to combat job scams. Visit the SAFERjobs website for information on common scams and to get free, expert advice for a safer job search.

Therefore, only short-listed candidates will be contacted for this particular role and if you havent heard from us within 7 days please assume you have been unsuccessful on this occasion. Please feel free however to apply for further roles and we will certainly keep your details on file and contact you with suitable vacancies. YourRecruit (IT) Ltd does not discriminate on the grounds of age, race, gender or disability and complies with all relevant UK legislation.

To stay safe in your job search we recommend that you visit SAFERjobs, a non-profit, joint industry and law enforcement organisation working to combat job scams. Visit the SAFERjobs website for information on common scams and to get free, expert advice for a safer job search.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
This is a fantastic opportunity at a progressive and successful media agency where you will provide support to the ARMLabs team and media planner buyers at All Response Media by way of data wrangling, analysis and econometrics.




You will be joining a passionate and supportive team of economists who crave answers, enjoy learning, and thrive off working on multiple tasks and projects ranging from data extraction through SQL/Snowflake to analysing the impact of advertising campaigns using time series econometrics models.




This a is great opportunity for newcomers to the data analytics world. You will be trained by the senior members of the team, who will soft manage you on a day-to-day basis, but you will report to the head of data science. There are many opportunities within the role to gain responsibility and develop creative thinking through actionable insight.




A BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or successful completion of a level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship is required to be considered for this role.




About The Company




All Response Media is Europe’s leading performance media agency, providing clients with an “Unfair Competitive Advantage” since 1995, with offices in London, Leeds and Amsterdam




We are progressive, dynamic and a rewarding company where you can develop your skills and build a long-term career in advertising, as part of a highly talented and driven team of over 150 professionals. As a growing agency, you will be a part of a fast-paced, exciting and social company culture that truly enriches employee careers. We show a great level of passion and care for all we do, and our leaders appreciate that embedding a strong team culture is important to the success of ARM. As such, we are passionate about developing strong leaders from within the business.




We provide industry-leading media performance to a growing global client base and partner with some of the most innovative and established businesses to continue our mission to disrupt and innovate the advertising industry. Our success is achieved through the success of our clients, and we do this by cultivating strong working relationships through collaboration, innovation and integration which drives engagement, helping them build strong brands and performance.




We plan and buy across all media channels, on and offline. Our bespoke campaign measurement suite, ARMalytics®, gives us a competitive advantage and is at the core of our model, underpinning the data-led operations of our integrated client business teams and ARMlabs data and systems unit. We actively encourage integration across the agency, therefore those who join us soon find that they have a wealth of knowledge across all marketing disciplines.




Your key responsibilities will include:




Access, investigate and extract data as needed (using Snowflake and SQL)
Manipulate data (format, remove and add data and tables)
Test data for completeness and correctness
Format client reports and data extracts (mainly in Excel and R)
Create own visualisation and dashboards and maintenance of dashboards using an advanced suite of visualisation tools
Manage the log of weekly requests from the ARM teams
Provide web tag data to ARM teams
Assist ARM team with queries regarding the bespoke ARM RAPS system
Assist ARM teams with client setup and configuration on the RAPS system
Analyse Direct Response advertising effectiveness
Compile and report on competitor insights
Run simple econometric regressions in R
Econometrics modelling to answer questions about the effect of advertising
Maintain GDPR compliance with regards to handling of first- and third-party data
Troubleshoot data problems that extend to attribution queries
Identify areas of opportunity with regards to automation and streamline processes
Contribute to further development around wider industry research and use cases




Requirements




BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship.
Data manipulation skills in R (or Python)
Timeseries econometric regressions experience (Eviews/SAS/R/etc.)
Advanced MS Excel Skills (VLOOKUP's, etc.)
Strong number orientation through abilities in maths, accounting, statistics .
Good communication skills
Good story telling with data skills
MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)
Media experience (preferred)
Eligible to work in the UK




Benefits




Competitive salary and bonus
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
Progression and development




Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.
Show more Show less

  • Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
  • Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
  • Progression and development


Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City of Westminster, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Job Summary




House of Commons




The House of Commons is a unique and exciting place to work right at the heart of the UK's thriving democratic system. 




Behind the scenes, the House of Commons Service is made up of more than 3,000 employees who support and facilitate the smooth day-to-day running of the House. They provide professional services to Members of Parliament, their staff, and the wider parliamentary community.




Introduction




We have an exciting opportunity to join our Business Management Team within the House of Commons. The Business Management Team’s work encompasses a broad set of responsibilities, including the delivery of construction projects, the provision of specialist planning and design support, and the care and development of our internationally significant heritage collections, among others.




Strategic Estates is committed to building a culture in which our people are supported and empowered to give off their best in meeting the needs of the parliamentary community. Our people are our greatest asset and are at the core of our vision.




Job Description




As a Data Analyst, you will provide analytical support to Strategic Estates, as well as the Parliamentary Maintenance Services and Customer Experience and Service Delivery teams in delivering a high-class suite of workforce information and performance metrics and analysis, enabling senior leadership to make strategically informed decisions on the performance of teams including the development of leading metrics and organisational service performance.




You will lead and contribute to workforce reporting projects across all teams and will identify opportunities for improvements to business activities and all relevant system processes.




Some Of The Responsibilities For This Role Include




Develop and maintain workforce management information, ad hoc reports and statutory requests to meet the business needs of Managers and facilitate the Business Planning process.
Lead on the production and tracking of key performance indicators as well as identifying and developing new metrics.
Analyse and interpret workforce data to inform and assist senior leadership in their strategy and workforce planning.




Person specification




To Be Successful In This Role You Will Demonstrate




Experience of leading on data administration and understanding of data management with proves experience in development expertise of complex reports, combined with advanced Excel skills and a proven ability to handle and analyse large quantities of data.
Proven business analysis experience including process mapping, and requirements definition.
Excellent problem-solving skills in technical and service delivery environments using logic, knowledge and sound processes to analyse information and find solutions.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to quickly gain the confidence of colleagues at all levels and influence a range of stakeholders. The ability to work under pressure and autonomously prioritising work to meet deadlines. Flexible in responding to changing requirements and circumstances. Willing to challenge and persuade where appropriate.
Act as a positive role model and promote the culture of House, maintaining principles of equality, diversity and inclusion at all times.
Experience of project delivery, planning of Workstream tasks/ system improvement projects.




Benefits




In addition to your salary, we offer an attractive range of benefits including:




30 days’ annual leave (increasing to 35 days after first full leave year).
Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%.
Access to training and development.
Flexible working.
Interest free season ticket loan and bicycle loan.




Things you need to know




Selection process details




CV & Cover Letter – If you would like to apply for this role, please submit your CV and cover letter with a 500-word limit.




More information on the role and the full criteria can be found in the Job Description.




Interview Stage – You may be asked to complete an Excel Test apart of the interview process.




Please note that most job offers will be made at the minimum of the salary range, other than in exceptional circumstances.




Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
Description




Hey, I'm Kuvera, the COO and Co-Founder at HowNow, and I’m hiring! Before I tell you more about our role, here’s a bit more about us…




Our mission is to make meaningful learning a part of your everyday work! 🧠




The shelf life of our skills is now less than 5 years. So, if you stopped learning today, you’d soon end up irrelevant. Think that’s a big problem? You’d be right.




Enter HowNow. Founded in 2019, this is the problem our Learning Experience Platform is solving. It’s disrupting the way people learn and grow at work through technology. Whether it's finding a quick answer, building a skill, or tapping into shared knowledge, we make it easy for people to learn what they need, when they need it.




On the back of our Series-A funding, the next stage of our ambitious journey begins. Already used by fast-growing scale-ups and global enterprises, such as Checkout.com, Depop and Investec, we’re pushing the boundaries of how people learn.




"Data & Insights" as a function at HowNow, hasn't previously existed, until now. As our first hire, your job will be to build out what Data Analysis looks like. We've already identified that there's an enormous amount of potential that this role can bring to the table. You'll provide key analysis and insights of our product that will allow our customers to have conversations they've previously never been able to have. Sound exciting? It is. You'll also partner with teams internally - Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, and Finance are just a few areas where we can see you'll be able to make a massive impact, but we're sure you'll spot other ways to add value as you go!




Day-to-day tasks will include 📩




You'll create a range of dashboards that help solve business challenges and support future decision-making both for our Customers, and us.
You'll provide teams and stakeholders with regular, actionable insights and analysis reports
You’ll collaborate with various stakeholders and teams including Product & Engineering, Customer Success, Sales, Marketing and Finance.
You'll train internal teams to support with self-serve dashboards
You'll collect data from numerous data sources, and clean and analyse data to identify trends
You'll work with our COO to identify the best tech-stack required based on industry best-practice.




The key things that we will be looking for in applicants 🔑




You’ve had previous experience, or can demonstrate that you have the capabilities to build out effective data insights and reporting from scratch
You have experience with data-modelling or the appetite to learn
You're experienced in using data visualization tools, and building dashboards, such as PowerBI or Tableau
You've got experience finding answers to similar problems that our teams would face
You're able to explain complex ideas and statistical concepts in a clear, concise manner
You've got strong presentation abilities
You're experienced and competent with SQL and Microsoft Excel




What You’ll Get




💰 A competitive salary and performance based bonus - let's have a chat about it.




🏡 A flexible approach to hybrid working (most of us are in 1-2x a week) and working hours




💆 Wind-down Fridays. No meetings from 2pm-6pm on Fridays, for you to wind down for the weekend. A few ways our HowNow’ers use this time is to exercise, study, or spend some time with their family and friends




🏖️ Workcations. We try to get our Mumbai and UK teams together to brainstorm in person over a company retreat. We’ve previously met in Goa, Turkey, and Copenhagen




💡 Access to the very best learning platform out there (HowNow+) to keep you at the top of your game




📚 An annual £500 learning and development budget




🌴 25 days holiday, plus bank holidays and your birthday day off




💰 An enhanced employee pension scheme




👩🏾‍⚕️ Private health insurance through Vitality




🤩 Monthly socials, which have included mini-golf, Hijingo, shuffleboarding, 5-a-side football and Badminton




🚲 Cycle to Work scheme




🐶 Dog friendly offices




👩‍💻A shiny new Macbook and work from home equipment




What's next?




Once you've applied, we'll get back in touch with you. This is usually within the next 3 working days. Sometimes it can take slightly longer, but we will get back to you as soon as we can, irregardless of what the outcome of your application is.




If we've decided it's a match, you'll be invited to a 30-minute video call with Dom, our Senior Talent Partner.




After the initial call, if we're both interested in moving ahead, you'll be invited to meet with Kuvera, our COO & Co-Founder for 45 minutes so you can get to know each other better.




Following a successful interview, you'll do take-home SQL task, which we'll review, followed by another meeting with Kuvera, and a member of the team where you'll also deliver a task that will require you to analyse a data-set and present your analysis back to us.

🚲 Cycle to Work scheme

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Life as a Data Analyst at Coral

Work as part of our Data team to develop a understanding of the challenges that Growth teams tackle day-to-day
Deliver and be accountable for data analysis at Coral
Work hand in hand with Data Science, Product & Engineering to conduct analysis driving the development of our Growth Platform (including Data Integration, Data Processing & Transformation)
Work closely with our Data team to template our Analytics workstreams so that we're able to scale our product to work efficiently with any data source
Maintain data quality and the source of truth for metrics
Maintain core data domain documentation
Develop a thorough understanding of different data sources for various industry verticals i.e. Marketing (Facebook, TikTok, Instagram), Commercial (Salesforce, Shopify), Product (Mixpanel, LaunchDarkly, Amplitude) so that we're flexible to any new customer needs and the tools they use
Support on decision-making about how to model and architecture our data internally
Support the identification of new data sources and collaborate with data engineers to make sure data requirements are captured and prioritised
Ensure the team follows best practices when working with our data platform
Exposure to a cutting edge data platform with the ability to learn new analytics tools and best practices




What You Need To Know And Show

Experience using tools to extract data such as SQL, Python, dbt, Amazon Redshift or BigQuery or Snowflake, Google Cloud Platform or AWS, GitHub, and Docker
Experience in some of the following would be beneficial: Snowflake, a BI tool such as Looker/Tableau/Lightdash
A curiosity around the developing technologies in AI (such as Chat-GPT and other machine learning applications)
Previous involvement in delivering actionable insight and business change through the application of analytics
Previous involvement in taking data in it’s rawest form and building a consumable data model on top
An inquisitive mind, with the curiosity to be constantly on the lookout for opportunities and the ability to logically solve problems
The ability to partner brilliantly with different teams across the business to understand their problems and deliver value
Experience with DevOps practices (code testing/review, source code management, packaging, and releases)
Experience with coding in Python (robust, understandable, and well-documented code)
Ability to understand and interpret business needs and requirements

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Find a job that lets your imagination run wild!




WildBrain Spark is a digital media leader that creates, manages and distributes kids’ entertainment content on platforms such as YouTube, Amazon Video Direct and ROKU. WildBrain Spark’s branded YouTube network is one of the largest of its kind, featuring over 500 brands and 300K videos across 800 kids’ channels.




Our team also produces original content at our studio including animation, stop motion and live action, both for our channels and those of popular kids’ content and toy brands. If you have an idea, WildBrain Spark will help you develop and grow it into a reality! Our content reaches 1 in 3 kids globally with over 4 billion monthly views, engaging families everywhere! This huge reach could not happen without our legendary team – and we are looking to add to it!




To work at WildBrain Spark means you get to help create and share stories that lets imaginations run wild. Join our team today to become part of the story!




About The Job/role




We are looking to add a Data Analyst to our growing, talented team of innovators to shape the future of kids entertainment. This role is in our Data and Technology Group focused on creating analytics and insight products and services that understand our audiences, our content and the relationships with brands. We are experimentative, we make big and small changes, and we are motivated by the fact that everything we do has the potential to be impactful. We know we won’t always get things right first time and enjoy learning and exploring new ideas.




We are a multi-disciplined group covering Data Analytics, Data Science (using AI and ML), Software Engineering and Product Ownership. We form self-organised teams around delivering solutions to real-world problems – we are agile, we are flexible, we spend time learning and on self -development and above all we have fun. We mostly use SQL, GCP and AWS clouds and are exploring using Azure, with visualisations and reports mostly within Tableau and PowerBI.




Responsibilities




Designing and developing data models, analytical assets, interpretations, insights, and segmentations to drive decisions, reports and dashboards.
Creating workflows for transformations, aggregations, filters and correlations to enable large/complex data sets to be accessed for “self-service” use across the business.
Designing algorithms to interpret data sets and enabling the creation of business reports (including dashboards) with samples, templates, generic and specific examples.
Evaluating (through analysis) the quality of data, resolves gaps and discrepancies in data sets.
Working to deliver the backlog, roadmap and overall strategy measured by outcome value and agreed priorities; and, keeping up to date and learning new technologies.




Qualifications




Practical experience of translating requirements into quality data sets aligned to strategy and outcomes.
Experience of working in an agile environment and understand OKRs, MVPs and KPIs.
Experience using Tableau is essential
A good understanding of using SQL along with Tableau or/and PowerBI for data visualisation.
A good understanding of using a range of approaches to convert, adapt and make data sets available.
A good understanding of transforming technology solutions for an ever-changing world.
Experience of working with Software Engineers to develop new data sets and transformation approaches.
Experience of working in a cloud first environment desirable




What We Offer




Working at WildBrain Spark is more than a job — it’s the opportunity to join forces with extraordinary, insightful and imaginative people who will recognize your talents and encourage your professional growth and development in a work environment that promotes creativity and individuality. We offer competitive benefits and we invest in our people and their future. Some of the perks we have are private medical insurance, income protection, gym subsidy, bonus time off, employee share programmes, reduced summer hours and flexible & home working.




Our commitment




Diversity and Inclusion are in our DNA. As a global leader in kids and family entertainment, we strive to reflect and honour the diversity of our audiences around the world. We believe that creating diverse and inclusive content & brands begins with fostering a culture of belonging at WildBrain CPLG. To us, a culture of belonging is one where we celebrate and welcome the diversity of all employees, stakeholders, and external partners and strive to create an environment where every individual feels valued, respected, and brings their authentic self to work.




We demonstrate our commitment to this by striving to provide a supportive work environment and a corporate culture that welcomes and encourages equal opportunities. We recognize that people bring experience and talent that goes beyond the technical skills and requirements of a job. If you possess similar experience that is close to what we’ve listed here, we encourage you to please still consider applying. We strongly believe that diverse experience, transferable skills, and passion are key! WildBrain Spark accommodates people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Applicants are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required.




About WildBrain – a Parent Company Of WildBrain Spark




At WildBrain we make great content for kids and families. With approximately 13,000 half-hours of filmed entertainment in our library – one of the world’s most extensive – we are home to such brands as Peanuts, Teletubbies, Strawberry Shortcake, Caillou, Inspector Gadget, Johnny Test and Degrassi. Our shows are seen in more than 150 countries on over 500 telecasters and streaming platforms. WildBrain’s portfolio spans all areas of the entertainment industry WildBrain Studios, where we develop and produce hit animated and live actions series; WildBrain Television, which is composed of prominent kids’ television channels in Canada (Family Channel, Family CHRGD, Family Jr. and Télémagino); home to Peanuts Worldwide; brand management to some of the world’s most-loved kids brands; celebrated global licensing and distribution teams with WildBrain CPLG, and a leading children’s YouTube network in WildBrain Spark, one of the largest networks of kids’ channels on YouTube, with over 168 million subscribers.




WildBrain is headquartered in Canada with offices worldwide and trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX WILD). Visit wildbrain.com to learn more!

Our team also produces original content at our studio including animation, stop motion and live action, both for our channels and those of popular kids’ content and toy brands. If you have an idea, WildBrain Spark will help you develop and grow it into a reality! Our content reaches 1 in 3 kids globally with over 4 billion monthly views, engaging families everywhere! Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Feeld, we are creating a world where where everyone is more intimately connected to each other and themselves. We are building an inclusive, human-centred product and are looking for a Data Analyst to become part our remote team and our mission to elevate the human experience of sexuality and relationships.

You will be responsible for supporting the growth team in driving user acquisition, retention and revenue growth for our platform.

To be right for this role, you should have experience with data analysis and be able to work with a variety of stakeholders to identify and support growth opportunities.




What you will do:

Support the growth team with experiment design and analysis/uplift modeling.
Track and analyze key metrics such as installs, active users and retention
Identify patterns between metrics (leading /lagging indicators) and assess the impact of input-to-output metrics.
Help the growth team prioritize growth initiatives and optimize overall strategy
Measure user lifetime value and build LTV predictive models
Predict customer churn propensity and support the CRM team in designing effective churn prevention campaigns by analyzing the user pain points
Score users based on their contribution to the growth and sustainability of Feeld’s micro-networks




About you:

Very good theoretical and applied knowledge of statistical methods like linear/logistic regression, hypothesis testing, and decision trees/random forests.
Familiarity with causal inference.
Excellent communication, presentation and storytelling skills.
Strong experience with SQL, Python, Excel and data visualization tools (we use Holistics but if you’ve used Looker, Power BI or similar that’s great!).
2+ years of experience working with data or growth/marketing analytics teams.
Commercially savvy, with an eye for marketing spend optimization opportunities and an understanding of the true ROI of marketing spend in both the short- and long-term.




Bonus points:

Experience in the dating industry is a plus.
Experience in a marketplace consumer app is a plus.




About us:

Feeld is an independent, experimental and fully remote organisation reshaping the dialogue on dating and sexuality. The company was founded in 2014 and has evolved since to become the open, distributed structure it is now. We have a naturally agile and fluid culture. The whole team is fully remote, which means you work where and when helps you perform at your best. We regard autonomy highly and treat our organisation as a product – we iterate, improve and test things internally to see what works best for everyone.




Our culture:

We believe in creating a safe work environment through humanity, fluidity, safety, transparency and progressiveness. When hiring, we look for culture add rather than culture fit.

Because we are a fully remote team, it’s especially important that we create an environment where our colleagues feel included and connected as humans.




Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging at Feeld:

Feeld promotes open-mindedness, inclusion, diversity and kindness, both in the world and among our own workforce.

We encourage and welcome applications from people with a history of marginalisation, whether because of race, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability (seen or unseen) or any confluence of intersectional identities.

Our goal is a barrier-free application process and working environment. If you require further details or assistance or have any questions about this process, please let us know at hr@feeld.co.




Compensation and perks:

We are conscious of how our work and decisions impact other humans and the environment. We design our product and organisation with consideration for the wellbeing and happiness of our members and colleagues. We believe in technology and working environments that enable people to live a meaningful, fulfilled life.

Therefore, we offer our staff:

Flexible working hours
Unlimited paid time off
A fully remote working situation
Annual expense budget
GBP £3k equipment and home office budget
Learning & development budget
On demand therapy sessions and mental health support via Spill
Company retreats




Feeld’s way of working is designed to proactively prevent burnout and an “always on” culture.

One of our Core Values is: Transparent. We strive for complete openness of information within the organisation and for enabling honesty on our platform. Internally, we keep decision-making transparent to keep each other accountable and make sure all voices are heard.




That is why we offer:

Open and transparent salaries
At Feeld we believe all humans deserve to make a competitive wage. That's why we offer a Baseline Freedom Salary of $80,000 or £60,000 per year.
The base salary for this role is determined by Level and Step, as well as geographic location, but we estimate that this role can earn between £70,000, - £90,000 GBP based on the requirements listed in this job description.




Our interview process:

Your first conversation with Feeld will be a screening call with our recruiter, where you’ll be able to ask - and receive answers - regarding any general questions you have and to confirm the role is a fit for what you’re seeking.
Your second conversation will connect you directly with the hiring manager for the role you’re applying to. Here, you’ll have a chance to ask more questions about the work you’ll be doing. This conversation will also focus on your past work experiences.
The next step for most of our roles is a candidate challenge. This is an evaluation of the skills relevant to be successful in this role and generally takes about an hour to complete.
Your third conversation allows you the opportunity to meet the team members you might be working with on a daily basis. Here, you’ll be able to ask questions about team processes, workflow, and the employee experience at Feeld.
We generally make an offer within 2 weeks of our final call, and offer a flexible start date that can begin as early as the next Monday after you sign our offer documentation.
Of note: all of our interviews are conducted remotely, and our interviewers will work with you to find an agreeable interview time based on mutual availability.




We understand we're asking you to invest your time and best efforts in our process, and are appreciative of getting the chance to better know who you are as a person and candidate. In return, we’re committed to offering transparent communication and prompt feedback as you navigate this application with us.

To find out more about Feeld, download our app (available on iOS and Android).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Salary: £40k-£72k

Location: London, Guildford or Gloucester




Overview:

We our seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team of 4,800 digital, cyber, and intelligence experts. Our Digital Defence division delivers solutions that protect and enhance the connected world, creating a safer future for nations, governments, and businesses around the globe.




As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients' data-driven needs from their current platforms and processes, enabling a deep understanding of these systems and becoming a key player in supporting their transformation from a structural, technical, or insight perspective. You will operate independently, providing a level of depth and insight into the real issues and problems of the systems and processes.




As a data analyst you will:

• Support data specialists in delivering for our clients, exploiting existing analytical technologies to extract value from complex and varied data sets, and presenting findings to a variety of technical and non-technical audiences.

• You will also need to be flexible in delivering in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, willing to work solo or within a team depending on the demands of the project.

• Have technical aptitude with technologies such as Python, C#, Nifi, ElasticSearch, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins to name but a few; or a desire to learn more about these ‘on the job’.

• You should also have a strong security mindset and be willing to go through SC clearance.




Candidates must be eligible for SC clearance




The package:

• £45,000 - £70,000

• 7-10% bonus

• Up to 6k car allowance

• 9% pension




As a member of the team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn us our place in an ever-changing digital world. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.




If you are ready to join our team and make a difference, please apply today!

Title: Research and Data Analyst - Home (Remote)
Description:
Company Description

Forbes Advisor is a new initiative for consumers under the Forbes Marketplace umbrella that provides journalist- and expert-written insights, news and reviews on all things personal finance.

We’re dedicated to helping turn aspirations into reality. We do this by providing consumers with the knowledge and research they need to make informed financial decisions they can feel confident in, so they can get back to doing the things they care about most.

Job Description

We are seeking a Home Data Analyst to join our team and assist our editorial team in creating top-quality content. In this role, you will provide competitive analysis on the market and ensure the quality and accuracy of data collection and analysis for home improvement products and services. Your research and analysis will be a key component of making trustworthy, relevant assessments of products and services, and will help thousands of homeowners make informed decisions about the products and services they use.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting opportunity similar to those found at a start-up, with the benefits of a seasoned and successful company, then this may be the role for you.

Responsibilities:

Review editorial data requests for feasibility, usability, and scalability
Leverage a team of freelancers to collect product and service data, with a focus on home products
Perform analysis on collected data to identify top-quality home products and services
Develop and implement processes for quality control
Collaborate with peers to introduce and develop new techniques and processes for efficient data collection
Collaborate with the editorial team to ensure deadlines and goals are met
Review editorial content resulting from work product for accuracy and completeness


About You:

Highly organized, with strong attention to detail and critical thinking abilities
Comfortable working in G-Suite, with an emphasis on Google Sheets
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize projects accordingly
Previous experience in a quality role is preferred
Comfortable managing your own projects and deliverables


Qualifications:

Degree in a relevant field, such as business or computer science, or equivalent training and experience
Proficiency in using Google Sheets for data analysis and manipulation
Proven experience in software testing, as well as proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation are desirable


Benefits:

We competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, unlimited PTO, disability coverage, employee assistance program, and a paid parental leave program.


Additional Information

Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

  • Collaborate with peers to introduce and develop new techniques and processes for efficient data collection
  • Collaborate with the editorial team to ensure deadlines and goals are met
  • Review editorial content resulting from work product for accuracy and completeness

About You:
  • Highly organized, with strong attention to detail and critical thinking abilities
  • Comfortable working in G-Suite, with an emphasis on Google Sheets
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize projects accordingly
  • Previous experience in a quality role is preferred
  • Comfortable managing your own projects and deliverables

Qualifications:
  • Degree in a relevant field, such as business or computer science, or equivalent training and experience
  • Proficiency in using Google Sheets for data analysis and manipulation
  • Proven experience in software testing, as well as proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation are desirable

Benefits:
  • We competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, unlimited PTO, disability coverage, employee assistance program, and a paid parental leave program.

Additional Information

Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Kent - £28,245 - £32,089




This is a great opportunity to join the team at a high school and sixth form based in Kent, they are looking for a Data Analyst to provide efficient and effective organisation of the school’s data assessment, reporting and recording systems. This role will suit someone who has good experience in a data analyst role and is now looking for a opportunity to take their career to the next step.




Responsibilities:

Develop and oversee the schools systems
To maintain and update Brom Com and other assessment records
Collect, monitor and summarise data to identify patterns / trends
Set up and manage systems for tracking students progress at each key stage / subject area
Formulate and produce adhoc reports on individual students’ progress and attainment for the Headteacher
Provide data for the local authority, DfE and school census




Skills required:

4+ years’ experience in data analyst role
Experience in Google Suite / MS Applications
Data gathering, reporting and analysis
Ability to manipulate data to produce written, numerical and graphical reports.
Brom Com experience (desirable)
Similar role in school (desirable)




Benefits:

50 days holiday, including bank holidays
Pension scheme
Free counselling
Frequent staff events

Data Analyst – Kent - £28,245 - £32,089




If this sounds like the role for you, please apply, send your CV to me at fern.wilson@senitor.com or call me on 0207 379 1599

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst London, office-based role

Salary £30-40,000 + pension, bonus (up to 20%), etc. MS Excel epxertise essential

Scale-up engineering firm




Background to the firm and the vacancy

This leading provider of safety inspection services to the social/residential housing sector are experiencing continued growth in demand across the UK.

The operations function currently numbers 9 members, and is growing.

Data analysis responsibilities include:

Devising and workin on data analysis to help improve logistics, workforce planning and efficent service delivery
Analysing and managing data– adding to and improving the database of clients, using dashboards to identify risks, etc
Liaising with internal teams, eg software development, for issue resolution and new product ideas

Experience/skills required

Professional experience(2+years) in an operations administration, coordination, support or analysis position
Confidence with using data – strong Excel is expected. Using dashboards is part of what the team does; it is expected that the Ops Director will be capable of driving data-led improvements
Excellent relationship-building skills




What’s in it for you?

Up to £40,000 base salary, plus a bonus of up to 20%, and 5% pension contribution from the employer
The chance to make your mark on a scaling-up business
Some of the ops work is very data-led – and will become more so. There’s room for personal skills growth here – data skills
Doing something meaningful (the work positively impacts society)
Variety

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role




The primary objective of this role is to support and expand the newly formed Client Intelligence team with analysis, scripting and reporting on a variety of subjects. This includes client/prospect profiling, sales lifecycle, client journey mapping, market/competitor research. This will assist in developing company strategies around growth, client engagement and the wider market landscape.




The role will offer applicants to learn in a fast paced and dynamic environment and to quickly take on more responsibility to further develop skills. The successful applicant will learn the needs of client intelligence team and the wider growth department as well as the procedures, KPIs and models used. With this knowledge and fresh perspective you will be expected to provide insights and process improvements to deliver on the team’s objectives.. Therefore, proactive and ambitious candidates are required.




Successful candidates will have access to a wealth of knowledge from more senior team members and from key stakeholders on other teams in the company. This will include learning about financial markets, modelling techniques, sales/marketing strategies and interaction with senior stakeholders including C-suite and board level.




Responsibilities




Provide insights and intelligence for use across the company to inform direction on business decisions
Create strategies and proposals from the insights generated through data analysis
Ensure accuracy and optimisation of our internal tooling and client intelligence software (including Hubspot and internal databases), particularly with regards to the accuracy of the sales pipeline and customer/prospect information.
Collate, clean and visualise data from several internal tools, and external sources, to produce/present reports for key stakeholders (internal and external)
Build, manage and update new workflows and dashboards to provide insights on clients, prospects, and wider market data
Build statistical tools that analyse TH client/prospect behaviour, trends and requirements
Perform market research on prospective client, competitor and regulatory data to inform new strategies across company




Requirements




Essential Skills/Competencies




1-2 years’ experience in a similar role
Proficient in either Python, Excel/VBA, SQL or any object-oriented language
Fast learner and keen for growth opportunities
Outstanding presentation, communication and interpersonal skills
Proactive, resilient and keen to voice suggestions for team/company strategies
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure and exercise clear judgement
BSc degree in STEM or another related field (data science would be preferential)
Knowledge of financial markets would be beneficial




Benefits




Why should you apply?




Ambition: Extremely fast-growing company with an uncapped potential, offering every colleague a broad range of experience and plenty of opportunities for internal movement, as well as rapid career progression. Vibrant company culture full of uniquely talented and friendly colleagues with regular social perks to build camaraderie.




Flexibility: 25 days holiday + bank holidays, informal dress code, generous maternity/parental leave policies. We also offer a flexible working policy (up to 2 days a week remote).




Reward: Highly competitive compensation plus annual discretionary bonus and discretionary EMI scheme (company share option scheme).




Support: Annual personal training budget, private healthcare, company pension plan, death in service coverage, cycle to work scheme & tech scheme.

Title: CITI Data Analyst
Company: Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust
Description:
Please note, interview dates to be confirmed.




CITI Analysts are instrumental in delivering the Trust’s most significant transformation and improvement programmes, by supporting data-led decisions and actions in the prioritisation and delivery of CITI’s programmes. This is an exciting opportunity to be working in and alongside our Clinical Groups and supporting teams across the organisation in delivering its vision for better, faster, fairer healthcare.




CITI Analysts will act as ambassadors for CITI across GSTT and externally, collaborating closely with internal and external stakeholders. We are looking dynamic individuals who are driven to fulfil CITI’s ambitions to be an exemplar internationally of a function that stimulates and delivers leading innovation, transformation and improvement.




You can see full details of the role in the Job Descriptions attached.




The interview process will take the form of an assessment centre for which the candidates will be asked to carry out a number of exercises over a period of ~3 hours. The dates held for the assessment centre are : 4th, 5th and 6th of April, with potential additional dates on w/c 10th April if required through the recruitment process.




Role




The post holder will help the CITI Leadership and Management team, and particularly the Senior CITI Analytics Manager, be effective in all the roles they undertake, by working with them on CITI projects and specifically around the following areas




The CITI Analyst is responsible for providing direct analytics support to the Centre for Innovation, Transformation and Improvement; helping to advance the data collection, collation and analysis on projects and programmes. This role will involve creating tools to monitor and report performance, transformation and improvement.




To lead on insightful analysis that support performance monitoring, transformation and improvement across a number of programmes and projects.
Lead on developing and implementing plans for data collection, collation and analysis across CITI.
Develop data insights and analytical tools that support performance management as well as the prioritisation and delivery of change.
Support the Senior CITI Analytics Manager in training and developing the analytic capability across CITI and the Trust.




The Centre of Innovation, Transformation and Improvement (CITI) at Guy’s and St Thomas’s was newly founded in 2021 under the Deputy Chief Executive. The DCE is the Executive Director responsible for leading and implementing the Trust’s strategy for innovation and improvement, which aims to develop an ecosystem that encourages the acceleration of new knowledge and capabilities and learn from best practices globally, to deliver improvements in patient care, research and education at scale. CITI co-locates multi-faceted teams to provide the focal point for clinical innovators and services seeking to translate ideas or early stage products or improvements into clinical practice. The Centre aims both to incubate and deliver innovations and improvement ideas, projects and programmes, working alongside and for its clinical customers for the benefit of patients.




CITI builds on industry best practice in taking innovation from concept to practice. It aims to foster a culture of innovation and improvement throughout the Trust, and acts as the intellectual home of our core change methodologies.




CITI aims to improve the adoption of new clinical technologies with an agile operational model, delivering a data-driven approach to evaluating performance of novel technologies, creating a sustainable culture of innovation in clinical and operational workforce, and to build enduring partnerships with academia, industry, investors, our communities and other key Stakeholders.




For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Nina Thompson Job title: Business Manager Email address: Nina.Thompson@gstt.nhs.uk
