Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the job

Overview



Medialab’s proprietary marketing intelligence proposition, Apollo, enables data-driven success through the centralised collection of data, the formation of information as our single source of truth and the exposing of insights for decision making. This is made possible through the capabilities provided by our foundation, Apollo Platform. A dedicated project team is responsible for the population of our platform which entails the strategic designing of data feeds, onboarding of data for our clients and delivery of business intelligence use cases.



 



We are at an exciting stage in our journey and are looking for a proactive self-starter who is passionate about data, detail-oriented and a clear communicator, to join the team and play a significant role in the delivery of our next chapter.



 



Responsibilities



The responsibilities of the role are as follows:



Analysing business requirements through building relationships with stakeholders and communicating effectively and analysing existing systems
Analysing existing and new data sources to understand their purpose, features and limitations
Become an expert in Apollo Platform’s domain model and design high quality data feeds
Onboard data feeds and monitor their success before handing over to our support function
Translate business requirements to technical data transformation requirements for our engineering team - technical contributions welcome
Deliver dashboards on top of our output data model that are fit for purpose
Perform data QA checks and comparisons to ensure data integrity
Communicate with stakeholders to ensure they are aware of progress and have their expectations managed
Ensure that all your work is carried out to a high standard and that your colleagues are aware of the status of tasks

 



Skills & Experience



You will need the following must-have skills:



Data literacy - apt at manipulating data for quick answers. Spreadsheet software (excel/google sheets) is second nature for you
Ability to deliver data visualisations on top of a data model based on a business requirement (e.g. experience with Tableau, PowerBI, Looker or similar)
Ability to extract requirements from stakeholders / analysing existing systems, effectively
Ability to conduct data QA and perform comparisons to ensure data integrity
Ability to pick up new technologies fast
Ability to work at pace in a dynamic environment and manage your time effectively
Ability to work autonomously and be accountable for your commitments
Ability to collaborate effectively with a team

 



The following experience will help you stand out:



Experience with interrogating data via SQL
Experience with the marketing/advertising domain
Experience within a media planning/activation environment
Experience within an agile environment

 



Behaviours



The below behaviours will be important in enabling you to thrive in the role:



Curious - you constantly seek how to do things better - you receive feedback well and look to apply it to your daily work.
Passionate - you care about your craft, you are hungry to learn more and you enjoy a challenge.
Ownership - you take your responsibilities seriously and you make it your mission to deliver - blockers are to be overcome.
Diligence - you know that technology and data are complex and a thorough approach is needed to ensure quality and integrity.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a well-established and innovative Data Analysis business who helps organisations manage their energy better and are well-respected within their division. They have been established for over 40 years and as a business, they currently have over 3.5k customers and employ over 300 people - this role will be based at their Epsom office.




They are looking to recruit a Data Analyst to work within their Asset Team. The company’s mission is to empower customers to reduce their energy costs and carbon footprint. Our client is looking for someone with strong analytical skills in particular the ability to analyse data within Excel. This could suit a graduate looking for their first step into a career or an experienced candidate looking for a new challenge!




Salary: £23,000 to £26,000 depending on experience




Hours: 35 hours per week, Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm




Location: Epsom Office, with hybrid option available after training (2 days in the office)




Benefits Include: Pension scheme, professional qualifications sponsorship, increasing holiday with length of service (start at 20 days rising to 25 days), Holiday EXTRA - purchase up to 5 days extra holiday per year, Employee Assistance programmes - health/legal/counselling, award bonus, Season Ticket Loans, Company social activities inc. Summer BBQ, Festive lunch and much more!




What is the purpose of this role?




The purpose of this role is to be part of the team responsible for tracking the energy meters. You will maintain the asset data that underpins the portfolio, while helping resolve enquiries that come in from our fantastic customers and colleagues.




To be successful, you will be data driven, be comfortable working with MS Excel, be able to turn data into stories, proactive and curious, as well as customer focussed. Of course, it will also help if you’re passionate about the environment and helping people save on their energy costs!




Produce analysis and tools that provide the information needed to maximise the value of the asset portfolio
Own, improve, and keep up to date a suite of tools that will help turn asset data into actionable insight
Support the Team Leader in identifying issues or opportunities to improve - and drive forward the design and implementation of cost-effective solutions
Perform routine reconciliations against information held in industry databases, problem solving any mismatches that arise
Assist in the production of routine departmental KPI reports and Management Information for the senior management team.
Resolve complex queries, that involve analysing data, reviewing audit trails and liaising with Suppliers, Account Managers, software providers, and other internal teams.




What Technical Skills & Knowledge Are Required




Analytical ability, particularly able to work with and analyse data in Excel
Strong problem-solver
Great knowledge of Excel, and Outlook
Willingness and ability to develop new IT and analytical skills
Strong administrative and organisational skills
Full training will be provided - requiring an ability to complete the training program within defined timescales.




Communication & Interpersonal Skills




Articulate, professional, and clear verbal communication skills
Present information clearly and in an engaging way
Good interpersonal and rapport-building abilities
Have precise and appropriate written communication skills
Good telephone manner
Good listener; can understand the needs of customers and colleagues




For Your Information




Interested? Please send your CV in as a Word format only
Please only apply if you are already eligible to work in the UK (indefinitely & without sponsorship)
Not for you but you know someone suitable? Take advantage of the YourRecruit paid referral fee




Due to the large numbers of responses we receive, despite our best efforts it is not possible to respond to every application. Therefore, only short-listed candidates will be contacted for this particular role and if you haven't heard from us within 7 days please assume you have been unsuccessful on this occasion. Please feel free however to apply for further roles and we will certainly keep your details on file and contact you with suitable vacancies. YourRecruit Ltd does not discriminate on the grounds of age, race, gender or disability and complies with all relevant UK legislation.




To stay safe in your job search we recommend that you visit SAFERjobs, a non-profit, joint industry and law enforcement organisation working to combat job scams. Visit the SAFERjobs website for information on common scams and to get free, expert advice for a safer job search.

  • Not for you but you know someone suitable? Take advantage of the YourRecruit paid referral fee


Due to the large numbers of responses we receive, despite our best efforts it is not possible to respond to every application. Therefore, only short-listed candidates will be contacted for this particular role and if you haven't heard from us within 7 days please assume you have been unsuccessful on this occasion. Please feel free however to apply for further roles and we will certainly keep your details on file and contact you with suitable vacancies. YourRecruit Ltd does not discriminate on the grounds of age, race, gender or disability and complies with all relevant UK legislation.


To stay safe in your job search we recommend that you visit SAFERjobs, a non-profit, joint industry and law enforcement organisation working to combat job scams. Visit the SAFERjobs website for information on common scams and to get free, expert advice for a safer job search.

Title: Data & Insight Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Hi, I’m Simon, our Chief Operating Officer at Mention Me and I’m hiring! Before I tell you more about the role, here's a little bit about Mention Me and what we do.

Becoming a Mentioneer means you’ll be joining our Referral Engineering® movement, which is changing the world of marketing.

Our data-driven referral marketing platform equips brands to drive growth through their fans by encouraging and rewarding personal recommendations.

There’s a good chance you’ve already come across us while online shopping from Puma, Michael Kors, ASOS, Ray Ban, or any other of the 450+ brands we work with.

We’ve delivered more than 5.5m referrals totalling $1.5bn in revenue for our clients.

Now, our mission to make all brands think advocacy-first is stepping up a gear, and you might be just who we need to help us.

The Role

We’re looking for a Data and Insight analyst to join our business, to make sure we’re on top of all the data we use to run the business. You’ll work closely with the finance team, revenue operations and leadership across the business to make sure everyone’s got the data they need at their fingertips. You’ll wrangle datasets into shape, build dashboards and answer a huge array of questions, exploring new hypotheses and generating ideas for what we can learn to improve what we do.

You’ll be joining Mention Me at an exciting time when we’re expanding the business into new geographies and new products. We’ve also put data right at the heart of our core product, so there’s an in-house data science team you can learn modern ML and data science techniques from.

What you’ll do:

Take on responsibility for our existing data warehouse and dashboarding (built in Looker and BigQuery)
Build new dashboards and reports for leaders in the business so that they have access to the data they need to make informed decisions
Make sure all our data is accurate and consistent and available
Field all manner of questions that will require you to explore the data available, visualise it in new ways and prove or disprove hypotheses
Integrate new data sources into our data warehouse


We'd really like to hear from you, if…

You have at least 3 years’ experience of looking after data and analytics in a business/finance context (ideally in a Martech and SaaS business)
Your attention to detail is exemplary, and you never let a discrepancy go unfixed
You can work well across a range of different stakeholders, capturing and prioritising their requirements and delivering against the commitments you make for them
You have experience of creating and managing reporting and dashboarding (ideally using Looker)
You love being hands-on in a scale up environment.


What you’ll get:

Here are some of our favourite perks and benefits, but we have so many more!

🏡 Remote and Hybrid working. We're opening our Boston office very soon, stay tuned.

🧠 Free mental well-being support with a qualified therapist through Spill

📚 An annual learning and development budget

🤲🏾 2 Celebration Days: additional time off for you to celebrate religious days, cultural events, birthdays, anniversaries, or any other significant day that’s important to you

👨‍👩‍👧 Enhanced parental leave

🌴 20 days holiday plus public holidays, alongside additional days for being a Mentioneer

🏆 Monthly prizes for being amazing! Values Awards and Customer Love awards, and Founders’ Award for Awesomeness. Win up to £500 cash, vouchers, meals out and trips away.

🤩 Regular social events, from chocolate-tasting and pottery-making to poker nights and picnics

💻 All the up-to-date tech you’ll need (we love Macs)

👩🏾‍⚕️ Major medical, dental, vision, and life insurance policies.

🫶🏼 Short and long-term disability support

Diversity, equity and inclusion

We celebrate every Mentioneer, exactly as they are. We don’t shy away from breaking down systemic discrimination in society, or from difficult conversations and decisions. We’re committed to being a force for change. You can read more about how we’re doing this and always learning, by looking at our blogs here.

The same goes for our recruitment. We welcome every application, regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, physical ability, family structure, socioeconomic status, age, nationality or citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation or gender identity. If you’d like to find out more about diversity and inclusion at Mention Me, get in touch.
Show more Show less

If you’d like to find out more about diversity and inclusion at Mention Me, get in touch.

Title: DWP Data Analyst
Description:
Change Grow Live are a charity dedicated to the belief that we can make a difference to our Service Users lives, offering support and respect in a safe environment, treating each user as an individual and working with them to find the right treatment and care options.




Our core values are ‘Be open, be compassionate and be bold’ and our team members apply these daily to achieve our mission of helping people change the direction of their lives, grow as individuals, and live life to its full potential.




As a data analyst you will ensure the collection, collation, input, recording, analysis and reporting of data is performed to the highest standard. You will provide expert advice, support and analysis to a range of stakeholders, including Service Managers, Regional Directors, Commissioners, and other Executive functions such as Clinical, Quality, Governance and Innovation.




This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to take the next step in their career with a charity that will support your continued personal and professional development.




Where One of our London services




When We are looking to get the right person into the team ASAP




What we will give to you




25 days holiday (+ bank holidays) rising by 1 day for each years’ service




Flexible working arrangements




Paid ‘Wellness’ hour each week along with a ‘Wellness’ hub and Employee Assist Programme




Contributory pension scheme




A great selection of benefits incl. discounts for shopping, cinema, holidays, etc.




A friendly and supportive team




Training, career development & progression opportunities




About the role




To use data that contributes to service user safety and maximise outcomes.




Ensure timely submissions to the applicable National Drug Treatment Monitoring System (NDTMS) datasets ensuring highest data quality.




To produce reporting external audiences (including commissioners).




To produce regular and ad hoc data, analysis and reporting for internal requirements.




To support the wider contracting and performance management requirements and that information is shared and disseminated in a professional and timely manner.




About you




Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.




Experience of maintaining information systems.




Experience of managing large datasets and analysis.




Experience of developing data processes and systems.




Highly IT literate with good knowledge of Microsoft Office applications.




Previous experience of working with NDTMS is desirable.




Knowledge of the management of data in health and social care sectors, including substance misuse.




Please ensure you clearly demonstrate how you meet the essential criteria on your application as this will be used in the shortlisting process.




Please note This post is subject to a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check




Salary Range (pro rata if part time) CGL points 26 to 30 (£28,547.65 - £32,412.09)




ILW / OLW /FringeLondon Weighting applies (£3,915.44 - £2,080.07)




Closing Date 05/4/2023




Interview Date 17/4/2023




This post is subject to a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) Scheme check at a basic level.




We believe that having diverse people working as part of our team makes us the organisation that we are.




We actively encourage applications from people from all backgrounds to help us to provide the best possible experience for the people who use our services and to make Change Grow Live a great place to work. If you have any feedback on our recruitment processes (good or bad) we’d love to hear from you so that we can make sure they are fair and we attract and recruit the best, most diverse workforce possible.




The safety of vulnerable children, young people and adults is our absolute priority. We will support you in your role to make sure that you are equipped to support the safety of people who use our services and those around them, to the highest standard possible.




CGL points 26 to 30 (£28,547.65 - £32,412.09)




Inner London Weighting (£3,915.44)




17/4/2023




5/4/2023




Danielle Diovisalvi | Danielle.Diovisalvi@cgl.org.uk




This post is subject to a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) Scheme check at a basic level.

You will compile data sets from multiple data sources, and carry out data analysis and deliver timely and accurate outputs to support business needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role type - Permanent, Full-Time

Location - London (4 days on site over 2 weeks)

Salary - £50,828.25

One of our most flexible clients are looking for a a Data Analyst to join thier friendly team.

Responsibilities

Sourcing, manipulating and cleansing companies' financial data and financial market datasets
conducting regular and ad-hoc data analysis, reporting and recommendations to drive strategy and enhanced regulatory scrutiny
leveraging primary and secondary source data using data analytical software to develop and manage internal databases; optimising analytical tools to increase efficiency within the data team
developing new reporting and increasing data streams, working with system suppliers and internal stakeholders to improve the quantity, whilst maintaining quality, and performance measures for various business areas
supporting business teams across the FRC with high quality information
continually reviewing reporting templates to ensure that they are relevant and meaningful
playing a leading role on particular projects and in quality assurance of the work of the team, including set-piece, data publications e.g. Key Facts and Trends in the Accountancy Profession
providing oversight and support to more junior, less experienced colleagues in the team
building understanding in teams across the FRC of how data can support delivery through the development of appropriate data solutions
ensuring that market intelligence and evidence are managed safely, securely, to the required standards and policies, and to best advantage in supporting the FRC's work
supporting the Data Analyst Team Leader in developing the data strategy for ARGA and in continuously developing and improving the market intelligence function to meet the evolving needs of the FRC and the new regulator

The Person

Proven data analytical work experience with demonstratable examples of working with structured data, ideally from company or financial markets datasets.

A degree in a quantitative discipline or other relevant data analyst qualification and experience in performing complex data extraction and analysis to deliver analytical models or reports to aid decision making. Competent and knowledgeable in PowerBI, SQL, Python and/or R. Experience in extracting structured and unstructured data from 3rd party sources is highly desirable.

Curious and inquisitive to learn new tools and find new sources of data. We are looking for individuals who enjoy constructing data warehouses and building 'best in class' data products; and supporting and engaging with the wider analyst community and stakeholders.

A strong understanding of the potential uses and limitations of data - technical and legal/ethical/security - in evidence-based policy making and strategy development. A desire to make a contribution to the FRC's transformation and the Regulator's public interest remit by ensuring 'the quality, accuracy and reliability of corporate reporting, governance and audit which are fundamental to the trust shareholders, investors and the wider public place in companies'. Experience of regulation is desirable but not essential.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have

Advanced MS Excel skills and strong technical knowledge of and experience with SQL, Python and/or R. Working knowledge of reporting tools such as PowerBI
Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development
Good understanding of business terminology, and accounting and financial data
Excellent relationship management skills and experience working proactively with 'client teams' to understand their needs
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including report writing
Ability to handle multiple requests at the same time, prioritising them appropriately
Good organisational and project management skills, including collaborative team working
Willingness to mentor and build the technical capability of more junior staff
Excellent team player with enthusiasm and energy, able to deliver under tight deadlines

McGregor Boyall is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Fully remote - work from home role*

We are looking for immediately available Data Analysts to undertake the task of generating and labelling speech and text data.

Job responsibilities

Deliver and generate high-quality annotated data, using guidelines provided, to meet KPIs, and using in-house tools and software.
Report issues with tools and software as and when they occur.
Maintain strict confidentiality and follow all applicable policies for handling confidential information.

Essential requirements;

Proficiency in English grammar and spelling (both written and verbal)
Strong computer skills, including MS Office, with good typing speed (> 40 wpm and >90% accuracy) and basic troubleshooting abilities.

*Fully remote - work from home role*

Office Angels acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. Office Angels UK is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Office Angels. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explaining how we will use your information is available on our website.

Salary

£11.62/Hourly

*Fully remote - work from home role*

We are looking for immediately available Data Analysts to undertake the task of generating and labelling speech and text data.

Job responsibilities
  • Deliver and generate high-quality annotated data, using guidelines provided, to meet KPIs, and using in-house tools and software.
  • Report issues with tools and software as and when they occur.
  • Maintain strict confidentiality and follow all applicable policies for handling confidential information.
Essential requirements;
  • Proficiency in English grammar and spelling (both written and verbal)
  • Strong computer skills, including MS Office, with good typing speed (> 40 wpm and >90% accuracy) and basic troubleshooting abilities.
*Fully remote - work from home role*

Office Angels acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. Office Angels UK is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Office Angels. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explaining how we will use your information is available on our website.
  • Salary
£11.62/Hourly

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

As featured in Sky News, The Guardian, The Telegraph, Independent and Forbes, Patchwork is an award-winning digital healthcare solution built by doctors, for doctors.

We are a rapidly growing team of 100+ people revolutionising flexible working in the NHS and helping NHS organisations save millions (and counting), by connecting them to an increasing number of flexible bank workers. We help grow their staff banks, remove reliance and spending on locum agencies, and aim to improve the general experience of flexible bank working.

We have been featured on Capsule Insurance's Top 50 Tech Scale-Ups to Watch 2023, recognised as HSJ’s 2022 Staffing Solution of the Year, and recently received the prestigious HSJ Partnership Award and the Spectator’s Economic Innovator of the Year Award.

The Role

We are now looking for a Data Analyst to join our close-knit Data team. You will be working closely with different teams across the business to support clients and stakeholder requests for facts and figures around their staffing usage and further develop and refine our data products to ensure they continue to react to our developing product set and the developing needs of our clients.

Using our industry-leading Patchwork Insights package and other analytical tools, you will be responsible for identifying, manipulating, and interpreting data to help us articulate trends, uncover impacts and identify improvements to help our clients meet their challenges head-on.

Responsibilities

Develop client-facing and internal dashboards
Support clients and colleagues in working through data queries to a successful outcome
Respond to ad-hoc requests for data and analytics
Maintain and support existing dashboards
Identify and where possible resolve limitations in our current data pipelines and tools
Escalate and support the wider Data Team to understand and implement data solutions as necessary
Support colleagues and clients in making the best use of our data products
Where necessary train and demo our data products both internally and externally
Build reports and presentations to articulate points of interest to both internal and external client workshops
Support the wider data team with QA reviews of analysis and content
Undertake regular content reviews to ensure the accuracy of calculations and relevancy of results
Ensure the data team documentation is current and comprehensive


Requirements

Proficient in MS Excel or equivalent
Ability to handle unstructured tasks, such as drawing conclusions from complicated datasets
Highly numerate and analytical with a practical approach to solving problems
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings in a clear and accessible manner both verbally and in writing
Knowledge and experience in using BI/data reporting packages e.g. Amazon Quicksight


Nice to have

Experience in querying databases using SQL
Knowledge and understanding of the UK Health Care market, with experience in the management of healthcare workers in the NHS


Benefits & Remuneration

Salary Range: £30,000 - £45,000

Hybrid office/remote flexible work arrangements - 2 days a month in the office
27 days holiday + bank holidays
Dog-friendly office 
Flexible working hours
Cycle to work Scheme
Pension scheme (Patchwork contributes 5% of salary)
Tech Loan Scheme (Macbook/Laptop + any necessary additional equipment you may require)
EMI Share Option Scheme
Perkbox + Perkbox Medical
Wagestream (get paid on your terms)
Employee Assistance Programme via Health Assured (well-being support)
£250 L&D Budget (autonomous spend - additional L&D supported upon request)
London HQ boasts games, snacks and socials
Travel expenses paid for (ask for more info)
Plus many cultural benefits such as workshops, book clubs, virtual events and more!


The Small Print

Due to the size of our small team, we are unable to provide individual feedback on each application. If you have not heard from us within 2 weeks, unfortunately, you have not been selected for an interview. We pledge to always provide feedback to all applicants who reach the interview stages.

Patchwork recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - Enterprise Software - London (£35k)
Description:
My client is a leading Software Solutions Provider who are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their Data Science and Insight Team.




As part of this team, you will be responsible for the delivery of data from a portfolio of data products. You will work closely with the sales teams and account managers, and will assist by talking to clients to help them interpret the data that is supplied. You will also be part of ongoing efforts to improve the efficiency of the current processes by working collaboratively on innovation.




As you gain experience there will be opportunities to work on a variety of data science and data visualisation projects, which use data to deliver insight and recommendations to clients.




Responsibilities




Develop an in-depth understanding of data and in-house systems.
Code and profile clients’ consumer database
Deliver off-the-shelf and bespoke datasets to aid clients’ understanding of their customers
Contribute to innovation initiatives within the team, which constantly seek to improve efficiencies, develop new propositions, and research new ideas
Support the delivery of a wide range of bespoke data science projects and tools using a range of different environments and languages
Work with a variety of teams, from sales and account managers, through to statisticians and database technicians




Required




The ability to communicate complex concepts in an approachable manner, both written and verbally
Superb analytical and problem-solving skills
An aptitude for coding (ideally Python, SQL or SAS)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Christian Jobs are managing the recruitment process for this position on behalf of Worship.Works. The role itself, will be based with Worship.Works' commercial client in Kent.*




Data Analyst (Christian Ministry)




Salary: £35,000 - £45,000 dependent on experience.

Hours: The role is full time working 40 hours per week.

Place of work: You will work primarily from our client’s office in central Kent, UK with occasional visits to customer sites or other locations.

Term: This is a permanent role subject to completion of probation period.




Fantastic opportunity to use your data research skills to develop insights for multinational commercial clients, while putting your Christian faith into every aspect of your work.

You will join a growing specialist business consultancy providing strategic insights and operating as a faith-based enterprise.




Our client is looking for a Data Analyst who has a personal, active commitment to the Christian faith. The successful candidate will join a team of skilled professionals who minister through their day-to-day work, pray together daily, and use the Bible as a foundation for business and career development. Candidates should be actively involved in a church congregation and have a desire to put faith to work in all areas of life.




As a member of our client’s Insights Team, you will build on your existing research skills and experience to develop unique insights using cutting edge technologies to analyse data.




To succeed in this role, you should have:

Excellent education results.
Minimum 3 years relevant professional experience in qualitative and quantitative data analytics delivering research projects.
Practical experience in understanding clients’ needs in order to design and execute effective research methodologies and writing.
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) and a strong ability to work in teams.




Any of the following skills will be useful in your work as a Data Analyst:

Data science techniques and tools.
Systematic review skills.
Social media analysis and strategy.
Mathematics and statistical analysis.
Market research.
Presentation design including data visualisation.
Knowledge of or experience working within the pharmaceutical industry.
Fluency in foreign languages.
Client relationship management.




Ministry Development

As well as developing your practical skills, you will be enrolled in a comprehensive ministry training programme which includes:

Training modules providing a Biblical foundation for your work-based ministry.
A marketplace ministry peer mentoring programme in which colleagues support each other in their ministry growth.


N.B. There is an occupational requirement for the Data Analyst to have an active personal commitment to the Christian faith. Permitted under Schedule 9, Part 1 of the Equality Act 2010.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst (automations)
Description:
At Gen H, our mission is to give everyone the opportunity to become a homeowner. To achieve this, we're building a homebuying process that is simple, transparent and fair.

We are on a mission to transform the housing market: We're broadening access to homeownership for aspiring buyers, simplifying the home-buying process, and promoting our customers' financial wellbeing through the smarter management of their home finances. Backed by leading institutional & angel investors, we're set for an exceptional 2023.

The challenge is huge, and we are looking for people passionate about delivering fantastic customer outcomes. Working for Gen H means being ambitious in the standards you set for yourself, working with urgency, and owning the outcomes of your work. We expect our people to be humble and communicate openly and honestly with one another.

And that's where you come in:

Your mission

We're looking for a Data Analyst to build state-of-the-art data automations and to provide accurate management information for various teams at Gen H. Your focus will be freeing up our commercial and product teams by automating regular data-related tasks, helping us improve our analytics infrastructure, and building complex dashboards for the senior management team.

Your Role

As Data Analyst, your role will consist of the following:

Developing and maintaining our data automations.
Building our analytics infrastructure using standardised methods in dbt and Looker, staying on top of the constantly evolving data sets.
Building and maintaining complex dashboards for the senior management team.
Working with product and engineering to process new features.
Partnering with other members of the data team, our product managers, and members of the commercial team.


Requirements

You would be an excellent fit as Data Analyst if you have:

Strong experience in analytics using SQL and building automations using Python.
Experience interpreting and building product-related MI dashboards/reports.
2 years experience in data related roles.
A proactive, "can do" attitude - being agile and open to different tasks and priorities.
Accountability over your work, embracing challenges and owning the outcomes.


Logistics

The interview process consists of a:

phone / video call with our recruiter or head of people
1hr technical interview via video with our product analyst
Two 45 minute values interviews on-site with two members of our data and capital markets teams
30 minute final interview with one of our senior managers


What We Have To Offer

£40,000 - £45,000 annual salary
Meaningful equity shares
£1,000 annual training budget
Private Health Care
Enhanced maternity leave
Online mental health support via Spill
25 days of holiday plus bank holidays
Regular Lunch and Learns
Cycle to Work Scheme
£300 yearly BEAM contributions on your behalf
Flexible working (2-3 days a week on-site in our London office)


We want everyone to become a homeowner. To achieve this mission, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We would love to hear from mission-driven candidates from diverse backgrounds who want revolutionise home-buying, so please do reach out! Read more about why we value diversity in our careers page.

Some final guidelines:

Please let us know if you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. We don't receive CVs or Cover Letters by email or LinkedIn messaging.
Show more Show less

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
HEAT is an immersive and innovative ecommerce platform looking for an Insights Analyst, with a high growth-focused mindset. Within the role as Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for not only building out a robust data structure to measure performance across marketing channels both online and offline, but also analyze consumer behaviors beneficial for customer and business growth.

Success as an Insights Analyst at HEAT will see you take ownership of how we analyze and report insights to the wider company. Having a collaborative approach will mean you will showcase findings in cohesive ways, which will lead to stakeholders making better data-led decisions.

In your day-to-day, you will work closely with the Head of Growth building out various analytics dashboards and reports regarding consumer and website data, which will inform various teams on expansion and new opportunities.

Although analyzing post and pre-drop performance across various marketing channels will be core, there will be expected scope to work on internal business processes such as logistics and developing insights which will support future funding rounds.

Responsibilities include:

Analyze sales funnels and customer intent, including cohort Data, CAC and LTV
Develop marketing dashboards and forecasts
Measure ROI of online and offline advertising campaigns
Report on marketing objectives such like revenue, conversion rates, website traffic and more
Recommend website and campaign optimizations based on data
Identify new opportunities in untapped markets
Build out a data framework in preparation for expansion


Requirements

Expertise in Google Analytics, Data Visualization and Shopify Data
Good knowledge of MS Excel
Worked and/or consulted for high-growth startups
In-depth understanding of performance marketing analytics
Team player


Benefits

Competitive Salary
Rare opportunity to join an exciting and rapidly growing business
Flexible Holidays (25 days per year)
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Signicat is a fast-growing cloud-based digital identity platform that enables secure customer authentication and digital signing for organizations. It helps businesses to reduce customer onboarding and authentication friction, streamline document signing, and secure customer data transactions.




About the Role:

We are seeking a motivated and detail oriented individual to join our team as a data analyst. The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology and regulation, and a desire to learn and grow in the exciting field of regulation technology (RegTech). Additionally, the ideal candidate will have the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. The Data Analyst will work closely with client compliance teams and other stakeholders to ensure that clients comply with the required standards and regulations.




What you will do:

Construct dynamic data pipelines (known as workflows) in LUA
Collaborate with clients to understand their unique regulatory requirements and help design solutions to meet their needs
Lead the onboarding process of clients from requirements gathering to end-to-end testing
Picking up and closing tickets via the Zendesk CRM system
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure the smooth delivery of projects
Generate reports and dashboards using the BI tool “Looker” _
Prepare quarterly client presentations highlighting trends and providing recommendations
Produce supporting documents such as design documents, rules libraries, illustrations, etc
Integrate 3rd party APIs into the core platform
Conduct research and analysis on regulatory requirements and industry trends




What we expect:

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field (e.g. computer science, engineering, maths)
Good foundational knowledge of scripting languages (e.g. Python, LUA, JavaScript)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with regulatory compliance and financial crimes prevention is a plus
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint




What we offer:

Competitive salary
Hybrid work
Opportunity to become a part of a passionate team within an international company which is growing fast across Europe
Dedicated time during working hours each week for training and development activities
Dedication to your continuous development and growth through quarterly development talks
Funky office space in central London - Paddington Works, Thursday drinks and so much more
Show more Show less

Title: Research and Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Job Title:




Research and Data Analyst




Directorate/Team




Research, Policy and Communications




Reporting To




Head of Research and Development




Location:




Hybrid, Central London Office




This position will require nationwide travel and overnight stays.




Contract Type




Fixed Term, Contract ends March 2025




Salary




£30 -32K




Benefits




Attractive benefits package including 5% matched contribution pension, free gym membership, Caboodle discount platform, birthday day off and more.




ukactive is the membership organisation representing the fitness, leisure, and wider physical activity sector. It exists to provide expert support to its members on issues of reputational concern, to promote growth and champion the sector through campaigns, to provide business intelligence on sector trends, and to lobby Government to improve members’ operating landscape, ensuring the impact the sector can have on major societal issues is acknowledged and maximised.




The ukactive Research Institute generates and translates physical activity-based evidence to support, protect and inform ukactive members, and to underpin physical activity policy and delivery. This is achieved through partnership working to provide high quality and rigorous research that achieves sector, policy, and academic impact that supports the growth and development of our members within the sector.




General Duties




As Research and Data Analyst you will be responsible for qualitative evaluation delivery of the 'Opening School Facilities’ project, and provide quantitative and qualitative research support across a range of Research Institute projects. You will utilise a range of mixed methods research approaches ensuring the highest standard of data and reporting to internal and external stakeholders.




Opening School Facilities (OSF)




The Opening Schools Facilities (OSF) aims to help schools to open their existing sport facilities, including school swimming pools, for a broader range of young people and to support the wider community by partnering with sporting organisations, who can help deliver activities in these settings.




The three-year investment will ensure that local solutions are sought collaboratively that identify long term changes in behaviour, leading to more people being active in areas that need it the most. Led by the national network of Active Partnerships and supported by ukactive, StreetGames and the Youth Sport Trust, all nine regions of England will benefit from this programme.




The ukactive Research Institute is responsible for capturing information and understanding how children have found the experience of taking part in the programme - this is called 'youth voice’ and forms part of the qualitative evaluation of the programme.




As part of this project you will be responsible for the on the ground data collection and stakeholder / participant engagement of the qualitative 'youth voice’ evaluation, over a two-year period until Spring 2025. You will berequired to build strong relationships with children, activity deliverers and members of school staff (e.g. teachers), in order to capture the relevant information needed.




Specific Tasks And Responsibilities




(these include, but are not limited to:)




OSF Research




Responsible for delivery on the OSF project, involving:
On the ground qualitative data collection from across a sub-sample of OSF schools.
Qualitative data collection with children, parents and / or teachers which includes observational fieldwork, interviews, and focus groups. This evaluation will involve co-design with children and young people.
Stakeholder management and engagement with individuals from schools, Active Partnership deliverers and session leaders, and other relevant stakeholders.
Data storage, collation, analysis and reporting in relation to the qualitative data collected.




Research Institute projects




Support the data collection, data cleaning, analysis, and reporting across research projects.
Work on both internal and external projects.
Clear presentation of research to show the results of analysis in an appropriate, easy to digest format for a range of audiences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salary circa £38,000




Hybrid Working – Remote / London




Full Time (35 hpw)




Our client is the professional body responsible for the specialty throughout the UK. They are the third largest medical royal college in the UK by membership. With a combined membership of more than 24,000 Fellows and Members, they ensure the quality of patient care by safeguarding standards in the three specialties of anaesthesia, intensive care and pain medicine.




They have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join their Education, Training and Examinations department.




This is a key role within the examinations team, providing expertise on all matters relating to examination data transfer and analysis, examination standard setting methods, and psychometric input to results data. Reporting to the Psychometrics and Standard Setting Manager, you will support the data management and production of results for all FRCA and faculty examination deliveries and create regular reports for each exam delivery.




In addition to this, you will also have the opportunity to attend meetings and contribute to the decision-making process on the handling and processing of examination data.




The Successful Candidate Will Have




A degree in Statistics/Psychology/Science/Maths (OR degree with strong quantitative research methods element)
A background in data analysis and experience in producing reports and creating graphical representations of data
Proficiency in IT packages such as Microsoft (Excel in particular)
Ability to quickly gain a firm understanding of new software packages and databases
Ability to deal with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality with tact and discretion
Excellent report writing skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
A commitment to maintaining high customer care standards and organisational values
Ability to work flexible hours




Ideally your experience will be based within the higher or further education sector and you will have previously used other statistical software.




Diversity, equality and inclusion is an integral part of our client's culture so it is important to them that this is reflected in everything that they do. They welcome applications from all individuals irrespective of age, race, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, marital status or parental responsibilities to ensure they actively embrace an inclusive and representative culture that encourages, supports and celebrates our differences.




Unfortunately, due to the volume of applications, our client are unable to provide detailed feedback to candidates on their application. Only short-listed applicants will be contacted after the closing date.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. We’re deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy and fun that reverberates throughout the company.




Our extensive mentorship, education and training programs help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means there’s going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. We’re willing to take risks, fail fast and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.




If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.




About The Role




Leveraged Commentary & Data (LCD) provides news and research on the leveraged finance markets to 80,000 plus subscribers worldwide. The Research Team is responsible for maintaining LCD’s databases, ensuring that not only is information entered in a timely fashion, but also with the utmost attention to accuracy and quality. We are a leading information provider whose success hinges upon producing a best-in-class data and research product.




As an Associate Data Analyst for leveraged loans, you will handle all aspects of data management, including the secondary market data behind LCD's loan indexes, the primary market data behind LCD’s market technicals and investor market data (business development companies (BDCs), collateralized loan obligations (CLOs), etc.). Management of this data is a cornerstone to LCD’s unique content and maintaining our position in market.




Primary Job Responsibilities




Provide support to the analytical team by building and updating leveraged loan and high yield bond profiles in LCD’s proprietary database based upon bank books and prospectuses gathered from the market
Bring together information from market sources such as SEC filings or Ratings Direct and update LCD’s related databases and analysis
Develop an understanding LCD’s production processes for its research reports and analysis
Support senior analysts and other group members for varied data collection processes and analysis
Build your knowledge of the basics of the leveraged finance markets including loans and high yield bonds, including the mechanics of the markets, syndication processes and documentation
Support the vision and values of the company through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested




Skills And Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, accounting or equivalent experience
2+ years experience in an analytical role in financial services is strongly preferred
Strong attention to detail, particularly with regards to the ability to accurately handle data
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to be an independent self-starter in a fast-paced environment
Intellectual curiosity and dedication to learn about financial markets
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Power Point. Access is a plus
Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data




Benefits At PitchBook




Physical Health




Private medical insurance
Dental scheme
Additional medical wellness incentives
Life cover




Emotional Health




Paid sabbatical program after four years
Paid parental leave
Education subsidies
Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
Minimum 25 days annual leave and volunteer days




Social Health




Employee resource groups
Company-wide events
Employee referral bonus program
Quarterly team building events




Financial Health




8% Pension contribution
Income protection
Shared ownership employee stock program
Transportation stipend
Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.




Life At PB




We are consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work and our culture is at the heart of our success. It’s our fundamental belief that people do and create great things and that people are the cornerstone of prosperity. We believe that proactively seeking out different points of view, listening to others, learning and reflecting on what we’ve heard creates a sense of belonging within PitchBook and strengthens the PitchBook community.




We are excited to get to know you and your background. Concerned that you might not meet every requirement? We encourage you to still apply as you might be the right candidate for the role or other roles at PitchBook.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: networx | Recruitment Software & Services by IRIS
Description:
Overall Summary

Close Brothers Asset Finance & Leasing (CBAFL) are embarking on an exciting transformational journey that will have a significant impact on the wider organisation over the next 2-3 years. As part of this journey we are investing in data related capabilities delivering a new warehouse, tools, policies, and standards.

The Data Analyst role is centred around data visualisation, reporting, and data quality. You will

Champion the use of Tableau and provide interactive dashboards and reports to inform strategic decision-making
Implement data quality metrics and help to create solutions to data challenges across the business
Develop a knowledge repository of business processes to help facilitate an understanding of the data lifecycle

Responsibilities

This is a role that requires interaction and partnership with leaders across the business. You will design and produce visually compelling reports and dashboards using reporting tools, applications, and queries/scripts using SQL Server, Tableau, Alteryx, and Snowflake platforms. These reports will help CBAFL to manage data, ensure high levels of data quality, report on policy adherence and provide operational insight.


Duties Will Include

Identify & gather reporting requirements, working with the business to guide and recommend reports and KPIs, to design and deliver the most impactful dashboards
Work on extending the suite of interactive Tableau dashboards to sit on top of CBAFL’s new data warehouse
Assist in the functional testing of Business Intelligence deliverables, identify, and manage defect resolution with the development team
Present dashboards to stakeholders at a variety of levels, and working with the business users to generate critical BI Insights needed to manage and optimise business outcomes
Assist colleagues using Tableau, demonstrating how to interact with readymade reports and report writing, proactively encouraging, and embedding the use of Tableau within the organisation
Help to resolve data quality issues with business representatives, under strict data governance controls
Ensure alignment between CBAFL and wider Bank policies and standards and prepare appropriate inputs & reports for various data related bodies.
Become the senior SME for Tableau in the Data Team and take on the responsibility for taking Tableau reporting to the next level by both improving what AFL currently have and how they're leveraging the tool as well as building new functionality
Supporting the Data Team in implementing data management activities such as data ownership, stewardship, data governance, data quality and data lineage etc
Helping senior Business stakeholders to understand and manage data as a strategic asset, ensuring alignment to overall data management & governance controls to sustain the integrity of data for the organisation and enable effective business intelligence & reporting

Risk & Compliance

Ensure that all Governance and Compliance requirements are adhered to and all reporting and reviewing activities required by the Regulatory Bodies are carried out to the standards required

We Would Love To Hear From You If

Strong experience gathering and reflecting stakeholder requirements in the technical solutions which are designed and asking the correct questions to ensure the most effective reports and dashboards are designed
Significant experience in using Tableau and SQL
Experience building interactive dashboards and reports
Strong analytical acumen with the ability to uncover insights and create stories by seamlessly integrating a variety of data sources
Be approachable and flexible, with a passion for delivering high levels of service
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to communicate well to differing levels of management
Able to take the initiative and progress tasks
Be able to time manage effectively and meet deadlines
A results-oriented mindset with an eye for detail
Experience of working within a data management framework (e.g. DAMA, DMM) - desired
Experience of developing data models (conceptual/logical) - desired
SQL (must-have)
Tableau (must-have, or similar BI platform)
Data visualisation
Advanced Excel
Snowflake (desired)
Python (desired)

We are an inclusive organisation and committed to ensuring our recruitment process is as accessible as possible to everyone. We will make adjustments for people who have a disability or long-term condition. If you need the job description or application form in an alternative format or would like to discuss the recruitment process with us, please email us at or request a call back.

About Us

For roles offering hybrid working: At Close Brothers we support employees to balance their work life priorities and in this role you will be able to enjoy a mixture of hybrid working.

Close Brothers is a leading UK merchant banking group providing lending, deposit taking, wealth management services and securities trading. At Close Brothers we provide financial support and advice to small businesses and individuals in the UK. Our purpose is to help the people and businesses of Britain thrive over the long term.

To find out more about Close Brothers, please visit our careers page: https://www.closebrothers.com/careers

To Find Out More About Life At Close Brothers

https://www.closebrothers.com/life-close-brothers#374017299-899295541

To Find Out More About Our Benefits

https://www.closebrothers.com/employee-benefits

To find out more about our commitment to creating an inclusive environment:

https://www.closebrothers.com/inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to work with an international children’s charity working with children, their communities, and with supporters and partners, in almost 100 countries.




Position: Data Analyst




Salary: £30,000 - £35,000 per annum, depending on experience + good range of benefits




Contract: Permanent – 36.5 hours per week – part time or flexible working considered




Location: Homebased / flexible with occasional travel to Milton Keynes




About The Role




As Data Analyst you would be using your amazing data skills to help unlock new opportunities found within the charity’s data and equip teams with the data and insight needed to transform their individual giving programme.




You would be partnering closely with marketing teams to deliver real actionable insights that fuels growth in both acquisition and retention activities with the end goal of improving the overall value of the supporter base. And by working alongside different teams they will look to your unique talents to help guide them to make the best possible decisions.




About You




You will using your unique talent of proven data analytics to solve problems that are evenly matched by your ability to manage powerful collaborations with your business partners. We need you to get people fired up around the insights you uncover!




Your experience in managing relationships at different levels along with the ability to influence decision making will be paramount in ensuring this role is successful. You’ll work closely with marketing teams to help them write sharp data briefs and to be clear on what the problem is that they need to solve.




Key Skills And Experience Include




Proven experience in Data Analytics, Data mining and the use of trend analysis techniques/models
Ability to use SQL, statistical programs (e.g. R) and other programming languages (e.g.Python)
Working knowledge of large databases in order to select, extract and transform relevant information
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Advanced Excel skills
Strong understanding of what makes a marketing campaign successful (knowledge of fundraising would be an advantage but not essential)
Strong Influencing skills with the ability to present complex problems in a simple & straightforward way.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as PowerBI would be beneficial




If you feel you have the necessary skills and would like to put these to use working for an amazing charity that really makes a difference to the lives of children, then apply today!

Title: Cyber Data Analyst - £45k – London
Description:
Cyber Data Analyst - £45k – London




Data Analyst required by leading specialist insurance company based in central London. The role holder will join a growing cyber practice and become an integral part of the team delivering exceptional advice to our clients through the development of bespoke analytical tools.




This is a London based role with hybrid working arrangements (2-3 days per week in the office near Liverpool Street), paying £45k per annum plus benefits.




The role lies within a growing, dynamic, and fast-paced company; this role will suit someone who is looking to make an impact, and help with to develop and shape the data analytics proposition. This is a great opportunity to build a diverse set of skills in an environment at the cutting-edge of our industry, with exposure to different business areas, senior management, and clients.

Key skills and experience:

Previous success in a data-driven role with proven ability in using Excel and/or business intelligence to at least an intermediate level
Proficiency in a standard data visualisation tool (e.g. Power BI, Tableau) with demonstrable knowledge of data visualisation and design
SQL
Experience of the following would be highly advantageous:
R or Python
Power Query (M)
Data Analysis Expressions (DAX)
Microsoft BI Stack; SSRS, TSQL, SSIS, Power BI, Tabular




This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to join a growing cyber practices with a market leading insurance company. The role is hybrid working and pays £45k per annum.

Title: Data Analyst – Transport & Logistics
Description:
A global energy and utilities business are searching for a Dutch speaking Data Analyst to join their Logistics and Transport team.




The firm have recently appointed one of the most formidable leaders in the energy industry to spearhead a £10bn overhaul of the organisation to accomplish the firm’s mission to secure natural gas and power supplies for Europe.




The successful candidate will be responsible for analysing and visualising data to gain meaningful insights that can be used to optimise the company's transport and logistics operations.




*This role is available in London, Den Bosch or Manchester * - The role offers flexible hybrid working.




The Data Analyst will:




Embark on a mission to improve operational efficiency by analysing, visualising and presenting insights to optimise the transport and logistics chain for power and hydrocarbons. This involves gathering, blending and transforming data from various sources, including internal data sources and external sources.
Understand and review nominations allocation and imbalance positions, as well as work closely with others to identify any issues causing profit leakage.
Become the leading expert on the energy logistics supply chain capacity to ensure efficient pricing and identify any optimisation possibilities.
Work collaboratively across Portfolio Management, Sales, Risk and Finance teams to mitigate risks and identify opportunities to add value.
Collaborate internally on clean energy certificate exposures and approach to balancing certificates to regulatory/legal requirements.




Requirements for the role:

A degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related STEM topics.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data.
Knowledge of database query languages
Familiarity with various software programs and tools used for data analysis and visualization, such as Python, R, Tableau, etc.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in Dutch and English.
Experience in the Energy, transport or logistics industries is highly desirable.




The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work with a diverse team of professionals in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. If you have the required skills and experience, we look forward to receiving your application

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A data solution analyst generally works on implementing complex data projects with a focus on collecting, parsing, managing, analyzing, and visualizing large sets of data to turn information into insights using multiple platforms. He or she should be able to decide on the needed hardware and software design needs and act according to the decisions. The big data engineer should be able to develop prototypes and proof of concepts for the selected solutions.

Ideal candidate for this role is someone with a strong background in computer programming, who is eager to tackle problems with large, complex datasets using the latest SQL, python, or Spark. You are a self-starter who will take ownership of your projects and deliver high-quality data-driven analytics solutions. You are adept at solving diverse business problems by utilizing a variety of different tools, strategies, algorithms, and programming languages.

Specific responsibilities are as follows:

Strong analytical & logical skills
Utilize the data skills within and outside of the developing Chubb information ecosystem for discovery, analytics and data management
Work with data scientists, architects, business partners and business analysts to understand requirements, design and build effective solutions
Understanding of P&C insurance processes, risk data attributes and concepts such as Limits, Exposure bases, Coverages, Packaged, Rating Factors, etc. Experienced in identifying, capturing, profiling & analyzing data from multiple sources (internal and external).
Skilled in identifying remediation solutions for addressing data issues. Experience in documenting data capture requirements, source to target mappings, data flow diagrams, entity relationships and complex data models. Experienced in translating business needs into systems requirements including rating systems, reports, dashboards and scorecards with minimal or no supervision
Work with various relational and non-relational data sources with the target being Azure based SQL Data Warehouse & Cosmos DB repositories
Sourcing data from multiple applications, profiling, cleansing and conforming to create master data sets for analytics use
Design solutions for managing highly complex business rules within the Azure ecosystem
Experience working/creating Rule Engines


Qualifications

Skills Required

Extensive experience working with Data APIs (Working with RESTful endpoints and/or SOAP)
Knowledge of any commercial distribution like Horton Works, Cloudera, MapR, DataBricks etc. a must
Excellent working knowledge of relational databases, MySQL, Oracle etc.
Hands on experience of ETL tools like Informatica and SSIS is preferred
Good knowledge of Python libraries like Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn etc.
Ready to learn new technologies and tools


Qualifications/Experience

Bachelor’s in computer science or related educational background
Prior experience of Insurance domain a huge plus
5+ years of experience


Flexible Working

We are open to discussing flexible working arrangements. This can be discussed with the Recruitment Business Partner managing this position.

Integrity. Client focus. Respect. Excellence. Teamwork

Our core values dictate how we live and work. We’re an ethical and honest company that’s wholly committed to its clients. A business that’s engaged in mutual trust and respect for its employees and partners. A place where colleagues perform at the highest levels. And a working environment that’s collaborative and supportive.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Chubb we consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness and respect, regardless of their age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or family circumstances.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: London - SW1V 2QX, Glasgow -G2 8JX, Durham -DH1 1SL, Lytham St Annes -FY8 4TS




Salary: c£40,500 per annum (Outside London) c£43,750 per annum (London)




Our client is one of the largest savings organisations in the UK with 25 million customers and more than £202 billion invested. They are both a government department and an Executive Agency of the Chancellor of the Exchequer. Our origins can be traced back over 150 years to 1861.




Job Summary




As an expert on the organisation's customer and product data and how it can be analysed and modelled, to produce analysis and reporting which can be used to provide stakeholders with the insight and information they need.




To support the business achieve its objectives through the production and delivery of information, analysis and insight relating to customers and their behaviours and interactions.




Essential Experience, Technical Knowledge And Skills




Substantial experience of business to consumer relational database analysis, report building and data mining
Substantial experience in undertaking analysis and data mining with a tool/language such as R or SAS
In depth knowledge and practical experience of producing dashboards and analysis with Tableau or another data visualisation tool
Ability to interpret data and analysis that has been produced, summarise findings and convert into easily consumable insights for non-data literate stakeholders
A good understanding of predictive modelling, segmentation and other statistical analysis
Advanced knowledge of Excel and good working knowledge of PowerPoint




Behaviours




You'll be assessed against these behaviours during the selection process:




Communicating and Influencing
Delivering at Pace
Managing a Quality Service
Changing and Improving




Technical Skills




You'll be assessed against these behaviours during the selection process:




Communicating and Influencing
Delivering at Pace
Managing a Quality Service
Changing and Improving




Benefits




A small company with a big reach, the organisation offer a range of benefits to include flexible working, great opportunities for development and a generous pension scheme. They care for colleagues, respect one another, invest in their people and manage talent effectively.




Some Of The Benefits Include




Learning and development tailored to your role
An environment with flexible hybrid working options
9 day fortnight scheme
A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
A Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
Generous annual leave – starting at 25 days, increasing to 30 days
Performance related variable pay bonus
Enhanced Maternity, paternity, adoption and shared parental leave.




To Apply




If you feel you are a suitable candidate and would like to work for this reputable organisation, then please proceed through the following link to be redirected to their website where you can complete your application.




https://www.civilservicejobs.service.gov.uk/csr/index.cgi?SID=c2VhcmNoc29ydD1zY29yZSZvd25lcj01MDcwMDAwJm93bmVydHlwZT1mYWlyJnBhZ2VhY3Rpb249dmlld3ZhY2J5am9ibGlzdCZ1c2Vyc2VhcmNoY29udGV4dD0yNzY0NTYzNCZzZWFyY2hwYWdlPTEmam9ibGlzdF92aWV3X3ZhYz0xODQzMTQyJnBhZ2VjbGFzcz1Kb2JzJnJlcXNpZz0xNjc3ODU4MTg3LTgyZDdhNTM0YTg2ZTg0ZWQzZjFiZDI3NWQ3MzM4YzRiZWUwODBhMjU

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
JR DATA ANALYST







ROLE IS REMOTE – TEAM SITS IN THE GREATER SEATTLE AREA




UP TO $35.68/HR COMPENSATION RATE (depending on experience)




OUR COMPANY – MURPHY & ASSOCIATES

Murphy & Associates has had the privilege of providing technology and business consulting services to over 150 diverse clients in the Greater Seattle Area since 1980. We take great pride in our full disclosure model and low margins which attracts top tier talent. We are transparent with our employees. Our business model fosters loyalty, satisfaction, and consistent delivery of quality services from the consultants on our team. Through it all, Murphy & Associates has stayed true to its roots, partnering with highly qualified technology and business consultants and working closely with our clients, fairly and ethically.




THE CLIENT

Our client is a technology company located in the Greater Seattle Area.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Executes project work and has zero or little experience. Responsible for data de-duplication (matching and merging data), data cleansing (matching, linking, updating records, such as organization records, in batch and real time), hierarchy management (identifying, creating, correcting, update, and maintaining complex relationships among parent and child records), and data conversion (changing / transforming the data based on business rules, usually done before the data is integrated into a new system). Also raises escalations and communicates issues to DOC Project Lead.




TOP 3 SKILLS

Power Bi (at least 1 year)
Good data modeling and data models experienced (real life data). ex: tableau, zoho, business intelligence tools, C-Beyond (at least 1 year)
Teamwork and be able to work with a diverse group of members. (at least 1 year)




CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

Years of Experience: At least 1 year of Power Bi experience or someone right outside of college.

Qualifications:

Undergraduate or Master studies student with high GPA.
Proficiency in English (verbal and written).
Advanced computer literacy.
Team-oriented attitude and excellent interpersonal skills.
Commitment to accuracy, quality, and attention to details.
Prefer Power BI or similar data analytics tool competency.

Degree/Certs: Bachelor’s degree is a plus.

Disqualifiers: N/A

Best: Have a data analytics background in schooling, spent some time working on projects with deep data analytics in industry, building dashboards and data analytics programs. Fit for culture on the team: teamwork, self-starter with limited direction needed.

PI:

Quality of work around the dashboards created.
Quality of data, making sure there is no gaps in the data.




WORK ENVIRONMENT

Start & End: 5/1/2023 – 6/30/2023.

Schedule: M-F, 40 hrs a week, no OT expected.

Typical Tasks:

25% Meetings and customer engagement shadowing PMs on the team.
40% Power BI and other analytic work: building dashboards.
Rest: data input, data cleansing, and heads down work.

Interaction Level:

Sponsor: low, weekly one to ones for check ins.
Members on the team: PMs: moderate, regular touch points.

Work Environment: Remote.

Extension: Chance to extend.




BENEFITS

We offer the opportunity to participate in health, dental, and vision insurance, along with a 401k and PTO.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by applying here with your LinkedIn profile.

KEYWORDS

Power BI, PowerBI, Data Analyst, Tableau, Zoho, Business Intelligence tools, C-Beyond
