Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Must- Haves;

- 5+ years data modeling experience at an enterprise level / for enterprise client

- Strong experience with Oracle Database

- Strong experience with SQL databases

- Experience working with legacy systems

- Azure data cloud experience

- Agile Scrum experience, working within sprints

- Extensive Data bricks, data factor and data lakes experience

- Experience modelling data, consolidating data, ingesting data from on prem to cloud azure







Plusses:

-Talend, experience

- IRWIN

- Guidewire

- Insurance







Day-to-day:

An enterprise insurance client in Markham is looking to bring on a strong Data Modeler to come in and model data, consolidate data from a variety of servers for their guidewire policy and claim modernization and transformation program. The successful candidate with have extensive data factory, data brick and data lakes experience, migrating and modeling data from on prem legacy systems to cloud azure. Will be consolidating data from different services e.g oracle and legacy systems. They will be working in an agile scrum environment, working closely with data engineer, ETL developers for this core modernization program. One the data is consolidated, and modeled they will pass this on to the ETL Developers for deployment.

Title: Data Analysis Standards Specialist
Description:
Background




Looking for a Data Standards Specialist with proven experience in data analysis and reporting using Roche and CDISC ADaM standards and ability to collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders at the molecule/indication project level (PDD and beyond).




The ideal candidate will join the Data Analysis subteam of Data Standards and Governance (DSG) and help shape our global data standards to enable automation and FAIR data!




Main responsibility will be to develop ADaM specifications to support standard analyses at the TA/indication level, in collaboration with cross-functional SMEs within the Pharma Data Governance Biomedical Domain.




As Biomedical Data Standards Specialist (BDSS), your main responsibilities are to:




Develop analysis dataset (ADaM) specifications to support standard analyses at the TA/indication level, in collaboration with cross-functional SMEs within the Pharma Data Governance Biomedical Domain
Develop standard TLG template and endpoint derivation specifications, also in collaboration with Pharma Data Governance SMEs
Maintain analysis standards metadata in GDSR for use in our clinical trials, data marts and technology projects (e.g., Project Botany-Orchid Garden, Frictionless Insights-Admiral)
Collaborate with other BDSS from DSG and cross-functional SMEs from PD, gRED, pRED and Medical Affairs under the Pharma Data Governance Framework to develop beginning-to-end standards from data collection to data analysis, in one or more disease areas




Skills/Experience




Senior ADS with extensive experience in data analysis and reporting, leading molecule programs (establishing project/molecule standards) or filing
Understanding the usage of Knowledge Graphs (or ability to adopt the technology) is helpful as the GDSR metadata is stored in graph
Proficiency in R strongly desired; could help bridge Orchid Garden and Admiral




This role comes with endless opportunities to enhance your leadership skills and broaden your impact, contributing to continuous improvement of our internal work processes and tools. As a group DSG helps drive a culture based on FAIR data principles across the Roche organization.




Must Have Skills




Well versed in CDISC ADaM standards
Solid experience in statistical programming for data analysis and reporting, establishing project/molecule standards, or filing
Communication and effective stakeholder interaction




Notes




Experience in I2ON studies is helpful but not required; current focus areas as determined in collaboration with Data Sciences TA Squads include multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer's disease, respiratory diseases, inflammatory bowel disease, ophthalmology, lupus and multiple myeloma
Show more Show less
HTML:
Background


Looking for a Data Standards Specialist with proven experience in data analysis and reporting using Roche and CDISC ADaM standards and ability to collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders at the molecule/indication project level (PDD and beyond).


The ideal candidate will join the Data Analysis subteam of Data Standards and Governance (DSG) and help shape our global data standards to enable automation and FAIR data!


Main responsibility will be to develop ADaM specifications to support standard analyses at the TA/indication level, in collaboration with cross-functional SMEs within the Pharma Data Governance Biomedical Domain.


As Biomedical Data Standards Specialist (BDSS), your main responsibilities are to:


  • Develop analysis dataset (ADaM) specifications to support standard analyses at the TA/indication level, in collaboration with cross-functional SMEs within the Pharma Data Governance Biomedical Domain
  • Develop standard TLG template and endpoint derivation specifications, also in collaboration with Pharma Data Governance SMEs
  • Maintain analysis standards metadata in GDSR for use in our clinical trials, data marts and technology projects (e.g., Project Botany-Orchid Garden, Frictionless Insights-Admiral)
  • Collaborate with other BDSS from DSG and cross-functional SMEs from PD, gRED, pRED and Medical Affairs under the Pharma Data Governance Framework to develop beginning-to-end standards from data collection to data analysis, in one or more disease areas


Skills/Experience


  • Senior ADS with extensive experience in data analysis and reporting, leading molecule programs (establishing project/molecule standards) or filing
  • Understanding the usage of Knowledge Graphs (or ability to adopt the technology) is helpful as the GDSR metadata is stored in graph
  • Proficiency in R strongly desired; could help bridge Orchid Garden and Admiral


This role comes with endless opportunities to enhance your leadership skills and broaden your impact, contributing to continuous improvement of our internal work processes and tools. As a group DSG helps drive a culture based on FAIR data principles across the Roche organization.


Must Have Skills


  • Well versed in CDISC ADaM standards
  • Solid experience in statistical programming for data analysis and reporting, establishing project/molecule standards, or filing
  • Communication and effective stakeholder interaction


Notes


  • Experience in I2ON studies is helpful but not required; current focus areas as determined in collaboration with Data Sciences TA Squads include multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer's disease, respiratory diseases, inflammatory bowel disease, ophthalmology, lupus and multiple myeloma

Title: Build your Data Analytics Portfolio
Description:
Project Overview




Over the past year, your employer has experienced a decline in the number of returning customers and a corresponding decline in revenue. To investigate, the company leveraged customer feedback and surveys and determined that the decline in retention rates is likely due to a combination of factors, including; a lack of variety in our product offerings, poor customer service, and increased competition from other retailers. As a Data analyst, your employer invites you to explore the factors contributing to the decline in retention rates and identify potential solutions to improve retention and increase revenue.




Project Mentor




Eliud Nduati




Data Analyst




Project Tasks




To begin solving the challenge at hand, you will undertake the following steps;




Part #1




Data Cleaning and Processing




Clean, organize and prepare data for analysis & building narratives.




Part #2




Data Modeling




Visualize data to build trends, patterns, and statistics to identify factors contributing to low customer retention.




Part #3




Data Analysis and Reporting




Use data insights, patterns & statistical evidence to propose solutions to increase customer retention.




Project Takeaways




Gain hands-on experience with real-world data analytics.
Leverage analytical tools to propose solutions that aid business development.
Get feedback on your project from data experts in a 1:1 mentoring session.
Build a portfolio that makes you stand out to recruiters.
Earn a certificate upon completing the project.




‍How will this project help you?




This project will empower you to:




Analyze customer feedback to make informed business decisions.
Leverage data analysis to identify blockers in customer retention & propose solutions.
Enhance your decision-making abilities by using data to forecast potential outcomes of various solutions.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Exciting long term opportunity to be part of a leading enterprise organization. We are looking for a strong Data Engineer.

The Data Engineer is responsible for the development of highly scalable ETL and data flow applications adhering to software development best practices. This position requires advanced SQL scripting who understands data visualization. You will design Data Warehouses in modern column-oriented database systems and develop data reporting solutions.

Advantages

Work within a large enterprise environment and a great technical team who are like minded. You will will be part of the IT Analytics team and will work closely with Architects, Scrum master, other members of the team and the business partners in a highly collaborative environment.

Responsibilities

Develop ETL processes delivering high-quality code, following coding best practices.
Create and implement complex analytical data models that support reporting and analytics business requirements.
Prepare test scripts and perform functional unit, integration, and regression testing. Coordinate and drive user acceptance testing
Support and troubleshoot issues/bugs in data pipeline and SQLs for analytics
Analyze the use of data, design and create data marts based on requirements.
Design and build reporting solutions.
Experiment with new/emerging technologies in the space and conduct POCs
Work with Functional/Business resources on day-to-day basis to understand business requirements and processes.
Work with Technical Lead/Architects to identify solutions/designs based on business requirements provided.
Provide status reports to Manager/Leads during task execution
Follow IT standards to deploy code to production environments


Qualifications

5-8 Experience in Data Engineering development and best practices.
Experience in Data completeness and accuracy checks and setup.
Accomplished expert SQL Skills to include data management, mining, and modeling
Advanced SQL knowledge, database, and data modeling knowledge are a must.
Strong business acumen, understanding of data and information.
Experience in Google Cloud Platform especially at BigQuery, Airflow, pubsub, and dataflow are preferred.
Excellent communication skills
Demonstrated ability to write technical documents.
Ability to communicate issues and recommend solutions in a timely manner to Management.
Retail experience will be considered an asset.
Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and development practices
Experience with a variety of database platforms and technologies.


Summary

If you feel this role is what you are looking for, then don't hesitate to apply to randstsad.ca for immediate consideration.

Good luck

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - MBC
Description:
59216

Position Summary

The Senior Data Analyst is a role defined within the Global Data and Analytics Center of Excellence, which provides design, development, consulting and support services to European, North American, South American, Middle East and Asia-Pacific markets.

The Center of Excellence is formed of experts in Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse software platforms, Data Architecture, Data Engineering, Data Visualization and Data Science.

The Senior Data Analyst will design and develop modern and innovative Global Analytics solutions to support Martin Brower’s strategic product and service offerings. In addition, this role will assist in establishing and enforcing the use of design and development best practices across those solutions. This role reports to the Lead Data Analyst.

Position Responsibilities May Include, But Not Limited To

Design and develop Global Reports and Analytics using modern data visualization tools
Work with business stakeholders to define data and report specifications
Understand and prioritize business requirements while managing the expectations of stakeholders
Align disparate business teams and stakeholders in the use of common Global Analytics metrics and standards
Apply modern UI/UX design to customer-facing analytics solutions that helps drive adoption
Define and advocate analytics best practices in the areas of data modeling, data wrangling, data visualization and data storytelling
Work closely with key business stakeholders to anticipate future data and analytics needs and strategic opportunities
Execute a portfolio of analytics projects that enable growth of the Martin Brower business, including enabling technologies such as self-service discovery and analytics that make it easier for Martin Brower personnel to use data to drive decisions, reduce costs, and optimize Martin Brower supply chain processes
Establish strong, strategic partnerships with key IT contacts, supply chain partners, Martin Brower senior leadership, and end users
Participate in Martin Brower global data governance processes to ensure data is both managed and used consistently and is compliant with enterprise standards
Participate in and drive strategy and execution for projects as appropriate
Ensure the operations follow all Safe Food for Canadians Regulations (SFCR), Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI) and Good Warehouse Practices (GWP)/Good Drivers Practices (GDP) for transport rules and regulations
Other projects or duties as assigned

Required Skills And Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or related field
Strong understanding of business process analytics and/or business process management, including common methods for deriving business value from data
Deep understanding and hands-on development experience within the Microsoft Power BI application, including data refresh methods, data modeling, data transformation, DAX functions, visualization techniques, content deployment and administration
Understanding and experience with application of modern UI/UX interfaces within data visualization solutions
This position must pass a post-offer background check
At least 4 years of experience in a business or business-facing IT role within a global or multinational organization, in which the following occurred:
Demonstrated capabilities for analyzing business needs and finding solutions
Demonstrated knowledge and real-world application of modern Business Intelligence tools
Demonstrated experience developing and maintaining sophisticated analytics solutions in Microsoft Power BI
Developed customer-facing business reports and dashboards using modern data visualization and UI/UX techniques
Defined and/or employed the use of report design best practices in the areas of dimensional data modeling, UI/UX, and report performance
Worked successfully in both Customer- and Business-facing roles
Gathered business requirements and translated into data and/or report specifications
Conceptualized efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems
Developed both functional and technical subject matter expertise
Proven ability to collaborate with IT and business teams working at remote locations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical subjects to non-technical audiences
Ability to travel as needed for projects (estimated to be 10% per year)
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Preferred Skills And Experience

Post graduate degree
Technical Certification
Experience with the common application of Supply Chain KPIs and analytics
Experience working both in a business and IT role
Experience as a liaison between IT and business
Experience within the distribution or Food Service industry
Familiarity with data science concepts like statistical modeling, machine learning and forecasting models with an ability to explain them to non-technical audiences

Physical Demands And Work Environment

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Due to the nature of our business in regard to such things as delivery schedules, order inputs, selection, and Department of Transportation Hours of Service, overtime, attendance and punctuality are essential job functions. Should an individual in this classification not be able to adhere to this requirement due to a disability, they should contact their Human Resources department to see what, if any, reasonable accommodation may be made.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Thentia

Thentia is a fast-growing, venture capital-backed software as a service (SaaS) company that is emerging as a world leader in government technology with a platform that is transforming and modernizing how regulatory organizations are conducting business. A company of builders, thinkers, and owners, Thentia gives employees the opportunity to create amazing solutions, showcase their talents, and benefit from our shared success as we scale up in the U.S., Canadian, and global markets. Further, Thentia’s solutions directly impact public trust and regulatory integrity, helping regulators and agencies meet 21st century standards by leveraging predictive analytics, Big Data, AI, and other innovative capabilities. Internally, our culture fosters collaboration, inclusivity, intellectual curiosity, and professional development.




About The Role:

Senior Data Analysts support the Customer Success team by conducting data analysis requirements workshops with clients to understand their current data platforms, data structures, and data complexities and provide guidance to clients to facilitate the transfer of client data to secure Thentia environments. Senior Data Analysts will leverage data analysis tools and data management techniques to ensure client data is properly mapped from client legacy platforms to Thentia’s target platform, once data is received from clients. Senior Data Analysts will also be involved in shaping the Data Management team’s overall process evolution and contributing data management process improvement ideas as Thentia looks to build the Data Management team.




The Senior Data Analyst should have a thorough understanding of data management, data visualization, and knowledge of data migration tools and processes to succeed in this role. Understanding licensing processes and procedures is extremely beneficial to this role.




Taking a product-oriented approach, you will assist the client by becoming a subject matter expert of our product’s features and functions and how they relate to various data structures and data tables.




Responsibilities:

Independently map data from legacy to target platform accurately and with speed
Identify tools and processes that will enable efficiency in data mapping and movement
Collaborate with client subject-matter experts to understand and meet the regulatory requirements of the organization
Gain a firm knowledge of the portals, features, processes, and capabilities of Thentia Cloud to assist the client through the product delivery
Communicate and create visual representations of our data structures
Plan and facilitate data movement and collaborate with the project team and the client for their identified projects
Document all mapping information in the appropriate tools for traceability
Identify and lead the resolution of data-related issues; devise effective ways of reaching project objectives in the most cost/time-effective manner while taking into account unique business conditions for the client
Provide data-driven insights and analytical support in solving strategic and operational problems
Be responsible for the successful data transformation and loading of all client data. into Thentia’s platform while advising Thentia’s development team to execute data loading activities
Work with QA to ensure they are able to conduct thorough testing




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline; or equivalent experience
At least 5+ years professional experience within the Data Analysis discipline
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to lead and facilitate client-facing data discussions
Experience working with data management and visualization tools (e.g., SQL, Power BI, Python, Tableau, Qlik, Datorama)
Advanced knowledge of Excel (e.g., Pivot tables and VLOOKUP)
Knowledge and experience with agile work environments
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Work well with a diverse team in a fast-paced environment
Excellent time management, written and verbal communication skills
Exceptionally organized with strong attention to detail
Experience with task scheduling and resource allocation




Assets:

Knowledge of regulatory processes and working experience with the regulatory industry
Familiarity with the Office 365 suite
Project Management tools (Jira, ClickUp, Daptiv, Wrike, Basecamp)




We thank all applicants in advance for applying. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.




Compensation

Thentia provides employees with a competitive base salary along with:

Full Health Insurance coverage
Flexible paid-time-off, including vacation and wellness days
Parental Leave
Year-end bonus potential
Remote or Hybrid working options (as position allows)
Professional development & training, including Udemy Business




Our Commitment:

Thentia is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We are building products for a diverse world and are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard, which enables us to make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, provincial, or local laws in the regions we operate. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, or internships.

Title: Lead I - Data Analysis
Description:
Job Description

Lead I - Data Analysis

Who We Are

Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.

UST is a mission-driven group of over 29,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in over 30+ countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live.

With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.

Visit us at UST.com .

You Are

UST is searching for a Data Analyst who will Provide expertise in data analysis techniques using software tools. Under supervision, streamline business processes.

The Opportunity

Design and manage the reporting environment; which includes data sources, security, and metadata.
Provide technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Support the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Assess tests and implement new or upgraded software. Assist with strategic decisions on new systems. Generate reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshoot the reporting database environment and associated reports.
Identify and recommend new ways to streamline business processes
Illustrate data graphically and translate complex findings into written text.
Locate results to help clients make better decisions. Solicit feedback from clients and build solutions based on feedback.
Train end users on new reports and dashboards.
Set FAST goals and provide feedback on FAST goals of repartees

This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.

What You Need

Database languages such as SQL
Programming languages such as R or Python
Analytical tools and languages such as SAS & Mahout.
Proficiency in MATLAB.
Data visualization software such as Tableau or Qlik.
Proficient in mathematics and calculations.
Efficiently with spreadsheet tools such as Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
DBMS
Operating Systems and software platforms
Knowledge regarding customer domain and subdomain where the problem is solved

What We Believe

We’re proud to embrace the same values that have shaped UST since the beginning. Since day one, we’ve been building enduring relationships and a culture of integrity. And today, it's those same values that are inspiring us to encourage innovation from everyone to champion diversity and inclusion and to place people at the center of everything we do.

Humility

We will listen, learn, be empathetic, and help selflessly in our interactions with everyone.

Humanity

Through business, we will better the lives of those less fortunate than ourselves.

Integrity

We honor our commitments and act with responsibility in all our relationships.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

UST is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

UST reserves the right to periodically redefine your roles and responsibilities based on the requirements of the organization and/or your performance.

HTML:
Job Description

 Lead I - Data Analysis

Who We Are

Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.

UST is a mission-driven group of over 29,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in over 30+ countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live.

With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.

Visit us at UST.com .

You Are

UST is searching for a Data Analyst who will Provide expertise in data analysis techniques using software tools. Under supervision, streamline business processes.

The Opportunity
  • Design and manage the reporting environment; which includes data sources, security, and metadata.
  • Provide technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
  • Support the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
  • Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
  • Assess tests and implement new or upgraded software. Assist with strategic decisions on new systems. Generate reports from single or multiple systems.
  • Troubleshoot the reporting database environment and associated reports.
  • Identify and recommend new ways to streamline business processes
  • Illustrate data graphically and translate complex findings into written text.
  • Locate results to help clients make better decisions. Solicit feedback from clients and build solutions based on feedback.
  • Train end users on new reports and dashboards.
  • Set FAST goals and provide feedback on FAST goals of repartees
This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.

What You Need
  • Database languages such as SQL
  • Programming languages such as R or Python
  • Analytical tools and languages such as SAS & Mahout.
  • Proficiency in MATLAB.
  • Data visualization software such as Tableau or Qlik.
  • Proficient in mathematics and calculations.
  • Efficiently with spreadsheet tools such as Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
  • DBMS
  • Operating Systems and software platforms
  • Knowledge regarding customer domain and subdomain where the problem is solved
What We Believe

We’re proud to embrace the same values that have shaped UST since the beginning. Since day one, we’ve been building enduring relationships and a culture of integrity. And today, it's those same values that are inspiring us to encourage innovation from everyone to champion diversity and inclusion and to place people at the center of everything we do.

Humility

We will listen, learn, be empathetic, and help selflessly in our interactions with everyone.

Humanity

Through business, we will better the lives of those less fortunate than ourselves.

Integrity

We honor our commitments and act with responsibility in all our relationships.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

UST is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

UST reserves the right to periodically redefine your roles and responsibilities based on the requirements of the organization and/or your performance.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.

Must reside in the Toronto, ON, CA area*

This role is a critical role collaborating with business leaders to increase transparency, streamline metrics, and solve key challenges for the company.

This individual will foster a data-driven culture by using their technical expertise to identify opportunities to improve key outcomes and operational efficiency.

This individual will build trust among data consumers by ensuring data integrity and consistency in the BI layer.

You will work closely with many teams within the company (business teams, data science, finance. marketing) to determine how best to measure and present our company's performance.

Streamlining metric definitions and tools, advocating for data governance while building a trustworthy reporting layer.

Manage the data architecture, systems and processes that are required for a best-in-class sales analytics function.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will lead and join projects focusing on driving continuous innovation around Sales Analytics Tools and Sales Performance Management.

Working as part of a commercial operations team the Business Intelligence Analyst provides decision support through actionable and insightful analytics to Sales and Business leaders as well as directly to Sales Reps.

The Business Intelligence Analyst is assigned full ownership of and will be partnering closely with key stakeholders and engage deeply in their business to ensure presentations, reports, and dashboards.

The Business Intelligence Analyst focuses on both lagging as well as leading analytics to ensure segment is not only well informed on what is happening in their business, but also through predictive and prescriptive analysis identify opportunities for further growth.

Duties & Responsibilities

Provide support and insights working collaboratively with sales management, finance and sales compensation team on transforming Segment revenue/sales plan target into sales plan goals by territory and individual.
Ensure linkage between revenue growth and sales growth in financial plans from each BU
Manage milestone requirements to ensure timely and quality execution of overall sales plan, including plan reviews, and meeting key milestones according to plan targets
Through deep understanding of sales channels and the segment create effective sales models that incorporate historical performance levels and future market opportunity to facilitate precise target setting
As an advisor to sales and business leadership at all levels deliver sales and retention pipeline and performance reporting by territory and product level with commentary and analysis focused on actionable insights.
Prepare presentations, reporting and analytical support for global and regional sales meetings.
Provide general analytical support to sales management to support ad-hoc business requirements.
Develop new standardized reporting packages designed to strengthen the insights and decision support the sales organisation and general business receives on a recurring basis.
Leverage salesforce, business intelligence and other reporting tools to support smart sales performance and future opportunity reporting, monitoring and tracking.
Partner with marketing on programs in order to drive and focus the sales organization to deliver on future growth opportunities.
Develop detailed knowledge of product portfolio and a strong understanding of current and future market opportunities.
Partake in monthly sales forecasting rhythm and support management in the development and evaluation of the committed sales forecast, including post closure forecast accuracy evaluation.
Work closely with Finance organisation on supporting forecasting process and potential areas for improvements.
Monitor data and provide analysis to illustrate sales trends, identify weaknesses in current sales execution and support future sales strategy.

Qualifications

Bachelors/University level degree in related business or operations field required
3+ years work experience in sales, financial or business analysis or related discipline
3+ years demonstrated Experience working with business intelligence tools including Power BI, Tableau and/or preferably Domo
1-3+ years experience developing metrics and performing analytics
1-3+ years experience writing advanced SQL
Experience working with Salesforce CRM
Direct Experience working with revenue management, budgeting, forecasting, reporting applications including Clari, Anaplan, etc.
Proven to work independently and in matrix environment
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication, influencing and presentation skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Strong MS Office skills in particular XLS essential to be successful in role

As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.

Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com .

Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses. Cision provides accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, upon request, to applicants with disabilities. If contacted, please advise us if you require accommodation and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Want to be part of a team that's changing the way Canada travels?




As Canada’s largest independent ultra-low-cost airline, that’s exactly what we’re doing at Flair Airlines. By consistently offering airfares that are a fraction of the ticket prices of “those other airlines”, we are making air travel an affordable option for millions of couch-bound Canadians.




Yes, we’re an airline, but we truly believe that our product is our people. Low fares are important, but it takes great people delivering consistently outstanding customer-focused service to build brand loyalty.




Flair Airlines is currently seeking a permanent, full-time Business Intelligence Data Engineer, to join our growing and ever-changing organization.




The Data Engineer can be based out of either Edmonton, AB (YEG), Toronto, ON (YYZ) or Vancouver (YVR) and some travel may be required.




Primary Job Functions




The Business Intelligence Data Engineer reports to the Director, Business Intelligence and will assist in implementing the data warehouse, developing ETL pipelines, ingesting various source data, profiling data, dimensional modeling, and technical documentation. They will also assist with implementing data governance, optimizing performance, writing policies and monitoring data quality.




Primary Responsibilities




Design and build modern data pipelines and data streams. Monitor, maintain and optimize warehouse performance.
Act as the lead for technical implementation. Mentor and train junior data engineers
Design and maintain data models. Provide data architecture recommendations and solutions.
Establish standards and documentation related to data ingestion/ETL and modelling
Monitor and log data quality and resolve discrepancies
Develop and maintain technical documentation
Develop data policies and assist in implementing data governance
Collaborate across teams and profiles including data analysts, data scientists, business users and vendors




Safety Duties, Accountabilities, Authorities And Responsibilities




Responsible for the Safety Management System (SMS) within the Information Technology department;
Involved in proactive and reactive safety issues;
Demonstrate knowledge of employee responsibilities regarding safety and actively participate in the company’s Safety Management System (SMS) program;
Initiate the creation and implementation of corrective actions plans as a result of Event/Hazard Reports, Preventative/Corrective Action Request (PCAR) or audit findings; and
Encourage active participation in the SMS for all personnel.




Knowledge, Skills And Abilities




University degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, computer engineering or equivalent specialized training/certification or work experience
A minimum of 6 years of related full-time work experience in a corporate setting
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python
Good understanding on data modeling for data vault and star schema
Strong understanding of database fundamentals
Must have demonstrated hands-on experience on:
Implementing a data warehouse for business intelligence
Designing and developing scripts for ETL processes and automation
Snowflake and DBT
Dimensional and OLAP modeling
APIs in JSON and XML
working independently and/or leading a team
Agile methodologies
CI/CD knowledge
Good to have experience:
Fivetran or similar
PowerBI or similar
GitHub, Jira
Erwin data modeler or similar
Experience in leading teams
A bias for action – results driven.
Demonstrated organizational skills, and high degree of attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast paced, deadline driven environment.
Must demonstrate a commitment to continuous learning and process improvement.
Clear criminal record check and satisfactory employment references.
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
Previous airline technology experience is an asset.




Flair Airlines offers a competitive compensation package including medical and dental benefits, short and long-term disability, life insurance, dependent life insurance, employee & family assistance program, a defined contribution pension plan (matched contributions), and a staff travel program.




How To Apply




Please apply online directly to the posting . Applications should clearly demonstrate how your skills meet or surpass, the requirements of the position of Business Intelligence Data Engineer. Further information about the Company can be found at www.flyflair.com




At Flair Airlines, we work together to promote an inclusive environment that attracts talented individuals and signals our commitment to celebrate and promote diversity. We are devoted to creating equitable, inclusive, and diverse workspaces and we encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role.




We wish to thank everyone who applies, however, due to the number of applications received only those shortlisted will be contacted. We cannot accommodate phone inquiries.




We look forward to meeting you at Flair Airlines!

Please apply online directly to the posting . Applications should clearly demonstrate how your skills meet or surpass, the requirements of the position of Business Intelligence Data Engineer. Further information about the Company can be found at www.flyflair.com


At Flair Airlines, we work together to promote an inclusive environment that attracts talented individuals and signals our commitment to celebrate and promote diversity. We are devoted to creating equitable, inclusive, and diverse workspaces and we encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role.


We wish to thank everyone who applies, however, due to the number of applications received only those shortlisted will be contacted. We cannot accommodate phone inquiries.


We look forward to meeting you at Flair Airlines!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description

Our client, located in Toronto is looking to hire a Data Engineer for their growing team. The Data Engineer is a technical leader in the Data & Analytics team.

Responsibilities include the design, build, optimization, and maintenance of experiments, prototypes and products across the organization's Azure Data Platform. The Data Engineer will use modern and innovative technologies to help business partners realize actionable insights and value from the enterprise data platforms. This includes but is not limited to the design and build of data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by developing custom data pipelines.

The Data Engineer will be valued member of an internal Data Engineering capability working together to discover to define requirements, use cases and outcomes. As a member of the IT Delivery team, the Data Engineer will build, configure, secure, migrate, optimize, and refactor the Azure data platform solutions which includes Ingestion, ETL, Storage, Data Lakes, Data Warehouses, Lakehouse and Data Modelling. You will be capable of working with all levels of the organization with an ability to understand and translate requirements into technical solutions.

Requirements

Key Requirements:

3 years of Data Engineering, Visualization and Analytics experience within Azure environments, Power BI or similar platforms.

University degree specializing in Engineering, Math, Information Systems, Technology or Computer Science

Azure Fundamentals and Azure Data Engineer Certifications

Technical Skills

Data Engineering in Microsoft Azure Environment + Toolsets (ADLA, ADF, Synapse, Data Bricks, AAS, Cosmos DB, FunctionApps, Logic Apps etc)
Expert in SQL
Skilled in core data warehousing platforms
Programming skills - Python, Scala etc.
Microsoft Power BI delivery and support

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.4429. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

© 2023 Robert Half. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

Title: Jr Data Engineer
Description:
Job#: 1338270

Job Description:

JR Data Engineer

Apex Systems is a global IT services provider, and our staffing practice has an opening for a Data Engineer with a strong background in programming skills like Python or Java, experience with data pipelines, models, and data warehouses, and proficient in SQL and NoSQL, to place at our client, a major international retailer.

Client: Major International Retailer

Terms: 12 Month Contract.

Location: Hybrid 2 days/week – Mississauga

Application Process: It is best to apply via the medium on which you are seeing this posting. If you encounter technical difficulties submitting your resume, please send a Word version of your resume to Cole at cedwards@apexsystems.com . Please reference JR Data Engineer, #.

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled data engineer with expertise in Google Cloud Platform and Hadoop to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience with data pipeline development, data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processing. The candidate should be able to design, build and maintain scalable and efficient data solutions.

Responsibilities:

Design and implement GCP-based data solutions to meet business requirements
Develop and maintain data pipelines, data models, and data warehouses
Optimize data processing and data storage to improve system performance and reliability
Develop ETL processes to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources into GCP
Implement data security and governance best practices
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues


Key Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
1-3 years of experience in data engineering with a focus on GCP
Strong programming skills in Python or Java
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience with version control tools such as Git


Nice to Have:

Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Kubernetes
Expertise in GCP services such as BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, DataProc


Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and collaboration skills


Interview Process: There will be 2 rounds of Interviews that will take place in the week of March 27 th .

This a great opportunity to join a leading household brand and continue your career in the ecommerce domain. Be a part of a great work environment with a very well organized team and colleagues who will help you succeed.

This is a position that impacts the business enterprise wide with great opportunity for career growth within the business.

If you are not a 99% match to the above, and want to be considered for other opportunities at our enterprise clients, register for our Talent Network where you can receive job alerts about new opportunities that match your interests.

Click here to Register for our Talent Network

Job#: 1338270

Job Description:

 JR Data Engineer

Apex Systems is a global IT services provider, and our staffing practice has an opening for a Data Engineer with a strong background in programming skills like Python or Java, experience with data pipelines, models, and data warehouses, and proficient in SQL and NoSQL, to place at our client, a major international retailer.

Client: Major International Retailer

Terms: 12 Month Contract.

Location: Hybrid 2 days/week – Mississauga

Application Process: It is best to apply via the medium on which you are seeing this posting. If you encounter technical difficulties submitting your resume, please send a Word version of your resume to Cole at cedwards@apexsystems.com . Please reference JR Data Engineer, #.

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled data engineer with expertise in Google Cloud Platform and Hadoop to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience with data pipeline development, data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processing. The candidate should be able to design, build and maintain scalable and efficient data solutions.

Responsibilities:
  • Design and implement GCP-based data solutions to meet business requirements
  • Develop and maintain data pipelines, data models, and data warehouses
  • Optimize data processing and data storage to improve system performance and reliability
  • Develop ETL processes to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources into GCP
  • Implement data security and governance best practices
  • Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues

Key Qualifications:
  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
  • 1-3 years of experience in data engineering with a focus on GCP
  • Strong programming skills in Python or Java
  • Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
  • Experience with version control tools such as Git

Nice to Have:
  • Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Kubernetes
  • Expertise in GCP services such as BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, DataProc

Soft Skills
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

Interview Process: There will be 2 rounds of Interviews that will take place in the week of March 27 th .

This a great opportunity to join a leading household brand and continue your career in the ecommerce domain. Be a part of a great work environment with a very well organized team and colleagues who will help you succeed.

This is a position that impacts the business enterprise wide with great opportunity for career growth within the business.

If you are not a 99% match to the above, and want to be considered for other opportunities at our enterprise clients, register for our Talent Network where you can receive job alerts about new opportunities that match your interests.

Title: Analyst, Marketing Analytics & Insights
Description:
Plusgrade powers the global travel industry with its portfolio of leading ancillary revenue solutions. Over 200 airline, hospitality, cruise, passenger rail, and financial services companies trust Plusgrade to create new, meaningful revenue streams through incredible customer experiences. As an ancillary revenue powerhouse, Plusgrade has generated billions of dollars in new revenue opportunities across its platform for its partners, while creating enhanced travel experiences for millions of their passengers and guests. Plusgrade was founded in 2009 with headquarters in Montreal and has offices around the world.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are looking for an Analyst, Marketing Analytics & Insights to join our team for a full-time position. The ideal candidate will be a detail-oriented, analytical person who will help deliver actionable customer, segment, product & loyalty program (LP) insights and proactive business/LP recommendations that support both immediate and long-term business objectives.

Reporting to the Director, Marketing Analytics & Insights, you'll support the Marketing Analytics & Insights team’s mandate of accelerated growth, actionable insights & business intelligence.

You will work closely with the broader Marketing team, as well as the Product, Partner Success, Delivery/Activation and other teams, as required.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

Developing a deep understanding of partners’ business, objectives and customers to ensure recommendations are tailor-made and on-strategy.
Working closely with various teams on identifying, creating, testing and implementing opportunities to increase engagement and drive KPIs (e.g. A/B testing, new product/marketing feature rollouts, new marketing channel opportunities).
Ensuring that each initiative considered has a robust testing and/or measurement plan at its outset, then executing that plan and reporting its results.
Conducting analyses to understand the effectiveness of marketing campaigns/initiatives, providing recommendations for improvement, optimization and deployment of new tactics & strategies.
Monitoring overall performance trends, profiling members & developing customer segmentation - driving insights around customer behaviour to foster a strong understanding of conversion drivers and personas.
Analyzing storefront performance & monitoring the customer purchase journey to identify customer friction points and areas for improvement/optimization; working with Product/Marketing/UX team(s) to optimize end customer journey.
Identifying the best-performing initiatives and communicating results to a more senior audience, recommending areas of increased focus
Participating in special projects as required, with responsibilities including data gathering, bespoke analysis, and the presentation of results and recommendations to internal and external stakeholders.
Serving as a subject matter expert for product/marketing data & capabilities.


YOU ARE SOMEONE WITH:

Experience translating key business questions into well-structured analysis and presentations shared back to the business & partners.
Significant experience analyzing and measuring marketing promotion performance.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an ability to distill a large amount of data into actionable insights.
Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills to work cross-functionally, including developed written and presentation skills.
Ability to perform in a fast-paced environment where priorities change and need to be rebalanced.
Understanding of customer segmentation and predictive analytics.
Solid Data Visualization Tool experience. Looker and/or Grafana experience is considered an asset.
Experience using statistical analysis tools/languages (e.g. SAS, Dataiku, Alteryx, SPSS / R, SQL, Python etc) to manipulate and analyze large and varied data sources.
Experience working with web analytics platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc).
Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics or Statistics is an asset.


For this role, you can be anywhere in Canada, given you are comfortable working within the ET timezone.

WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT US:

🏦 RRSP/401(k) Matching

🏥 Comprehensive Health Plans

📅 Unlimited Vacation/PTO

✈️ Travel Experience Credit

🧘 Annual Wellness Credit

🥗 Team Events and Monthly Lunches

💻 Home Office/Commuter Credit

🌅 Work From Anywhere Program

Title: Data Analysis Standards Specialist
Description:
Title: Data Analysis Standards Specialist
Location: Mississauga, ON
Duration: 12+ Months

Background:
Looking for a Data Standards Specialist with proven experience in data analysis and reporting using Client and CDISC ADaM standards and ability to collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders at the molecule/indication project level (PDD and beyond).
The ideal candidate will join the Data Analysis subteam of Data Standards and Governance (DSG) and help shape our global data standards to enable automation and FAIR data!
Main responsibility will be to develop ADaM specifications to support standard analyses at the TA/indication level, in collaboration with cross-functional SMEs within the Pharma Data Governance Biomedical Domain.

As Biomedical Data Standards Specialist (BDSS), your main responsibilities are to:
Develop analysis dataset (ADaM) specifications to support standard analyses at the TA/indication level, in collaboration with cross-functional SMEs within the Pharma Data Governance Biomedical Domain
Develop standard TLG template and endpoint derivation specifications, also in collaboration with Pharma Data Governance SMEs
Maintain analysis standards metadata in GDSR for use in our clinical trials, data marts and technology projects (e.g., Project Botany-Orchid Garden, Frictionless Insights-Admiral)
Collaborate with other BDSS from DSG and cross-functional SMEs from PD, gRED, pRED and Medical Affairs under the Pharma Data Governance Framework to develop beginning-to-end standards from data collection to data analysis, in one or more disease areas

Skills/Experience:
Senior ADS with extensive experience in data analysis and reporting, leading molecule programs (establishing project/molecule standards) or filing
Understanding the usage of Knowledge Graphs (or ability to adopt the technology) is helpful as the GDSR metadata is stored in graph
Proficiency in R strongly desired; could help bridge Orchid Garden and Admiral
This role comes with endless opportunities to enhance your leadership skills and broaden your impact, contributing to continuous improvement of our internal work processes and tools. As a group DSG helps drive a culture based on FAIR data principles across the Client organization.

Must Have Skills
Well versed in CDISC ADaM standards
Solid experience in statistical programming for data analysis and reporting, establishing project/molecule standards, or filing
Communication and effective stakeholder interaction

NOTES:
Experience in I2ON studies is helpful but not required; current focus areas as determined in collaboration with Data Sciences TA Squads include multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer's disease, respiratory diseases, inflammatory bowel disease, ophthalmology, lupus and multiple myeloma

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Our Client in the Ontario Public Sector is looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist on a 12 month contact

Must Haves:

Demonstrated experience with database design (SQL Server, Oracle)


Experience developing BI and analytics Roadmaps for clients (e.g. Microsoft

BI)

Working knowledge of advanced data visualization tools and techniques (statistical graphics, plots, information graphics). Some tools that would be of interest are Rshiny, Google Analytics, Tableau and Power BI (RShiny or RServer a MUST)
Demonstrated experience with a range of analytical methods, techniques and tools: statistical analysis and modelling, data mining, machine learning and algorithms, natural language processing, business performance management, benchmarking text mining, predicative/prescriptive analysis and other related disciplines
Demonstrated experience with statistics and modelling techniques such as econometrics, theory of Probability and Statistics - inference based on survey data, confidence intervals, regression models - multinomial linear, logistic, ridge, machine learning algorithms - training, model evaluation, hyper parameters search techniques


Nice to have:

Power BI

PS

10+ years experience with Business Analysis

Advantages

Long Term Contract

Pay Every week

Office is close to College Subway Station

Responsibilities

To support, influence and impact the use of analytics and strategy for analytics across the enterprise.
To help develop and support the use of the Analytics, tools, and best practices across the enterprise.
Provide consulting services to ministry business partners regarding their information consumption and analytical needs.
Participate in the creation of detailed plans and accurate estimates towards development, testing, and implementation of the project or program.
Contribute to successful project completion by identifying risks and developing/ recommending mitigation strategies.
Participate in Proof of Concept or Proof of Technology projects.
Help develop proposals and feasibility studies for small to medium projects
Conduct technology research, evaluate analytics tools and produce strategy/direction papers
Provide advice and guidance in the areas of advanced statistical modelling, econometrics tools and techniques.
Provide planning advice to the project team on the use of data and building capacity within the Ministry on performing advanced analytics and data analysis.
Provide direction on the statistical relevance of data to the project team


Skills

Qualifications

10+ Years of Business Analysis experience

Demonstrated experience and knowledge with database design (SQL, Server Oracle)

Demonstrated experience developing Power BI and analytics roadmaps (e.g. Microsoft BI)

Working knowledge of advanced data visualization tools and techniques (statistical graphics, plots, information graphics). Some tools that would be of interest are Rshiny, Google Analytics, Tableau and Power BI

Demonstrated experience with data preparation and scripting tools (such as R, OpenRefine, Python and DAX)

Demonstrated experience developing data extraction, transformation, and load functionality for large relational and multidimensional data stores

Summary

business clients to refine project requirements, conduct stakeholder engagements, research data management and data governance best practices, analyze different data holdings from various sources using business intelligence and analytics tools/systems such as, Microsoft BI, R, Python and other analytic tool

Title: Developer, Data Visualization
Description:
At Chartwell, we’re all about Making People’s Lives Better for our residents, their families, and our employees. Join an exceptional group of diverse, caring, and passionate people who are inspired to make a difference in their own lives and are dedicated to delivering an experience that is personalized, memorable and feels like home for more than 30,000 residents across the country.




The Developer, Data Visualization will focus on development, maintenance and support of current and future Data Visualization & Business Intelligence applications as well as various other data collection and reporting tools. This includes maintenance of all platforms managed to support said tools. In partnership with third party services providers the Developer, Data Visualization will build Data Visualization tools to replace existing MS Excel reporting tools where Chartwell has reached the technology limits and requires stronger decision-making capabilities. In partnership with internal resources, the Developer, Data Visualization will optimize technologies to meet challenging and changing business requirements in the areas of ad-hoc data collection, report design and ad-hoc querying/dataset provisioning. The Developer will also work closely with business stakeholders in other departments to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support solutions to deliver essential information and analytics tools.




Key Accountabilities




Development & Quality Assurance




Work with business stakeholders, subject matter experts and business analysts to define requirements and development specifications
Work within a pre-defined development lifecycle to produce technologies meeting requirements and following all documentation and approval workflows, ensuring change management practices conform to organization-wide standards.
Collaborate with similarly disciplined roles in other departments to share skills and determine optimal solutions to cross functional problems
Where necessary conduct quality assurance testing of all developed technologies
Work with business stakeholders, subject matter experts and business analysts to ensure user acceptance testing meets requirements.
Develop and database, business intelligence and data visualization tools designed to improve data democratization
Develop and maintain data repositories including reports, dashboards, and information artifacts.
Facilitate system feasibility studies, proof of concepts, pilot project, and testing.
Ensure the efficient utilization of data resources across different business units
Ensure best practices are established for effective problem resolution for a high availability, 24/7 environment.
Establish and maintain regular written and in-person communications with the organization’s executives, department heads, and end users regarding information-based decision making.




Support & Continuous Improvement




Provide Tier 2 support of all tools maintained and developed
Manage the deployment, monitoring, maintenance, development, upgrade, and support of automation and customization systems
Develop maintenance schedules for automation and customization systems
Analyze existing operations and make recommendations for the improvement and growth of the automation and customization architecture.
Conduct research and remain current with the latest data technologies and solutions in support of future automation and customization procurement efforts.




Qualifications




Education:




Post-Secondary Diploma or University Degree in computer science, finance, business administration, or a related discipline.
Professional training and/or certification in a robotic process automation stream is an asset.
Professional training and/or certification in a development stream is an asset




Experience:




3+ years related work experience.
Strong technical knowledge of current business intelligence and data visualization tools
At minimum proven experience in MS Power BI is required.
Hands on experience in SQL and data manipulation languages
Extensive experience in MS Excel and its data connection and presentation capabilities
Extensive experience in MS Excel application development and security
Strong technical knowledge of other custom application development environments such as MS Power Query, MS Forms, MS Power Apps, etc
Working knowledge of Microsoft 365 and SharePoint Online.




Skills & Abilities:




Ability to understand the interfaces between source systems (ERP, HCM, ITSM, EPM, etc.)
Ability to utilize monitoring tools to evaluate general health of applications from end to end.
Broad understanding of VBA and/or PowerShell and/or other shell scripting is highly desirable.
The ability to work independently, be proactive and self-sufficient is key
Strong team player
Aptitude towards systems and process improvements and re-engineering
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
Process improvement and/or automation experience in the planning area is an asset
Good verbal and written communicator
Ability to communicate effectively with the end-users
Excellent interpersonal communications and the ability to present ideas in a user-friendly format




To apply please email your CV/resume to recruitment@chartwell.com




Chartwell recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, staff and others from COVID-19. As such, subject to any accommodation required by applicable human rights legislation, it will be a condition of employment that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.




Chartwell’s commitment to diversity and inclusivity is a commitment to hire people whose skills and abilities contribute the most to the success of the organization and who reflect the communities in which we live and work.




Chartwell Retirement Residences is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from a wide range of qualified candidates, including persons with disabilities. If you have questions or require assistance with the application process, please email accessibility@chartwell.com or call 1-888-663-6448.




We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

HTML:
At Chartwell, we’re all about Making People’s Lives Better for our residents, their families, and our employees. Join an exceptional group of diverse, caring, and passionate people who are inspired to make a difference in their own lives and are dedicated to delivering an experience that is personalized, memorable and feels like home for more than 30,000 residents across the country.


The Developer, Data Visualization will focus on development, maintenance and support of current and future Data Visualization & Business Intelligence applications as well as various other data collection and reporting tools. This includes maintenance of all platforms managed to support said tools. In partnership with third party services providers the Developer, Data Visualization will build Data Visualization tools to replace existing MS Excel reporting tools where Chartwell has reached the technology limits and requires stronger decision-making capabilities. In partnership with internal resources, the Developer, Data Visualization will optimize technologies to meet challenging and changing business requirements in the areas of ad-hoc data collection, report design and ad-hoc querying/dataset provisioning. The Developer will also work closely with business stakeholders in other departments to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support solutions to deliver essential information and analytics tools.


Key Accountabilities


Development & Quality Assurance


  • Work with business stakeholders, subject matter experts and business analysts to define requirements and development specifications
  • Work within a pre-defined development lifecycle to produce technologies meeting requirements and following all documentation and approval workflows, ensuring change management practices conform to organization-wide standards.
  • Collaborate with similarly disciplined roles in other departments to share skills and determine optimal solutions to cross functional problems
  • Where necessary conduct quality assurance testing of all developed technologies
  • Work with business stakeholders, subject matter experts and business analysts to ensure user acceptance testing meets requirements.
  • Develop and database, business intelligence and data visualization tools designed to improve data democratization
  • Develop and maintain data repositories including reports, dashboards, and information artifacts.
  • Facilitate system feasibility studies, proof of concepts, pilot project, and testing.
  • Ensure the efficient utilization of data resources across different business units
  • Ensure best practices are established for effective problem resolution for a high availability, 24/7 environment.
  • Establish and maintain regular written and in-person communications with the organization’s executives, department heads, and end users regarding information-based decision making.


Support & Continuous Improvement


  • Provide Tier 2 support of all tools maintained and developed
  • Manage the deployment, monitoring, maintenance, development, upgrade, and support of automation and customization systems
  • Develop maintenance schedules for automation and customization systems
  • Analyze existing operations and make recommendations for the improvement and growth of the automation and customization architecture.
  • Conduct research and remain current with the latest data technologies and solutions in support of future automation and customization procurement efforts.


Qualifications


Education:


  • Post-Secondary Diploma or University Degree in computer science, finance, business administration, or a related discipline.
  • Professional training and/or certification in a robotic process automation stream is an asset.
  • Professional training and/or certification in a development stream is an asset


Experience:


  • 3+ years related work experience.
  • Strong technical knowledge of current business intelligence and data visualization tools
  • At minimum proven experience in MS Power BI is required.
  • Hands on experience in SQL and data manipulation languages
  • Extensive experience in MS Excel and its data connection and presentation capabilities
  • Extensive experience in MS Excel application development and security
  • Strong technical knowledge of other custom application development environments such as MS Power Query, MS Forms, MS Power Apps, etc
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft 365 and SharePoint Online.


Skills & Abilities:


  • Ability to understand the interfaces between source systems (ERP, HCM, ITSM, EPM, etc.)
  • Ability to utilize monitoring tools to evaluate general health of applications from end to end.
  • Broad understanding of VBA and/or PowerShell and/or other shell scripting is highly desirable.
  • The ability to work independently, be proactive and self-sufficient is key
  • Strong team player
  • Aptitude towards systems and process improvements and re-engineering
  • Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
  • Process improvement and/or automation experience in the planning area is an asset
  • Good verbal and written communicator
  • Ability to communicate effectively with the end-users
  • Excellent interpersonal communications and the ability to present ideas in a user-friendly format


To apply please email your CV/resume to recruitment@chartwell.com


Chartwell recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, staff and others from COVID-19. As such, subject to any accommodation required by applicable human rights legislation, it will be a condition of employment that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

Title: Summer 2023 Co-op:Data Analyst (Access Deployment Management Technical Support)
Description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.

We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.

Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.

Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity

Assist with the development of Configuration Templates to be used in the Access Deployment Management (ADM) application
Engage the various access network teams to develop specific requirements for enhancements to the ADM application
Work with the various access network teams to develop and define new milestones for the existing workplan templates in ADM.
Provide support to end users of the ADM application as it relates to the creation and maintenance of user accounts
Work with the senior Delivery Specialist to prepare, analyze and clean-up various data set for upload to the ADM application
Work with the senior Delivery Specialist to support end users in the creation of reports, metrics and dashboards
Assist with documentation of processes and procedures for the various functionalities in ADM

Schedule [[req_RogersFullPartTime]]

Shift Day

Length of Contract 4 Months

Work Location 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON

Travel Requirements Up to 10%

Posting Category/Function Student/New Grad & Co-op

Requisition ID 287152

At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @ https//digital.rogers.com/

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work

Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment

Posting Notes Student and New Grad
