Show more Show less
HTML:
About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


Key Areas of Focus:


In this role, you’ll get to:


Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape.


Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance.


Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives.


Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers


Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making.


Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management.


Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments.


What you’ll Need to Succeed: 


  • 4 years and above of experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields
  • Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations
  • Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areas
  • Entrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on on the work
  • Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment 
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders 


It’s Great if you have: 


  • Ability to write in SQL a plus, or willingness to learn 
  • Ability to use Tableau a plus, or willingness to learn
  • Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Nebeus

Nebeus is the leading European financial app for crypto hodlers which offers dedicated user IBAN accounts connected to a full crypto service ecosystem, all within one app. Join Nebeus in its mission to bridge crypto and cash!




Key facts:




Founded in 2014, backed by ex-VC executives, Seedrs, and the UK government’s Future Fund.
Nebeus is a multi-cultural and international team spread out between London and Barcelona.




To help carry us even further, we’re searching for an experienced data analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate should be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. Additionally, you should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth.




What You'll Be Doing

Understanding our business and its processes through our data.
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams.
Developing documentation and data governance.
Owning the entire ETL process.
Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytic systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks.
Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets.
Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.
Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
Work directly with management and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.




Daily and Monthly Responsibilities

Work closely with the Head of Product and CEO to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and delivering actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources.
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts to make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets.




Who You Are & What You'll Need

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics.
3+ years of experience mining data as a data analyst.
Experience with CRM platforms such as Zoho, etc.
Native English is a must.
Native or Advanced level Spanish is a big plus.
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations.
Strong SQL or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools.
Like everyone at Nebeus, you have a passion for creating high-quality products .




Preferred Qualifications

Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques.
Strong programming experience with frameworks, including Javascript, etc.
Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages, including Excel, SPSS, and SAS.
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.




What we offer

A competitive salary.
25 days' holiday.
Health insurance package.
Apple equipment.
Free coffee and tea.
Regular on-site & off-site team events, summer & Christmas parties, and much more to come.
Unlimited monthly cashback on books - non-fiction, business, and especially crypto & fintech.

About Nebeus

Nebeus is the leading European financial app for crypto hodlers which offers dedicated user IBAN accounts connected to a full crypto service ecosystem, all within one app. Join Nebeus in its mission to bridge crypto and cash!


Key facts:


  • Founded in 2014, backed by ex-VC executives, Seedrs, and the UK government’s Future Fund.
  • Nebeus is a multi-cultural and international team spread out between London and Barcelona.


To help carry us even further, we’re searching for an experienced data analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate should be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. Additionally, you should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth.


What You'll Be Doing

  • Understanding our business and its processes through our data.
  • Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams.
  • Developing documentation and data governance.
  • Owning the entire ETL process.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytic systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks.
  • Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets.
  • Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.
  • Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
  • Work directly with management and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.


Daily and Monthly Responsibilities

  • Work closely with the Head of Product and CEO to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and delivering actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
  • Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity.
  • Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources.
  • Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts to make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets.


Who You Are & What You'll Need

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics.
  • 3+ years of experience mining data as a data analyst.
  • Experience with CRM platforms such as Zoho, etc.
  • Native English is a must.
  • Native or Advanced level Spanish is a big plus.
  • Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
  • Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization
  • Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations.
  • Strong SQL or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools.
  • Like everyone at Nebeus, you have a passion for creating high-quality products .


Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques.
  • Strong programming experience with frameworks, including Javascript, etc.
  • Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages, including Excel, SPSS, and SAS.
  • Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.


What we offer

  • A competitive salary.
  • 25 days' holiday.
  • Health insurance package.
  • Apple equipment.
  • Free coffee and tea.
  • Regular on-site & off-site team events, summer & Christmas parties, and much more to come.
  • Unlimited monthly cashback on books - non-fiction, business, and especially crypto & fintech.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Quantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.

Our services are based on a Digital Factory model. Through this model we help companies to accelerate its digital transformation projects with an end-to-end approach.




We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.




As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don’t hesitate to apply!




What you will do:

You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teams
You will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experience
You will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.
You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needs
You closely align with business and management teams to assess business needs
You collaborate with the product teams to identify possibilities for improvement and adaptations regarding their digital products
You will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speed
You will work in an international environment with a diverse team
You will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team




Required skills:

At least 2 years of experience as a Digital Analyst
Knowledge of front-end web and mobile technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SDKs)
Experience in digital data collection (tracking), Firesbase and/or tag management systems
Experience in standard digital analytical tools (e.g., Google Analytics)
Experience with AB testing, personalization, customer data platforms, and/or data activation is a plus
Experience in working in cross-functional teams in an agile environment
Knowledge of software-development processes, dependencies and digital products as well as methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and Kanban
Knowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL…), reporting tools (e.g. , Tableau) and cloud platforms (esp. Microsoft Azure)
Knowledge of script languages such as Python, R, Scala e.g., with Apache Spark is a plus
Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasets
Willingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving it
Very good command of English language







Apply to our offer…

💟 If you are passionate about technologies

💟 If you define yourself as a team worker

💟 If you want to work with a multidisciplinary and international team

💟 If you want to be part of a company which is permanently expanding and growing

💟 If you want to work in an international environment




Our offering:

✨ Permanent contract

✨ Competitive salary

✨ 22 days of vacation

✨ 5 additional holidays for Christmas

✨ 4 additional holidays for Easter

✨ Flexible working time

✨ Continuous working days in summer




Committed to equality, at Quantion we believe in diversity and inclusion. We defend equal opportunities without discriminating based on gender, age, religion or sexual orientation or any other aspect that could be considered exclusive.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
OBS Business School es la 1ª Business School 100% born online en España. Con más de 36.000 alumnos formados desde nuestra fundación, ofrecemos MBAs y Másters online que se adaptan a las necesidades del mercado nacional como internacional en constante evolución. OBS Business School forma parte de Planeta Formación y Universidades (división educación de Grupo Planeta), unos de los grupos líderes en el sector educativo en el mundo hispanohablante.

Para apoyar a nuestro crecimiento a nivel nacional e internacional, estamos en la búsqueda de Data Analyst, apasionado de los datos para el Departamento de Admisiones.

Misión del Puesto:

Dominar nuestra herramienta de gestión de candidatos para la extracción de información.
Gestionar la información comercial disponible en el Departamento de Admisiones a fin de generar el reportings necesarios para el correcto seguimiento de indicadores.
Analizar los procesos existentes en los cuales se recopilan datos para proponer una optimización sustentada en la planificación a desarrollar con los estándares que permita el contexto de negocio y las herramientas disponibles.
Dar visibilidad de toda la información del departamento con diferentes Dashboard.
Dar soporte en el proceso de toma de decisiones estratégicas del área proporcionando datos fiables a partir de la información recopilada.


Funciones:

Dominio del proceso en nuestro CRM
Creación, optimización y propuesta de circuitos
Identificación y creación de KPI’s
Optimización y gestión de BBDD
Realizar Dashboard (cuadros de mando) fiables
Reportes: diarios, semanales y mensuales


¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato Indefinido y a jornada completa (Horario de 12h a 21h)
Podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente gracias a nuestros planes de formación y desarrollo de talento interno.
Descuentos y promociones exclusivas para nuestros empleados (masters y posgrados, sellos editoriales, coleccionables, Casa del Libro…).
Un atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales a través del plan de retribución flexible que incluye: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico, etc.


Requisitos:

Conocimientos:

Dominio muy avanzado de Excel
Dominio muy avanzado de Power BI, herramienta clave para los reportings
BBDD: Extracción-Transformación-Visualización-Carga (ETL)
Se valorarán favorablemente conocimientos en: SQL, QLIK, Programación PYTHON, Programación R


Habilidades:

Persona proactiva, resolutiva y exigente
Aporte ideas y soluciones
Anticipación problemas
Facilitador de toma de decisiones
Analítico, atención al detalle, estructurado
Fiable, confiable y metódico
Visión de negocio
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst Operaciones
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 80% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

Data Analyst Operaciones

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

¿CÓMO ES UN/A DATA ANALYST OPERACIONES ONLINE EN MANGO?

Tu objetivo será desarrollar la visión analítica de las operaciones online y generar insights que ayuden a la toma de decisiones de negocio.

En tu día a día…

Ayudaras a definir los KPI los principales y darás visibilidad sobre los indicadores de negocio de operaciones.
Mejorarás la calidad de los datos en colaboración con los equipos de Data y Tecnología
Ayudarás a la operativa mediante reporting/dashboarding y automatización de procesos.
Realizarás Benchmark de los principales mercados para identificar opciones de mejora y gaps de servicio respecto la competencia
Crearás las alertas necesarias para detección de incidencias


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

Que tengas formación en áreas cuantitativas (Matemáticas, Estadística, IT, Ingeniería, ADE…)
Que aportes entre 1-2 años de experiencia laboral en análisis y visualización de datos (PowerBI, Looker…)
Que tengas conocimiento en programación SQL y un nivel avanzado de Excel
Valoraremos positivamente experiencia en e-commerce y operaciones
Valoraremos positivamente experiencia R/Python
Que tengas capacidad analítica, técnica y de resolución de problemas. Que seas una persona entusiasta, participativa, con ilusión por aportar nuevas ideas y apasionada por la analítica.


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?

Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido
Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento del 25% en todas nuestras líneas además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso


You got it?

We like you!

Buscamos un/a

Data Analyst Operaciones

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

¿CÓMO ES UN/A DATA ANALYST OPERACIONES ONLINE EN MANGO?

Tu objetivo será desarrollar la visión analítica de las operaciones online y generar insights que ayuden a la toma de decisiones de negocio.

En tu día a día…
  • Ayudaras a definir los KPI los principales y darás visibilidad sobre los indicadores de negocio de operaciones.
  • Mejorarás la calidad de los datos en colaboración con los equipos de Data y Tecnología
  • Ayudarás a la operativa mediante reporting/dashboarding y automatización de procesos.
  • Realizarás Benchmark de los principales mercados para identificar opciones de mejora y gaps de servicio respecto la competencia
  • Crearás las alertas necesarias para detección de incidencias

¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?
  • Que tengas formación en áreas cuantitativas (Matemáticas, Estadística, IT, Ingeniería, ADE…)
  • Que aportes entre 1-2 años de experiencia laboral en análisis y visualización de datos (PowerBI, Looker…)
  • Que tengas conocimiento en programación SQL y un nivel avanzado de Excel
  • Valoraremos positivamente experiencia en e-commerce y operaciones
  • Valoraremos positivamente experiencia R/Python
  • Que tengas capacidad analítica, técnica y de resolución de problemas. Que seas una persona entusiasta, participativa, con ilusión por aportar nuevas ideas y apasionada por la analítica.

¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?
  • Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido
  • Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
  • Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
  • Descuento del 25% en todas nuestras líneas además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
  • Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
  • Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
  • Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
  • Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
  • Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
  • Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
  • Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso

You got it?

We like you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world's largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world's largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe's fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world's most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do

Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units


Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 3 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau
Good knowledge of Python is a plus
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas


Why should you join Proton?

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world's top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We're one of Europe's fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else's problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.


Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Empresa del sector energético.|Ubicada en la zona del Vallés Oriental.




About Our Client




Empresa del sector energético en pleno crecimiento ubicada en el Vallés Orienta.




Job Description




Liderar los proyectos de análisis de datos coordinándose con el equipo de datos.
Poner foco en el impacto de la aplicación de la tecnología en el negocio.
Liderar los proyectos asignados de business analytics y casos de uso de extremo a extremo, reportando a la dirección del proyecto.
En colaboración con el equipo de data: diseñar, implantar y optimizar una estrategia a largo plazo del tratamiento de la información.
Documentar las distintas fases de los proyectos.
Realizar análisis del entorno y diseñar un sistema de reporting para la visualización de las datos.
The Successful Applicant




Grado en matemáticas, estadística, ingeniería, ADE o Informática
Experiencia consolidada R, Python, SQL/PLSQL.
Conocimientos de Talend.
Dominio de técnicas de aprendizaje automático, técnicas estadísticas y minería de datos.
Experiencia en Power BI i Tableau
Nivel de inglés B2.
What's on Offer




Oportunidades de carrera y desarrollo profesional.




Contact: Alejandro Mediano

Title: Data Analyst Junior | Automoción
Description:
¡Seguimos creciendo!

En Trigo Group somo expertos en ofrecer soluciones integrales de calidad para nuestros clientes ofreciendo desde acciones correctivas hasta preventivas. Nuestro objetivo es evitar posibles no conformidades de calidad durante los procesos de fabricación y mantener una producción óptima. Además, nos hemos especializado en las industrias automovilística, aeroespacial y de transporte pesado.

Que, ¿cómo lo hacemos?, muy fácil: gracias a nuestro gran equipo.

¿Suena bien verdad?

¡Te estamos buscando!

Tus Tareas Serán

Crear, modificar, actualizar y analizar dashboards disponibles en Power BI Desktop, Online y en MS Excel
Analizar datos a nivel estadístico y predictivo.
Presentación de los resultados de los análisis mediante PPTs y PDFs.
Proponer nuevos análisis o test de hipótesis.
Creación de listas o informes automatizados en la nube (One drive/Sharepoint)

Pensamos En Ti Como Una Persona Con

Experiencia de al menos 2-3 años en una posición similar.
Conocimientos avanzados de MS Excel (Macros, programación VBA, power query y funciones avanzadas).
Experiencia en:
Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Microsoft Lists, Sharepoint,etc).
Desarrollo de cuadros de mando con tecnologías Microsoft PowerBI, formulación/programación DAX, Power Query, etc.
SAP Business Objects.
Inglés B2-C1

¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Jornada completa.
Posibilidad de disponer de seguro de salud a un precio competitivo.
Integración en una compañía puntera del sector.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for the next challenge? Do you enjoy Data Management? This opportunity is for you!

Multinational inside the industrial and medical sector responsible for the production and distribution of gases is looking for several Data Analysts located in Barcelona, Madrid, Porto or Lisbon.

Tasks

You will be in charge to generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics
This role is aimed to support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics
The Data Analytics Expert acts as the interface between Business and IT area - defines and discusses content related requirements with business and transform into IT / implements requirements using state-of the art technology
Moreover, you will be in charge of the execution and management of projects within business analytics closely aligned with business, IT
Last but not least, responsibilities like coaching and training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics (e.g. Tableau training)


Requirements

You have a University diploma in Computer Science, Business Economics or Business
Advanced level of English language is mandatory
Solid computer skills, including Microsoft Office, databases, web-based applications
Further you have the ability to write and execute complex SQL queries to extract data from a variety of internal sources
Significant experience with Tableau or any Data Visualization Tool is require for this role
Python and/or R development skills would be a plus
You are highly organized and adaptable individual with effective time management
Travel availability (for dedicated meetings, for training purposes or knowledge exchange experiences)


Benefits

Competitive salary
Possibility of growth inside the company
Multicultural atmosphere

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job




Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in.




Danone’s mission is bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Healthy food needs a healthy planet, and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.




Danette, Evian, Activia, Volvic, Blédina, sound familiar to you? Do you know that behind these brands there is always Information Technology pushing them forward?




At Danone, we use advanced and innovative IT solutions which are implemented in all Danone units around the world to contribute to our mission bringing health through food to as many people as possible. Don’t wait, click and discover the Danone IS/IT universe and join the movement your IT skills could be a real asset for the alimentation revolution!




https//youtu.be/MqjF1HxsTyw




About You




Profile & Experience




Minimum of 5-6 years’ experience in the Data & Analytics Domain.
Minimum of 1 -2 years’ experience as Functional or Business Analyst in a product team.
Proven Track record of Implementing efficient and flexible dashboards / reports / data visualization capabilities.
Ability to demonstrate a mix of technical skills and business processes knowledge and proven experience in rolling out a data product in multiple markets. Essential to have experience in experience in data catalogue documentation and manage the product use throughout all the stages of the product lifecycle.
Experience working with Data Architects, Ingestion, Data scientists, Developers and visualization teams in an agile framework.
Strong ability to connect and communicate to distinct stakeholders in a complex organization, managing stakeholders from Global, Local, Business and IT colleagues.
Experience implementing modern data strategies and solutions using cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, Google), Informatica Cloud, Power BI or similar tools.




Competencies




A minimum of a Bachelor's /Masters Degree is required; a field in Computer Science, Math, or statistical background.
Excellent level in SQL-like languages (SQL, Python, NOSQL, …), data warehousing(Snowflake/ redshift/ others)
Feeling comfortable with the implementation of dashboards with the main reporting tools in the industry (PowerBI / SpotfIre / Kibana etc., or equivalent)
Good knowledge and curiosity about best-in-class Data technologies
Experienced in Functional Analysis/ Business Analysis / Data Analysis
Proficiency in English
Comfortable with written and verbal communication - strong analytic mind
Capability to express complex data concepts into lay language for stakeholder management




About Us




As a Data Analyst, you will be our eyes in the ocean of data. We expect you to run experiments and studies to find quantitative answers from simple to more complex business or internal questions, having an easy access, and critical view on our data. This role will help the team to have a good control on the content of the data, the consistency, the quality, and should be able to provide deeper insights into the data.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to take the responsibility of designing the specification required for the developments we will plan to find the right data sources, how to transform them, how to analyze & provide insights, while ensuring the functional tests/validations, and creating the definition of done and make sure it is reached, together with the Product Owners.




We are looking for a candidate who has a strong knowledge on both data analyze/querying Data using SQL/ Python, visualizing through PowerBI and a good experience in turning the business needs into analytical insights and provide recommendations to the business with problem solving techniques.




In this position you will be reponsible for




Data Analysis Expertise




Data Analysis querying and exploit the data sets, tables, read and define the right data marts, navigate into the different environment (DWH, Datalakes, etc.) and extract relevant data for business
Data Based Decision & Advices know how to leverage the quantitative insight from the data while keeping a critical eye to the content/reliability/information provided. Answering questions, providing precise insights or order of magnitudes easily.
Data visualization represent the data insights in synthetic / tailor made dashboards and reports (Power BI, and/or other standard Business Intelligence tools)




Product Support to Data Governance




Knowledge Management keeping an up-to-date documentation / data & metadata description and linking it with the Data Excellence/Master Data Management program and MDM tools.
Monitoring Being proactive in the definition of the data quality KPIs to ensure a well monitored data quality level.




Implementation Follow-Up and Operationel Excellence




Backlog Gather and refine the backlog of user’s stories/requirements and ensure the right execution of the priorities set by the Product Owners & Senior Product Owners.
Turn business needs into deliverables
The description, documentation, and functional tests of new features to be done.
Define the rules to validate the expected implementation of the features / User’s Stories (Definition Of Done)
Validate the deliveries with the right quality/non-regression level.
MVPs Maximizes efficiency in a constantly evolving environment using Minimal Viable Product delivery, and rapid prototyping.
Keep a flexible/agile state of mind, while managing the backlog transparently and efficiently and communicating regularly on the progresses.




Experience in developing innovative data solutions, agile ways of working, intellectual curiosity, and collaborating with small agile delivery teams are critical to enable you to be successful. Furthermore, it is important that you possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to logically analyse complex requirements or processes.




You will be a passionate with the ability to gain business partner agreement, communicate confidently at both the technical and data team level, and collaborate with a wide variety of technical and non-technical teams

  • Data visualization represent the data insights in synthetic / tailor made dashboards and reports (Power BI, and/or other standard Business Intelligence tools)


Product Support to Data Governance


  • Knowledge Management keeping an up-to-date documentation / data & metadata description and linking it with the Data Excellence/Master Data Management program and MDM tools.
  • Monitoring Being proactive in the definition of the data quality KPIs to ensure a well monitored data quality level.


Implementation Follow-Up and Operationel Excellence


  • Backlog Gather and refine the backlog of user’s stories/requirements and ensure the right execution of the priorities set by the Product Owners & Senior Product Owners.
  • Turn business needs into deliverables
  • The description, documentation, and functional tests of new features to be done.
  • Define the rules to validate the expected implementation of the features / User’s Stories (Definition Of Done)
  • Validate the deliveries with the right quality/non-regression level.
  • MVPs Maximizes efficiency in a constantly evolving environment using Minimal Viable Product delivery, and rapid prototyping.
  • Keep a flexible/agile state of mind, while managing the backlog transparently and efficiently and communicating regularly on the progresses.


Experience in developing innovative data solutions, agile ways of working, intellectual curiosity, and collaborating with small agile delivery teams are critical to enable you to be successful. Furthermore, it is important that you possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to logically analyse complex requirements or processes.


You will be a passionate with the ability to gain business partner agreement, communicate confidently at both the technical and data team level, and collaborate with a wide variety of technical and non-technical teams

Title: Data Analyst
Place: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Giesecke+Devrient is a global company that offers security technologies, both in the physical and digital world. Every day, billions of people benefit from G+D innovations in their personal and business lives. With around 11,600 employees across 32 countries, we develop, manufacture, and distribute products and solutions for the safeguarding of payment processes, identities, connectivity, and data.

At G+D, we are looking for a Data Analyst within the team based in El Prat de Llobregat, Barcelona.

Your Duties

Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
Removing corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems.
Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format.
Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.
Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems.
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction.
Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.
Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.

Your profile

Degree in Maths or other scientist discipline.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in similar position.
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data.
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, MATLAB, and Python.
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (Javascript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases.
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing.
Adept at using data processing platforms like Hadoop and Apache Spark.
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik.
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions.
Problem-solving skills.
Accuracy and attention to detail.
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations.
Team-working skills.
Verbal and Written communication skills.
Proven working experience in data analysis.

What we offer

Culture and Diversity: Join a people oriented environment with different nationalities and a great team spirit, flat hierarchies (everyone speaks to everyone). Equal Opportunity Employer and LGBT+ friendly.
Global Teams: Enjoy collaborative work in Agile/SCRUM teams and with stakeholders around the globe.
Innovative Products: Design and develop business processes and IT solutions for innovative products and digital solutions.
Career Development: Continuous training and coaching, talent program.
Social Benefits: Private medical insurance, transport ticket, in-house parking.
Flexible work time and remote work: Core time Mo-Th 9:30 – 17:00, 3 days of remote work.
Own Canteen: Take a break with our breakfast and lunch service: Choose between a big range of menus, salad desk and sandwich service. Fruit packages.
Location: El Prat de Llobregat. Easy communication by public transport o private transport.
transporte público Bus 88 y 110 desde Barcelona y PR4 desde el Prat.
Show more Show less

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description




What makes Netcentric a great fit for you?




At Cognizant Netcentric, we come to work every day with the mission of leveraging cutting-edge technology to create memorable digital experiences for the world’s leading brands. And we do it as a diverse, global community of over 1500+ Adobe experts collaborating across countries, cultures, languages and technologies.




We’re energized by an inclusive and responsive organizational culture that brings together the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with the resources, growth opportunities and stability of a larger global organization. Holacracy is the cornerstone of how we work, empowering every individual with the power to make an impact within our organization. All this encourages us to learn and grow as individuals, and unite as a team to build innovative digital experiences that touch people’s lives.




Job Description




Job Description




We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst professional who loves to transmit his/her passion for web technologies and big data projects. You will consult internal stakeholders by leveraging data insights. You will be the interface between the product team and the business. You are a good fit, if you are a sharp mind that gathers insights and turns them into business value.




You have a strong analytical mindset and are a great communicator to convey your insights.




Roles & Responsibilities in your day-to-day activities you will:




Consult internal stakeholders on using data to gain meaningful insights
Collaborate with members of the digital, product marketing, and business stakeholders to provide actionable insights on the performance of digital channels.
Guide product marketers in identifying key performance indicators for their areas and build appropriate reporting that provides insight into the performance of initiatives within each area.
Derive actionable consumer insights from trends observed data and reports for the business owners and stakeholders
Extract existing data to calculate/format into presentable reports, charts, and graphs
Examine and evaluate the purpose and content of business reports to develop new or improve existing format
Design, build and implement new report formats and layouts on a customized basis as requested by the process owners
Validation and clean-up of the production data. Individual productivity tracking and scorecard preparation
Create automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.
Apply data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with the products.
Ensure the accuracy of the reports
Continuously work with product teams and improve the product
Responsible for product reporting and guiding team along with Product Owner
Consult on projects with respect to tracking and measuring all desired on and offline touchpoints.
Advocate customers through the creation of Analytics, Data Management and Customer Data Platform solutions.
Added advantage:
Experience in Tag Management with the ability to read and write code
Model business processes in data architecture for analysis and optimization
Workshop attendance - online, as well as some onsite travel required.
Qualifications




Required Skills:




5 years of experience as Data Analyst
Products, MS Power BI, Google Data Studio / Looker
Basic understanding of SQL and queering data to derive insights for business
Good communication skills (verbal and written) and Strong Interpersonal Skills
Report writing, presentation and insight generation
Creating Dashboards in (Excel, PowerBI, Google Data Studio etc.)
Understanding of Marketing needs
Data Science interface
Creative skills on visualization
Can inspire, gather insights and convey key messages to the business
Out of the box thinking, linking data sets
Abstract thinking
Working hours CET +/- hour




What makes us smile when we look at your profile:




Experience in international projects and working with remote teams
Not afraid to run workshop and knowledge sharing sessions




Additional Information




At Netcentric you get:




Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation
Flexible working hours
Recognition bonus system
Private health insurance
Apple work equipment
WFH equipment + welcome package
WFH monthly expenses compensation
Access to Udemy courses
Adobe certification
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport)
A dynamic and international team
Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organization
Show more Show less

  • Sponsored gym membership

  • Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organization

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
¿Quiénes somos y qué queremos conseguir?

GoTrendier es una startup que ha creado el marketplace de moda de segunda mano líder en México y Colombia desde 2017, ayudando a millones de personas a consumir moda de una forma más sostenible y obtener ingresos extra para su familia.

Ya somos 90 compañeros y tenemos oficinas en Barcelona, Ciudad de México y Bogotá.

En nuestra plataforma se hacen más de 200.000 transacciones al mes. Somos una comunidad de más de 6 millones de usuarias y más de 10.000 se unen cada día.

Nuestra Misión es cambiar la manera en que las mujeres consumen moda e inspirarlas a hacerlo de una forma más social y sostenible.

Se estima que la moda de segunda mano duplicará a la fast fashion en 2030, a nivel global, evitando un enorme impacto ambiental. ¡Y en GoTrendier somos protagonistas de este cambio!




¿A quién buscamos?

Buscamos un Analista de NEGOCIO con excelentes skills y conocimientos de DATA, que nos ayude a monitorizar, analizar y obtener insights relevantes sobre la evolución del negocio, y detectar oportunidades que puedan impactar en el performance de la compañía.
Trabajarás en el equipo de Growth/Producto, apoyando a los principales líderes de la empresa con análisis de datos que serán claves en la toma de decisiones de negocio.
Buscamos una persona proactiva, con muchas ganas de crecer profesionalmente y con potencial para asumir nuevos roles en la compañía a medio plazo.
Muy Importante: debes ser 100% Data-Driven, pero sobre todo con visión y mindset de NEGOCIO.




Requisitos mínimos:

Residencia en Barcelona
Trabajo híbrido flexible: 2-3 días a la semana en la oficina (Poble Nou), con flexibilidad.
2+ años de experiencia (preferiblemente en entorno startup) como analista de negocio.
Vocación y visión de Negocio.
Data-Driven. Excelentes skills analíticas.
Dominio de herramientas de análisis y visualización de datos. Excel avanzado + estar familiarizado con aplicaciones de BI.
Conocimientos de estadística.
Proactivo y resolutivo. Si se puede hacer hoy, mejor que mañana.




Además, nos encantaría que tuvieses (nice to have)...

Experiencia en entorno startup, marketplaces o ecommerce de moda.
Experiencia en análisis de empresas.
Conocimientos avanzados de SQL.
Experiencia en consultoría estratégica.
Formación MBA.
Experiencia o formación específica en Data (Master en Business Analytics & Data o similares)




¿Cómo somos en GoTrendier?

Somos conductores, no pasajeros. Somos gente de acción y nos implicamos en conseguir los objetivos.
Buenos compañeros de Equipo. Colaboramos, nos ayudamos, y también sabemos divertirnos.
Nos encanta crecer y aprender. Somos curiosos e inconformistas y nos motivan los retos.




¿Qué valoramos más de trabajar en GoTrendier?

El enorme impacto que estamos generando. Formar parte de una empresa en crecimiento que logra impactar en millones de personas y en el planeta.
Flexibilidad para organizarse y conciliar.
Trabajar con un equipo top con oportunidades para aprender con gente muy buena y con amplia experiencia en startups exitosas, como Jesús Monleón (uno de los mayores expertos en España de eCommerce e Internet, fundador de emagister, Trovit, Offerum, SeedRocket,…) y Yair Martínez (ex CEO de Social Games Online, BeRepublic, Accenture,...).
Proyecto de producto, negocio, y tecnología muy atractivo, con una clara hoja de ruta, y retos profesionales que nos hacen crecer a todos junto a la empresa.
Salario acorde al perfil y a lo que aporta cada uno.
Seguro de Salud privado pagado por la empresa al empleado (con compañía top: DKV), con posibilidad de incluir a familiares en modalidad de retribución flexible.
Trabajar con compañeros que, además de ser grandes profesionales, nos hacen agradable el día a día.
Entorno internacional: compañeros de España, México y Colombia, colaborando cada día.
Iniciativas continuas de formación y aprendizaje (cursos, libros, conferencias, …)
Acceso a un Club de Descuentos para empleados en tiendas top (Amazon, AirBnB, Cepsa, Atrápalo, Ticketmaster, Nintendo,...), a través de Cobee.
Plan de People & Culture para seguir mejorando cada día.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Description:
AVL is the world's largest independent company for development, simulation and testing technology of powertrains (hybrid, combustion engines, transmission, electric drive, batteries and software) for passenger cars, trucks and large engines.

Develop and maintain data analysis tools and algorithms to support the development and testing
Perform statistical analyses and modeling of the data to identify trends and patterns
Collaborate with engineers and team members to interpret data and provide insights and recommendations
Develop and present reports and visualizations to communicate data insights and findings to non-technical profiles
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the systems through data-driven decision making
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering.
High level of English.
Strong analytical skills and experience with statistical analysis, data modeling and machine learning techniques is a plus.
Medium\Advanced programming skill with Python.
Experience with data visualization tools is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team.
An exciting and challenging job in an innovative and dynamic company
An international working environment with opportunities for personal and professional development
Competitive salary and benefits package

AVL is the world's largest independent company for development, simulation and testing technology of powertrains (hybrid, combustion engines, transmission, electric drive, batteries and software) for passenger cars, trucks and large engines.
  • Develop and maintain data analysis tools and algorithms to support the development and testing
  • Perform statistical analyses and modeling of the data to identify trends and patterns
  • Collaborate with engineers and team members to interpret data and provide insights and recommendations
  • Develop and present reports and visualizations to communicate data insights and findings to non-technical profiles
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of the systems through data-driven decision making
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering.
  • High level of English.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with statistical analysis, data modeling and machine learning techniques is a plus.
  • Medium\Advanced programming skill with Python.
  • Experience with data visualization tools is a plus.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • An exciting and challenging job in an innovative and dynamic company
  • An international working environment with opportunities for personal and professional development
  • Competitive salary and benefits package

Title: People Data Analyst
Description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.

As a People Data Analyst, you will be working alongside a passionate and dynamic team of people analytics professionals to drive data-informed decisions related to our people operations, with a particular focus on Talent Management.

This role will be embedded within our People team, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse group of team members who share your passion for using data to drive business outcomes.

The main responsibilities will be:

Partner with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and develop dashboards that provide insights into our people operations.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends and patterns that inform business decisions.
Participate and co-drive the creation of an People data platform and develop models and frameworks to support strategic
workforce planning, talent acquisition, retention, and performance management.
Collaborate with HR, Finance, and other business functions to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.
Advocate for a data-driven approach, building processes to ensure data quality excellence and ability to advise on internal mobility decisions.
Support Chief People Officer in the preparation of documentation material for various audiences including the Company’s Board of Directors.
Proactively seek out new opportunities for data analysis and continuous improvement within our people analytics function, helping to shape the future of our organization.


Qualities we value for the role:

>2 years of experience in a People Data Analyst role or similar roles.
Knowledge of People functions and metrics.
Proven ability to be analytical and handle data effectively.
Ability to function as an effective and respected partner to internal clients.
Advanced knowledge of Google Sheets, alternatively, Excel.
Working knowledge in data visualization tools (Looker Studio, or other data visualization tools).
Understanding of and experience with SQL and relational databases.
Experience with ETL tools and Python knowledge is highly valued.
Ability to communicate fluently in English, as it is our main working language.


What do we offer?

A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.
Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.
Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills trainings, language lessons as well as a subscription to Coursera Online Learning.
Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.
We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!
A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.
New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.
Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.
Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!


… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.


Show more Show less
HTML:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.

As a People Data Analyst, you will be working alongside a passionate and dynamic team of people analytics professionals to drive data-informed decisions related to our people operations, with a particular focus on Talent Management.

This role will be embedded within our People team, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse group of team members who share your passion for using data to drive business outcomes.

The main responsibilities will be:
  • Partner with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and develop dashboards that provide insights into our people operations.
  • Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends and patterns that inform business decisions.
  • Participate and co-drive the creation of an People data platform and develop models and frameworks to support strategic
  • workforce planning, talent acquisition, retention, and performance management.
  • Collaborate with HR, Finance, and other business functions to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.
  • Advocate for a data-driven approach, building processes to ensure data quality excellence and ability to advise on internal mobility decisions.
  • Support Chief People Officer in the preparation of documentation material for various audiences including the Company’s Board of Directors.
  • Proactively seek out new opportunities for data analysis and continuous improvement within our people analytics function, helping to shape the future of our organization.

Qualities we value for the role:
  • >2 years of experience in a People Data Analyst role or similar roles.
  • Knowledge of People functions and metrics.
  • Proven ability to be analytical and handle data effectively.
  • Ability to function as an effective and respected partner to internal clients.
  • Advanced knowledge of Google Sheets, alternatively, Excel.
  • Working knowledge in data visualization tools (Looker Studio, or other data visualization tools).
  • Understanding of and experience with SQL and relational databases.
  • Experience with ETL tools and Python knowledge is highly valued.
  • Ability to communicate fluently in English, as it is our main working language.

What do we offer?
  • A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.
  • Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.
  • Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills trainings, language lessons as well as a subscription to Coursera Online Learning.
  • Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.
  • We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!
  • A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.
  • New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.
  • Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.
  • Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!

… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Giesecke+Devrient is a global company that offers security technologies, both in the physical and digital world. Every day, billions of people benefit from G+D innovations in their personal and business lives. With around 11,600 employees across 32 countries, we develop, manufacture, and distribute products and solutions for the safeguarding of payment processes, identities, connectivity, and data. At G+D, we are looking for a Data Analyst within the team based in El Prat de Llobregat, Barcelona. Your Duties

Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
Removing corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems.
Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format.
Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.
Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems.
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction.
Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.
Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.


Your profile

Degree in Maths or other scientist discipline.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in similar position.
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data.
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, MATLAB, and Python.
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (Javascript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases.
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing.
Adept at using data processing platforms like Hadoop and Apache Spark.
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik.
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions.
Problem-solving skills.
Accuracy and attention to detail.
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations.
Team-working skills.
Verbal and Written communication skills.
Proven working experience in data analysis.


What we offer

Culture and Diversity: Join a people oriented environment with different nationalities and a great team spirit, flat hierarchies (everyone speaks to everyone). Equal Opportunity Employer and LGBT+ friendly.
Global Teams: Enjoy collaborative work in Agile/SCRUM teams and with stakeholders around the globe.
Innovative Products: Design and develop business processes and IT solutions for innovative products and digital solutions.
Career Development: Continuous training and coaching, talent program.
Social Benefits: Private medical insurance, transport ticket, in-house parking.
Flexible work time and remote work: Core time Mo-Th 9:30 – 17:00, 3 days of remote work.
Own Canteen: Take a break with our breakfast and lunch service: Choose between a big range of menus, salad desk and sandwich service. Fruit packages.
Location: El Prat de Llobregat. Easy communication by public transport o private transport.
transporte público Bus 88 y 110 desde Barcelona y PR4 desde el Prat.

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
Who We Are




At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 2,700 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and share successes. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising.




This is a 6-month internship opportunity based in Barcelona starting January 2023*




The goal of Business Performance AX (BPAX) team is to provide market level analytics insights to internal stakeholders and also derive action plans from them. Insights on business performance drive sales or operational actions that maximize revenue and margin. Thanks to a global geo coverage, BPAX has the ability to address country, market and global level topic, and ensure timely sync with every in-market team and leader. Aligned with the Criteo culture of data-based decision making, the team has a unique capability to unveil business opportunities.




As an Analyst Intern in this Business Performance team you will provide a data-driven approach to understand the business.




This role involves working with a considerable amount of complex data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of innovative ways to analyse data and create a comprehensive story.




Missions




Provide analytical insights on changes of market environment and competition.
Size business growth opportunities/threats. Translate findings into actionable insights for multiple levels of stakeholders.
Based on external and internal data, understand client’s behaviours, qualify potential of clients and prospects on new and existing business.




Academic Background / Skills / Experience




Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Business School).
Strong intellectual curiosity and analytics skills. Ability to structure and solve difficult problems.
Experienced in Python and SQL. Knowledge of Tableau is a plus.
A good grasp of statistical modelling.
Very good communication skills.
Fluency in English.
Proactivity and commitment.




At Criteo, we believe the future is wide open when it includes everyone. We are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed. We want you to come as you are so we can succeed together.




We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!




Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Title: Data Analyst - Operations
Description:
Description:

📍Location: Barcelona, Spain

🌍 International environment

💰Competitive salary and perks




The revolution starts with small things: driving EVs, taking profit from renewable energy sources to avoid fuel... At Wallbox we work to make the world greener!

Why join Wallbox?

We create smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger. We work with electric cars, build smart chargers, use solar panels and inverters and integrate everything into solutions for users around the world. Founded in 2015 as a Barcelona based start up, we have since grown to over 1000 Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities with a presence in Europe, Asia and the Americas!

From a top Spanish start-up to the first Spanish company to be listed on the NYSE, we are growing rapidly and we want you on board!




Our Data Journey:

Wallbox is committed to become a data driven company, not only for improving our decision making processes but also for helping us drive better our product development and incorporate data into our existing products or even create new business models.

We started our data journey just one year ago and it has already been an amazing drive! We’ve built a passionate and vibrant team, organised in a hub & spoke model, with roles such as data analysts, data engineers and analytics engineers.

Also we’ve been building a modern data stack, with technologies like Snowflake, Airflow, Fivetran, DBT, Tableau and Databricks. Our long term vision is to walk towards a data mesh model, where we will split people into producers and consumers domains.

Today our data lake is ingesting more than 1M events per hour coming from more than 350 sensors in our chargers. And this is just the beginning, as our goal is to reach one million online chargers by 2025.




What will you be doing?

Work as a Data analyst for our Operations team which is responsible for production planning, continuous improvement, material management and process optimization at Wallbox
Engage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analytical tasks
Enable data driven process improvements through analysis of sales, production, logistics and external data
Extract, load and reconcile large data sets from multiple system platforms and sources.
Utilise SQL or other advanced analytic tools to perform data extract and query functions.
Build post-measure dashboards that will serve as a monitoring tool for diverse stakeholders and assess the impact of new process improvements
Work with Data Engineers to identify and add new datasets to the data platform. Collaborate with them for roadmap definition.
Be a steward of data quality, ensuring that metrics and KPIs are consistently reported across the catalogue of dashboards and data products
Have a key role in building data culture within the company
Define the direction, structure, processes, and standards for Data across the company (e.g. experimentation framework)
Drive a culture of data-informed decision making as we scale.




Must have:

Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical background
2+ years experience in working in a data driven analytics environment including an understanding of how to engage and influence decision makers
Exceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking and experience in solving highly challenging problems
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R)
Very good knowledge of SQL and experience in working with large data sets
Fluent in business English




Nice to have:

Experience in working with Data Visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview)
Experience in Manufacturing, Operations,Energy, Mobility or Automotive industry will be good to have
Experience in working with predictive models




Benefits:

Half-day Fridays!
Hybrid policy: 2 days of remote work
First-class private health insurance after your first month at Wallbox
Online group training sessions twice a week
Free online language classes (Spanish & English) twice a week
Flexible compensation valid for restaurants & food delivery apps, transportation,
childcare, and learning & development.
Hundreds of discounts on different brands & services with our Wallbox Circle benefits
platform
Car discounts & special advantages if you choose an EV!
Learn and grow in a company of over 45 nationalities and counting!
Show more Show less

Title: Business Intelligence / Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Definition




Defining requirements and concepts for complex data analyses
Assuming responsibility for the planning, conception and realization of business intelligence projects
Setting-up and further developing of various evaluations, analyses and reports (standard reporting, unit reporting, ad-hoc reporting)
Supporting the preparation, cleansing and modeling of data for decision-making purposes
Continuously improving of the methods and technologies used, e.g. further development of existing dashboards to increase the degree of automation and efficiency




Job Qualification




Successfully completed studies in the field of IT or economics with a specialization in statistics or or completion of comparable training
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a similar field
Sound programming skills in R / Python as well as with SAS / SQL and confident handling of BI solutions, e.g. MS-Power-BI
Business fluent English, German or Dutch language skills are a plus
